loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Meuangluang Group

texts.en:
Chanthee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  

These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Chanthee and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

Chanthee and her group are excited that the TerraClear water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within these 2 years the filter users, like Chanthee’s family, will be able to identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 50-year-old married mother who lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has two children and both of them are workers who make copper decorative objects. Sokha does washing from house to house for payment. Her husband is 55 years old and he is a luggage mover at a market. They can make approximately USD 17 per day. 

Sokha's present house is too small and old for the family to livening, so she has decided to apply for a loan to buy lumber to build a new house. This loan will provide her and her family with good living conditions. 

For her plan for the future, she wants her children to use their skills to run their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a new house.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim (pictured here) is 46 years. She lives at Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1988, has two sons and two daughters. One of her children is married, one is hairdresser, the others are still young.

Lim has been a cook and a weaver for a private company for eleven years, while her husband has been a cleaner for seven years. 

She would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her child take to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her child take to school

loans.name: Al Rabih Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a member of Al Rabih Group, which consists of four hardworking women. They decided to join together and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to develop their businesses and improve their families' standard of living at the same time.

Mariam is the featured borrower of the group. She is a 34-year-old married mother of two children who works hard to support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs, especially educational expenses.

She has been employed at a company for seven years with a limited salary, barely enough combined with her husband's monthly income to cover their increasing living needs. That's why Mariam is acquiring the current loan from Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school tuition fees and make sure that they can benefit from a brighter future.

Mariam is the first lady at the far right side of the picture with the blue top.

As for the other group members, both Najwa (24 years old and single, second from the left, wearing pink) and Adibeh (25-year-old married mother of one baby, first from the left) work in the business of selling beauty cosmetics and perfumes, and their acquired loan will be invested in buying special Valentine's day offers. Yasmine (23-year-old, single, the second from the right) works as a reporter. Her acquired loan will be used to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Patricia Irene

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hija de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de limpieza.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, comunicativa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la ciudad como ‘Tilata’, ‘La Florida’, ‘3 Estrellas’ y otras, todas caracterizadas por el comercio desordenado, vendedores ambulantes se asientan en las calles otros ambulan por el lugar, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Patricia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas domiciliario. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de limpieza como; escobas, trapeadores, detergentes, ambientadores, desinfectantes, estropajos, cepillos, etc. “me inicie en el negocio ayudando a mi mamá que realiza el mismo negocio ahora soy independiente y me organizo sola…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia de artículos de limpieza, ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería de temporada para abastecer a sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Patricia solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos de limpieza de temporada para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 38 year old woman who is married and has a 16 year old daughter. Her business is selling cleaning products. She is independent, enterprising, communicative, responsible and hard-working.

She does her business itinerantly in the various markets of the city such as 'Tilata’, ‘La Florida’, ‘3 Estrellas’ and others. All are characterized by their disorder, itinerant vendors that sit on the street and others that wander around. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies from 2 to 12 degrees Celsius.

Patricia is dark skinned with long braided black hair and short in stature. Her native language is Aymara which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish because of the main culture and for her business. She shares her life with her husband who works in commerce and her son who studies at school. They live in their own house built of bricks with a metal roof that has running water, electricity, sewage and cooking gas.

Her business is selling cleaning products like brooms, cloths, detergents, air fresheners, disinfectant, scouring pads, brushes, etc. "I started the business with the help of my mother who did the same business and now I am independent, I organize for myself", she comments. Her dream is to have her own store selling cleaning products.

She wants to buy seasonal cleaning products to supply her clients. This is her second loan with the institution in the 8 years that she has had her business. For these reasons Patricia is requesting a loan to purchase seasonal cleaning products to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for the season to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: seeds and plastic sheets.

loans.name: Grupo M (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Elvira lleva viendo toda su vida en su comunidad donde la mayor parte de la población se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Ella antes solo se dedicaba solo a su hogar pero sus hijos han crecido y los gastos han aumentado por ello hace tres años decidió iniciar con la cría y engorda de cerdos.

“Desde que me casé yo veía a mi suegro dedicar su tiempo a los cerdos y obtener buenas ganancias” y fue como decidió comprar una pequeña cerdita que más tarde tuvo lechones, resultando en una excelente inversión. Actualmente, Elvira trabaja en la ciudad de México como empleada doméstica mientras su suegro le ayuda en el cuidado de los animales entre semana. Actualmente tiene nueve animales y con su préstamo quiere comprar 4 cerdos más y un poco de alimento. “El precio del alimento es elevado pero es muy necesario para el buen crecimiento de los cerdos cuando son pequeños”. 

Elvira y su esposo trabajan para comprar alimento y maíz para sus cerdos, para poder pagar a tiempo sin ningún problema el préstamo que tienen con VisionFund. "Estoy muy agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque ahora puedo comprar algunas cosas como alimentos y ropa con mayor facilidad".
texts.en:
Elvia has lived her entire life in her community where most of the people work in livestock and agriculture. Previously her only work was taking care of her home, but now that her children are older the expenses have increased. So three years ago she decided to start raising and fattening pigs. "Since I got married I saw my father-in-law working at raising pigs and making good money" and that was how she decided to buy a little pig which later had piglets - it turned out to be a good investment. 

Elvia currently works in Mexico City as a housekeeper while her father-in-law helps her take care of the animals during the week. She has nine animals at this time, and wants to buy four more and some feed with the loan proceeds. "The cost of feed is very high but it is essential for the growth of the pigs when they are small." Elvira and her husband work to buy feed and corn for their pigs and to be able to make their payments on the loan they have with VisionFund on time. "I am very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because now I can buy a few things such a food and clothing more easily."

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Luz Ofelia

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso, el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete. Aquí  cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Jacinto.
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2  hijos de 8 y 4 años que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es chofer de un taxi, viven en casa propia.
Doña Luz con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo en un pequeño local, sus clientas de años tienen crédito y pagan en cuotas mensuales. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30   hasta las 18h30. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace un año y le gusta por la rapidez y la facilidad de pocos documentos  y les da oportunidad a mujeres emprendedoras. Sus sueños es tener un gran almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Our canton was named for the Virgen del Carmen.  The area's rich flora and fauna are a major source of income for local people and the canton is known for Barraganete plantains.  The San Jacinto community bank meets here twice a month.  Our member, Sra. Luz, 38, is married and has 2 children, 8- and 4-years old, both in school.  Her husband has a taxi business.  The family own the house where they live.
Doña Luz started a clothing sales business because she wanted an income of her own and a means of generating an extra income for her family.  She extends credit to her regular customers and they pay her monthly for what they buy.  She works from 8:30am to 6:30pm.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, once or sometimes twice a month.  She has operated the business for seven years and says that it is successful.  Doña Luz will use this loan to stock her business with the merchandise she sells: pants, blouses, children's clothing, etc.  She has been a group member for a year and likes Fundacion because it processes loans quickly and without a lot of paperwork.  She also values the opportunity it provides to women entrepreneurs.
For the future, she hopes to have a clothing store of her own.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso, el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete. Aquí  cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Jacinto.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años. El marido es agricultor, viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo para mujeres, hombres y niños. Trabaja tres horas diarias de lunes a sábado, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son zapatos de mujer ya que son muy buenos y  las personas son puntuales en sus pagos.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos que están de promoción en los catálogos y ropa para incrementar la venta. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que viven con los papas.
texts.en:
Our canton was named for the Virgen del Carmen.  The area's rich flora and fauna are a major source of income for local people and the canton is known for Barraganete plantains.  The San Jacinto community bank meets here twice a month.  Our member, Sra. María, 24, is married and has 2 children, 5- and 2-years old.  Her husband is a farmer and they live with his parents.
Doña María started her retail business to have an income of her own and to help her husband with the family's expenses.  She buys shoes from catalogues and resells them to her customers.  She works three hours a day, Mondays to Saturdays.  She leaves orders with her customers and collects from them every eight days.  She has operated the business for three years and says that it is successful.  
Doña María wants to grow her business and will use this loan to buy both clothes and shoes.  She has been with the group for three rounds of funding and likes Fundacion because it processes loans quickly and without a lot of paperwork.  
For the future, she wants to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Angie Bella

texts.es:
Al cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí”, por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo, por su rica y variada gastronomía y sus paisajes hermosos llenos de vegetación. Aquí se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Antonio.
En este lugar vive la señora, Angie tiene 23  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 3 y  1 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la pequeña empresa familiar, viven en casa propia.
Doña Angie se dedica a la venta de aluminio y vidrio vende ventanas de aluminio y todo tipo de trabajo como (ventanas, puertas para baños, vitrinas, entre otros) lleva seis años en esta actividad junto a su esposo. 
El crédito solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR es para comprar aluminio y vidrio para incrementar su negocio y cumplir con los contratos ya adquiridos. Lo que le gusta es la facilidad de adquirir los créditos, y que los requisitos son fáciles y rápidos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen is known as 'the golden door of Manabí' for its production of green plantains which are unique to the country and exported around the world, for its rich and varied gastronomy and for its beautiful landscapes full of vegetation. It is here that the Crédito San Antonio group meets each fortnight.

This is also where Angie lives. Angie is 23 years old, married and has two children from this relationship who are three and one. Her husband works in a small family business and they live in their own home.

Angie sells metal and glass. She sells metal windows of every type (windows, bathroom doors, glass cabinets, and others) and has been doing this job for six years together with her husband.

The loan that Angie is applying for from Fundación Espoir will be used to buy metal and glass to expand her business and fulfill the contracts that have already been signed. What she likes most is the ease with which she can acquire the loans and the quick and easy requirements. Angie's dream is to own a big store.

loans.use: to buy metal and glass

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liezl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling gasoline. Liezl is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

Liezl has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Gresel

texts.en:
Gresel is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gresel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gresel requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gresel has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Gresel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old. She is a married woman with six children, four of whom are currently in school. Imelda is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joveniana

texts.en:
Joveniana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and root-crops vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Joveniana has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and root-crops to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and root-crops to sell.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Lanie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Lanie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Justina has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. 

Justina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Justina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Justina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines. Larina requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like thread, needles, fabric, etc. for her business. Larina has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Larina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like thread, needles, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and vegetables to resell, so she can earn more money.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 43-year-old mixed farmer whose main source of income is milk. She decided to concentrate her efforts in dairy farming since she comes from Chuka, where milk is in increasingly high demand due to an upsurge in the population. Margaret is seeking a loan to purchase a cow. 

Margaret has been passionately interested in dairy farming since she was a young girl. She actualized her dream at age 24 when she started her dairy farm. The business has seen various successes and challenges alike, but has remained full of promise. Margaret aspires to grow her business to the next level and she needs your loan to do so. The income from the expansion will enable her to repay the loan, settle the ever-increasing farming expenses and take better care of her three children. A loan will surely improve Margaret's livelihood as help can be very significant for the people in the countryside like Margaret, who works up to 12 hours a day to obtain the resources consumed in a home.

loans.use: to pay for a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Pov is a married 44-year-old mother with one dependent school child.

To survive for a living, cassava farming , pig raising, and a grocery selling business are the main sources of income for her family which earns her a decent income.

Pov has been a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner for 5 cycles before, and now it is her sixth loan. 

She is applying for 1,500,000 KHR loan in order to support her business, to buy more grocery items for resale, and to buy pig feed. 

She hopes that she can earn triple the income than before, so that she can buy additional plot of farmland to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale and to buy pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Ildirim

texts.en:
İldirim lives with his wife and son. They live in Füzuli region. For 22 years they have been IDPs (internally displaced people) from Füzuli city. İldırım has been engaged in a business breeding sheep at their homestead for many years. İldırım prepares dairy products (milk, cheese and yogurt) and he sells these products in the local bazaar to earn money. Also, he periodically sells sheep wool. This is Ildirim's second loan. He repaid his first loan on time.
 
Now İldırım needs 1300 AZN and has applied to Komak for a loan. With this loan he wants to repair his sheep's stalls. He is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help.

loans.use: to repair sheep's stalls

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 11 años y una hija mujer de 8 años, y su negocio es el comercio de electrodómesticos línea blanca.
Ella es emprendedora, trabajadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘senkata’, es un barrio a 30 minutos del centro donde varias veces los vecinos quemaron a ladrones, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-10 grados centígrados.
Elena es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla mayormente en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza.  Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas domiciliario, su pareja la abandonó hace 8 años y desde ese momento ella se hace cargo de sus hijos sola. Su actividad principal es la venta de artículos de línea blanca como; refrigeradores, cocinas eléctricas y a gas, lavarropas y otros. “vendo toda clases de electrodomésticos, los traigo desde chile donde tengo un pariente que me ayuda…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de línea blanca en su propio domicilio. Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para importar mayores cantidades de electrodomésticos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para aumentar su capital para la compra de electrodomésticos y con su negocio ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a 43-year-old woman, is single, and has an 11-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Her business is selling household appliances.

She is enterprising, hard-working, persevering, and responsible. Her business is located in the “Senkata” area, which is a neighborhood 30 minutes from the city center, where many times neighbors burn things because of the cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies between 0 and 10 degrees Celsius during the day.

Elena has brown skin, long black hair that is braided, and a short stature, and she dresses in a traditional way (hat, blanket, and full skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará, which is the most common language in the area, and she speaks Spanish general knowledge and for her business. 

She shares her life with her children, who are studying in school. They live in their own house, which is built from bricks with a corrugated iron roof; the house has drinkable water, electricity, indoor plumbing, and gas. Her partner left her 8 years ago, and from that time, she has cared for her children by herself. 

Her main work is selling household appliances, including refrigerators, electrical and gas stoves, washing machines, and other things. She says that she sells all types of household appliances; she brings them from Chile, where she has a relative who helps her. 

Her dream is to have a store for household appliances in her own home. She wants to increase her capital for work so that she can import more household appliances. This is the first in a sequence of loan over four years that will allow her to continue with her work.

It is for these reasons that Elena requests a loan to increase her capital so that she can buy household appliances and, with her business, to help her children.

loans.use: to increase her capital so that she can buy household appliances and, with her business, to help her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a sari-sari (general retail) store owner from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has been in the business for several years now. This is her source of income. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Martina is asking to take a loan to buy more goods for resale, such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, among others. In the future, Martina has hope of expanding her store in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale, such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, among others.

loans.name: Tatiana Lilibeth

texts.es:
Al cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí”, por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo, por su rica y variada gastronomía y sus paisajes hermosos llenos de vegetación. Aquí se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Antonio.
En este lugar vive la señora Tatiana, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de cinco años el cual  estudia en escuela, su esposo trabaja con aluminio y vidrio.
Doña Tatiana trabaja en un centro de desarrollo de la niñez de 8h00 a 14h00 de lunes a sábado,  realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido el cual tienen un taller de cerrajería en su casa donde elabora puertas, ventanas y muchos otros trabajos con estos materiales, sus otras las realiza por contratos con personas particulares que saben del buen trabajo que realiza su marido razón por lo cual no le falta el trabajo, ella también por su parte con este crédito espera empezar a vender ropa de todo tipo y así colaborar con los gastos que genera el hogar ya que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que gana.
Este crédito es para compra vidrio, aluminio, cortadores y  ropa para empezar su negocio.  Su sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen is known as 'the golden door of Manabí' for its production of green plantains unique to the country and exported around the world, for its rich and varied gastronomy and for its beautiful landscapes full of vegetation. It is here that the Crédito San Antonio group meets each fortnight.

This is also where Tatiana lives. She is 28 years old, married and has a five year old son from this relationship who goes to school. Her husband works with metal and glass.

Tatiana works in a childcare centre from 8am until 2pm from Monday to Saturday. She is applying for a loan to help her husband who has a locksmith workshop in their home. He makes doors, windows and other items with these materials, depending on the contracts he receives from private individuals who have heard of the good job he does, which is why he is never out of work. For her part Tatiana hopes to begin selling all types of clothing so she can contribute to the household costs as her husband's earnings are not enough to cover everything. 

This loan will be used to buy glass, metal, glass cutters and clothing so Tatiana can begin her business. Her dream is to give her son the best she can.

loans.use: to buy glass, metal, glass cutters and clothing

loans.name: Longena

texts.en:
Longena is a 53-year-old widow and a mother of two grown children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for than ten years now. Fishing is a very lucrative business in her area. 

Longena is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. A loan will be a great help to her in improving her fishing business, thus increasing her income. In the future, Longena hopes to make her fishing business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a resident of Talibon, Bohol. She is 23 years old and is engaged in a fishing business. Fishing is one of the sources of income in her area.

Merlyn is asking to take a loan to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat, such as plywood, nails, bamboo, epoxy adhesives and other materials. 

With this loan, she will be able to improve her fishing business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat, such as plywood, nails, bamboo, epoxy and adhesives.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Esmeralda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items and ingredients for her business.

Esmeralda has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47, married, and has four children, one of which is currently in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Marilou has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Marilou requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 41, married, and has four children, three of which are currently in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

Merlyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merlyn has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a smallholder farmer practicing mixed farming on a two-acre farm. His home and farmstead are located in the Chuka area of Kenya. 

On the farm, he has a home where his family stays. His wife, 26 years old, has blessed him with lovely children that he takes care of by selling milk, bananas, tea, and other crops. Wesley has also invested in other side-businesses that give him additional income from time to time. He has been doing farming for over 20 years. He always strives to increase his business and become more financially independent and stable. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. One more cow on the farm will make a difference in Wesley's livelihood. For one thing, it will provide him with additional income that will enable him to afford his children's education. 

Wesley told our loan officer that the impact of the loan on his family is that it will bring an increase in financial security to his family. 

Help out a Kenyan farmer with an enterprising mind!

loans.use: to purchase a diary cow

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has been in the business of selling produce since 2008, and does cattle farming and saloon businesses, where he earns additional income. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda and is married with five children. He is hard working and desires to educate all his children, even though he is faced with price fluctuations, hindering his profits. 

William is asking for a loan to buy maize and ground nuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Sugr-Nooma Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Mr BANGRE est la représentante du groupe SUGR-NOOMA KOANGA. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. 01 va à l’école. Il a 05 personnes en charge. 
Mr fait l'élevage depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant. 
Elle veut s’acheter 40poules.
Mr compte utiliser ces bénéfices pour agrandir son élevage. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Mr. BANGRE is the representative of the group SUGR-NOOMA KOANGA. A married man, he is the father of two children. The oldest is 6 years old, and the youngest is 6 months old. One goes to school. Mr. BANGRE has five persons to support. He has been raising livestock for five years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. He wants to purchase 40 hens. He wants to use these profits to expand his livestock farming. His ambition is to be a major livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy 40 hens

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim is a resident of Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is now 44 years old and a mother and wife. She has 5 children, but only 2 that are still her dependents. Her main source of income is from rice farming, but in addition to that, she is sometimes hired to help harvest rice for the people in the village to earn extra income. She can earn 16,500 KHR per day.

This is the fifth time for  Yim with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Now she is a leader in her group of three and they are applying for a new loan in the amount of 5,500,000 KHR, in which her loan amount will be 2,000,000 KHR.

The four loans she received before allowed her to provide better nourishment for her children and to be able to send them to school. 

For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer. Moreover, she will also use a portion of her loan to buy soy bean seeds for growing in order to earn additional income.

This will help enhance her family's financial situation significantly.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for having PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an amount of Yemeni traditional clothes to resell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for haivng PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem belongs to a poor family. She lives with her husband and 4 children in the Lahore, Pakistan.

Tasleem's husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories for residential doors and windows. He provides door-to-door service welding these broken accessories. Recently, however, his welding power source malfunctioned due to overheating, and now it needs to be replaced. 

He wishes to purchase a new welding power source and cutting machine, but he does not have the funds due to many household expenses. Therefore, Tasleem has requested a loan from Kiva's active field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy the welding and cutting equipment.

Tasleem thanks Kiva's lenders and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment and a cutting machine for her husband's iron accessories business.

loans.name: Nongvaeng Group

texts.en:
Xieng and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  

Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

Xieng and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease, and after totaling up the costs, Xieng and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Xieng and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  

Xieng is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Alisson Kassandra

texts.es:
Al cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí”, por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo, por su rica y variada gastronomía y sus paisajes hermosos llenos de vegetación. Aquí se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Antonio.
En este lugar vive la señora Alisson, tiene 22  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de 2 años. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Alisson es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, de 9h00 a 17h00 ocho horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tresaños que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa que le están solicitando sus clientas. Esta en este bankito desde hace dos años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles, la organización y el trabajo en equipo. Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que viven en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen is called “La Puerta de Oro de Manabo” because of its production of green bananas, which is unique in the country and is exported all over the world. The area has a rich and diverse cuisine, and its beautiful paths are full of vegetation. Here, the San Antonio loan group meets every fifteen days. 

Alisson lives in this place, and she is 22 years old, is married, and has a 2-year-old son. Her husband is a farmer.

Alisson is a housewife, who—in order to have her own resources and to help her husband with the household expenses—sells clothing by catalog and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works three days a week, from 9:00am to 5:00pm, which is eight hour a day. She sells her products on credit and collects from her customers every eight days. She has been doing this activity for three years, and it is going very well. Her best-selling products are the perfumes and cosmetics because they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing that her clients are requesting. She has been with this bank for two years, and she likes it because the payments are easy, for the organization, and for the teamwork. 

Her dream is to have her own house since her family currently lives in her in-laws’ house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie, 32, a resident of Taguig, Philippines and  married to Adriano, a food vendor. She and her husband manage their household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Melanie sells a variety of accessories, footwear and other merchandise. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also operates a food stall and earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Melanie is requesting a Php 9,000 loan to buy items ordered by her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her enterprise.

Melanie hopes that she will gain more customers and prays that her family is always healthy and strong. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the continuous maintenance of her tricycle. It is important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and a steady income. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her high school child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial aid that will be extended to her.

Aida dreams of buying another tricycle unit to grow her business. She aims for her child to get a college degree to allow her better opportunities in life and prays for good health and protection for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle motorcycle.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 57 years old, married, and has one child who is currently in school. Nora works very hard to provide for her family.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nora has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 58 years old, married, and has one child currently in school.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, diapers, spices, noodles, and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Norma aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, diapers, spices, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Nighat Bibi

texts.en:
Nighat Bibi is a 45-year-old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a fruit seller by profession He sells fruits such as apples, bananas, and grapes. He is the sole provider for the family and responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Nighat Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit, so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit, but due to an unfavorable financial position he is not in any condition to purchase fruit for his business.  Therefore, Nighat Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for her husband's business

loans.name: Phean's Group

texts.en:
Phean, 34, is a married mother blessed with two kids. She lives with her family in Tbaung Khmum village in Kampong Cham province. One of her children is under the age of 6, and her other child is in secondary school. She has been doing rice farming on her 1 hectare land for 15 years and when she is free from farming. is also a paid worker. By doing the two jobs, she can earn 30,000KHR a day, and is able to save to 6,100KHR as well.

Phean is not new to VisionFund. She has been a member for three cycles and has fully paid back the loans she borrowed before. Phean, along with the other four members of her group, is seeking another loan with total amount of 7,000,000KHR. She is applying for 2,000,000KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. She hopes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and maize seeds for selling and beans for planting.

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Свете 53 года, она вдова, мать 3 детей. У Светы - среднее образование, она работает в детском саду в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1999 году с покупки скота на 3,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день у Светы есть: 2 коровы, 1 бычок и 15 овец. Также Света ежедневно реализует молоко и молочную продукцию. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Света в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого домашнего молока, что позволит ей улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Sveta is a 53 years old, a widow and a mother of 3 children. Sveta has a secondary education and works at a kindergarten. To provide additional income for her family, she is involved is animal husbandry, having started this business in 1999 with a purchase of livestock with 3,000 som (KGS). Today Sveta has 2 cows, 1 bull and 15 sheep. Sveta also sells milk and dairy products daily. Her combined monthly income amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS). Because this money is not enough for a decent life, Sveta, to further develop her business, requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the sales volume of ecologically clean, home milk, which will help her improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the sales volume of ecologically clean, home milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, fertilizer, and manure.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 59 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos de 29, 24 y 20 años, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, autónomo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de ‘Palcoco’ que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; camélido, vacuno, ovino y porcino, se vive de la pesca y también de tubérculos, vegetales y cereales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie terrestre. 
Roberto es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, usa chullu y sombrero, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de vertiente. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado; él realiza la compra de ganado vacuno, lo alimenta, se ocupa de ponerle las vacunas necesarias, y una vez gordo y grande lo vende. También realiza la venta de leche, sus clientes son productores queseros del lugar. “estamos acostumbrados al clima árido del lugar, debemos preocuparnos por la comida del ganado…’ comenta. Su sueño es contar con muchas cabezas ganado. Él desea realizar la compra de un terreno de tierras para plantar forraje para ganado, porque en la época actual, debido a las lluvias hacen que el pasto crezca sin problemas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 22 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roberto solicita un préstamo para la compra de tierras para plantar forraje y alimentar a su ganado.
texts.en:
Roberto is 59 years old, is married, has three children—aged 29, 24, and 20—and sells cattle for a living. He is enterprising, independent, self-employed, responsible, and hard-working. 

He runs his business in the community of "Palcoco," which is located near Lake Titicaca. It is an agricultural area where people raise cattle, camelids, sheep, and pigs. People also make a living fishing and growing tubers, vegetables, and indigenous cereals such as quinoa, "chuño" (freeze-dried potatoes), broad beans, potatoes, and the like. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies between 1 and 12°C during the day, and the sun's rays beat down hard on the ground.

Roberto has a tanned complexion, is short, and has black short hair. He wears a "chullo" (woolen cap with earflaps) and a hat. His mother tongue is Aymará—which is spoken in the area—and he speaks Spanish for general knowledge and business purposes. He shares his life with his wife, who works in agriculture. They live in a house made of adobe. It has electricity and a corrugated iron roof, and its water supply comes from a spring. 

He runs a business selling cattle. He buys the cattle, feeds them, and takes care to give them the necessary vaccinations. Once they are fattened and large, he sells them. He also sells milk. His customers are cheese producers from the area. "We are used to the dry climate of the area; we must make sure that the cattle are fed," he says. His dream is to own many head of cattle.

He wants to purchase a plot of land to grow forage for his cattle because in the current season, the rains make it easier for the grass to grow. 

This is his second loan cycle with the institution in the 22 years that he has been running this business.

It is for these reasons that Roberto is requesting a loan to purchase a plot of land to grow forage and feed his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to grow forage and feed his cattle.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is single with three children, all of whom go to school; there are also additional family members. She owns her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

For the past six years Annet has operated a small restaurant from her home. She works seven days a week. Seasonality is a major business challenge.

Annet has applied for a 1,200,000 UGX loan through MCDT-SACCO to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, green bananas, rice and flour. She will use the loan to buy better serving utensils so as to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, green bananas, rice and flour for her restaurant.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda runs her retailing business in their village. She sells a variety of grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and breads. Imelda is 50 years of age, married and has three children. She is sending one of her children to school to study. Imelda is thankful because through her business, she gains profit that enables her to sustain her kid's allowances for school. Imelda wants to extend her business so that she would also get a higher income. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy drinks, eggs, and much more. Imelda anticipates having a higher income when she avails herself of the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, eggs, and much more.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns a small sari-sari or retail store in her place in Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has six children. Elizabeth has been in the business for more than 5 years now. Elizabeth sells food items like bread, canned goods, noodles among others. Elizabeth is requesting to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, bread and chips, soap and detergents, coffee, soft drinks and beverages, eggs, condiments and others. A loan will help Elizabeth improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Elizabeth dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Aside from selling grocery items, Jenny also sells rice grains in their village. She is 34 years old, married and has two grade school children. Jenny has managed her retailing business for almost eight years. She will be very happy if she runs the business continuously and has great earnings. Therefore, Jenny wants to get a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy bulk grocery items and sacks of rice to sell. She will prioritize her children's needs in school through her profits from the business. Jenny looks towards the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy bulk grocery items and sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Al cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí”, por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo, por su rica y variada gastronomía y sus paisajes hermosos llenos de vegetación. Aquí se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Antonio.
La señora Elena tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y de esta unión tiene tres hijos de 9, 10 y 11 años de edad, todos estudian en una escuela. Su marido trabaja en cerrajería.
Doña Elena con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y poder ayudarle a su esposo a salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y cosméticos y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También atiende el negocio del esposo cuando él tiene que salir, el tiene un pequeño local donde hace los trabajos de cerrajería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00  hasta las 17h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería  como perfumes, cremas, lápiz labiales, etc. y otra parte la compartirá con su esposo para invertir en (llaves, aluminio,  entre otras). Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace cuatro años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Canton of El Carmen is known as “La Puerta de Oro de Manabi” (the golden door) for its production of the "barraganete" banana, unique in the country and exported to the world, for its rich and diverse gastronomy and for the beautiful landscapes full of vegetation. The credit group San Antonio meets there every 15 days.

Elena is 29 years old, lives with her partner and from this relationship they have three children of 9, 10 and 11 years of age. They all attend school and her partner works as a locksmith. Elena, with the intention of making money herself and to be able to help her partner get ahead sells all types of clothing and cosmetics. She sells door to door. She also tends to her partner’s business when he is not there. He has a small locksmith shop were he works.  He works every day from 7:00 to 17:00. He offers credit to his clients and he gets paid every 15 days. He has been working on this trade for 7 years and it is going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as perfumes, creams, lipsticks, etc. and part of it she will share with her partner to invest (in keys, aluminum, among others). She has been in the credit group for four years and she likes it because the interest rates are low. Her dream is to see their children complete their education and become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, lipsticks, keys, aluminium, etc.

loans.name: Familia El Arca Group

texts.es:
Carlos es el representante del grupo Familia El Arca, es un hombre muy trabajador tiene 35 años de edad, está casado con Guadalupe y juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos.

Carlos se ha dedicado a su carpintería, oficio que aprendió gracias a su padre. “Es un oficio honrado y del cual estoy muy orgulloso porque de ahí obtengo ingresos para mantener a mi familia” comentó Carlos. Él lleva ya varios ciclos solicitando crédito a VisionFund para comprar herramientas y madera para poder entregar sus encargos a tiempo; con el nuevo préstamo esta vez comprará sólo materia prima. 

En su casa, Carlos tuvo que acondicionar una de sus habitaciones para poder trabajar y tener toda su herramienta, pasa todos los días en su taller de carpintería y comenta que siempre que tiene algún trabajo trata de entregarlo antes del tempo acordado para ser muy puntual. Puesrtas, muebles, mesas, camas y sillas son algunos de los muebles que más entrega.

Carlos y Guadalupe están muy agradecidos porque gracias a los préstamos su taller cada vez esta mejor equipado y con las ganancias obtenidas pudieron comprase un auto de segunda mano que les ayuda a trasladarse, además ahora pueden pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos sin ningún problema. Aunque el sueño de la pareja es establecer una carpintería formal en donde trabajar con mayor comodidad y tener más ingresos. 

Candelario, María Guadalupe y Herlinda también desempeñan la misma actividad e invertirán en madera y herramientas. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco del municipio, Carlos viste un suéter rojo*
texts.en:
Carlos is the representative of the “Familia El Acra” group. He is a very hard-working man, and he is 35 years old. He is married to Guadalupe, and together they have made a family with three children.

Carlos is dedicated to carpentry, a job he learned thanks to his father. Carlos says that is honorable work and that he is very proud because from this work he has earned income to take care of his family. He has already had many cycles requesting loans from VisionFund to buy iron and wood to be able to complete his orders on time. With this new loan, he will buy raw materials.

In his house, Carlos had to prepare one of his rooms to be able to work and to have all of his iron. He spends everyday in his carpentry workshop, and he says that he always has some work to do and tries to complete it before the agreed-upon time so that he will be very punctual. Doors, furniture, tables, beds, and chairs are some of the pieces of furniture that are most requested.

Carlos and Guadalupe are very thankful because thanks to the loans, his workshop is better equipped over time, and with the earnings obtained, they have been able to buy a second-hand car that helps them travel. Additionally, they can now pay the school fees for their children without any problems. The couple’s dream is to establish a formal carpentry workshop, where they will be able to work more comfortably and have more income.

Candelario, Maria Guadalupe, and Herlinda also perform the same work, and they will invest in wood and iron.

* The photograph was taken on the stairs under the municipal pavilion. Carlos is in the red sweater.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michelle is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Michelle has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

Michelle has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Ann, a very hardworking and honest mother who decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by starting dairy farming in Thika, Kenya. Deciding what kind of farming she would do was not difficult. “I was brought up with dairy cows raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Ann said. “It is in my blood.” She passionately loves dairy farming and has been practicing it for the past 15 years. She has never regretted starting to farm.

Her primary sources of income is milk, eggs, and crop farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her take care of her family and she has always yearned to produce more dairy milk. The major challenge she faces is feeding her cows.

She is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device for cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed the cattle. Through the loan her cows will be aided in digestion and they will never reject any part of the food. Ann strongly believes that through proper feeding of the cows she will reap more and it will lead to increased milk production which will translate into more sales and a better income. Through this loan, Ann’s life is going to change permanently. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cows, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards. Wonderful lenders you can be a participant in the evolution of this enterprising mother, by lending her capital, so that she can increase her milk production.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Christine is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Christine has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock like pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell to her customers.

Christine has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zyinat

texts.ru: Зыйнат, 52 года, вдова, есть сын, он взрослый, у него уже есть своя семья, которая живет вместе с Зыйнат. Все члены семьи активно помогают по хозяйству. У Зыйнат среднее образование, на протяжении 22 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки одной нетели. Благодаря упорному труду, Зыйнат смогла развить и расширить свою деятельность до 2 коров, 7 овец, также она арендует 0,5 Га земли, где выращивает ячмень для реализации. Для содержания скота есть все условия. Прибыль Зыйнат составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Зыйнат и ее семьи, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зыйнат обратилась в Банк "Бай –Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма. Доходы от кредита позволят Зыйнат расширить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и построить большие и просторные сараи для скота.
texts.en: Zyinat is 52 years old, a widow and has an adult son, who already has his own family, living together with Zyinat. All of the family members actively help with the household. Zyinat has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for 22 years, having started this business with a purchase of one heifer. Thanks to Zyinat's hard work, she was able to develop and expand her business to have 2 cow, 7 sheep and also 0.5 hectares of leased land, where she grows barley for sale. She has all of the conditions for keeping livestock. Zyinat's profit amounts to 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Because this money is catastrophically not enough for a decent life for Zyinat and her family, Zyinat, to further develop her business, requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow for fattening up. The earnings from the loan will allow Zyinat to expand her business, improve her family's welfare and build large and spacious barns for livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening up in order to grow her earnings

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with his family. He continues to work even though he's retired. He is a hardworking and responsible father who takes care of his wife who is disabled. For a few years he has had difficulty locating objects from far distance. He had to change glasses constantly which is now affecting him in his job. He couldn't have his surgery and treatment done in the past due to economic reasons. He is using this loan to pay for his eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza is 54 years old. She lives alone in Tsalenjikha. Roza is involved in agricultural activities. She grows nut trees on the family-owned land and sells the harvest locally. In addition, she has a cow and a calf. Roza decided to generate a stable income and requested a credit. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase home products such as sugar, salt, cereals and so on. She plans to resell these products from home and generate more income. With increased income she will be able to expand the business gradually and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to start trading home products such as sugar, salt, cereals and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with her husband and one daughter. She continues to work even though she's retired. She works only two days in a week as a nurse. She takes care of her husband since he is retired and has some health problems. Her husband has developed vision problems, and she decided to take him to get a vision exam. While in the eye exam, they found out he had an eye retina problem and an emergency procedure had to be performed. She is using this loan to help her husband to pay for his eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Adishirin

texts.en: Adishirin is 35 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Adishirinis lives in Füzuli region with his family, but the family members are IDP (internally displaced persons) from native land Füzuli city over 22 years. He has been in the animal breeding business for nine years.  He buys little calves, fattening them to sell. A while ago Adishirin had applied to Komak company for a loan of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy calves and increase his business. He is thankful to Kiva and the lenders. In future Adishirin wants to get married and have a big family.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years. Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aimie

texts.en:
Aimie is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Aimie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aimie has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aimie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Mildred aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a printing and scanning service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice.  Corazon is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials like ink, bond paper and other materials for her business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like ink, bond paper and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 35 years old and married with two children. With her children currently in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, noodles, candies, vinegar, sugar, juice, soft-drinks, beers, etc. 

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kharina May

texts.en:
Kharina May is 37 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, biscuits, cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Kharina May has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, biscuits, cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, etc.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is a 52-year-old married man from Kutaisi. He lives with his wife and son. Iuri works physically and gets a small daily income. 

There is a high unemployment rate in the region, but self-employment helps people to generate income. Iuri decided to work more and increase his income, but he needs equipment for that. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 600 GEL and purchase working materials, which will help him to do more work better and increase income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to do more work and generate income

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum, Kampong Cham province, 36 year-old Neat is married and a mother of four. All of her children are still secondary students, but one of them is currently living with their grandparents. Neat has been working hard for 16 years in cassava and rice plantation. Both plantations earn her 38,000KHR a day and she manages to keep 12,100KHR for saving. 

Neat has successfully become a member with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for two cycles, this is her third loan. Being a leader of her partnership with another woman, Neat is applying for 2,000,000KHR loan to help her cassava plantation. The previous loans were able to help her with the setup and the new loan is to help enhance the plantation. The money will be used on hire workers for harvesting and the transportation. With this, she is expected to get her family better housing, and to provide high education for her children.

loans.use: to hire workers for harvesting and transportation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 62 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Anecita has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income by raising pigs. She is working toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Наргиз 35 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Наргиз - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, начав свою деятельность в 2000 году, с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Наргиз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 2 теленка, 42 овцы и 15 лошадей. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Наргиз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Наргиз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Nargiz is 35 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business in 2000 with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nargiz's drive, persistence and hard work, today her farm contains 6 cows, 2 calves, 42 sheep and 15 horses. Her monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nargiz requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount. Nargiz plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Boldkhurel

texts.en: Mr. Boldkhurel is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He used a previous loan to buy a truck, and is now transporting goods between districts, generating more income for his family. Before this, he earned a living by providing taxi service to local people. His wife stays at home, looking after their youngest child. Their daughter studies at university while their son goes to high school. He is requesting a loan for $700 to buy a child's bed and drawer for an upcoming national festival. Everyone in Mongolia celebrates this event, the White Moon Festival, by buying something new to welcome the new year.

loans.use: to buy a children's bed and drawer.

loans.name: Rosa Melva

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso, el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete. Aquí  cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Jacinto.
En este lugar vive la señora, Rosa  tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 26, 24 y 17 años, el último hijo estudia en el Colegio. El marido es profesor, viven en casa propia.
Doña Rosa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días  de dos a tres horas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y cobra semanalmente,  esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos ya que tiene pedidos pendientes. Tiene seis años realizando créditos en el Grupo y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer y la facilidad que le brinda la fundación ya que los requisitos no son complicados. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
