Our canton was named for the Virgen del Carmen. The area's rich flora and fauna are a major source of income for local people and the canton is known for Barraganete plantains. The San Jacinto community bank meets here twice a month. Our member, Sra. Rosa, 47, is married and has 3 children, 26-, 24- and 17-years old, the youngest of whom is in high school.  Her husband is a teacher.  The family owns the house where they live.
Doña Rosa started her cosmetics sales business to have an income of her own.  She sells Avon, Esika and Yanbal beauty products.  She works door to door, two or three hours every day.  She collects from her customers once a week.  She has operated the business for three years and says that it is successful because she has a reliable customer base.  Among the products that she sells, cosmetics and perfumes are most in demand.
Doña Rosa will use this loan to buy the merchandise she needs--perfumes, creams and cosmetics--to fill orders from her customers.  She has been a group member for six years and likes Fundacíon because it processes loans quickly and without a lot of paperwork.
For the future, she wants to see her children finish school and find good, steady jobs.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Lena Narciza

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Lena, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es empleado público.
Doña Lena es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella trabaja de enfermera en el hospital general de la ciudad pero también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas),  la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su lugar de trabajo ya que sus compañeros son sus mejores clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  3 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños siempre han sido tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The members of the "16 de Julio" communal bank meet every fortnight in San Eduardo street on the road to Santa Ana in the city of Portoviejo. It has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since the colonial period.

Lena lives here. She is 47 years old, married but has not been able to have children. Her husband is a public employee. Lena is a woman who likes to work to help her husband to get ahead. She works as a nurse in the General hospital of her city but also is in business. She sells clothing of all kinds and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). most of her sales take place at her work as her fellow workers are her best clients. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this business where she makes her own money for 10 years.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewellery, cosmetics, creams and clothing of all types. She has been in the communal bank for 3 years and she likes it as the loans are quick. Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewellery, cosmetics, creams and clothing.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business. In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Latopat

texts.ru: Латопат, 49 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Латопат среднее образование. По характеру она очень трудолюбивая, жизнерадостная. Занимается животноводством, начав с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Латопат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы.На участке мерою 1,23 Га Латопат выращивает картофель и лук, в саду- вишню. Она покупает у местных жителей фрукты и овощи и перепродает их на рынке. Вся семья помогает в ведени и бизнеса. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Латопат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 1,000 долларов (USA) на покупку племенных овец, часть средств будет затрачена на приобретение корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Латопат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на постройку колодца с питьевой водой.
texts.en:
Latopat is 49 years old, married, and she has four children.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, she is very hardworking and she has a positive outlook on life.  She works in animal husbandry: she bought her first livestock with an initial amount of 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows on her farm, she also grows potatoes and onions on 1.23 hectare of land, and she gets cherries from her garden.  Additionally, she buys fruits and vegetables from the local residents, and she resells these produce at the market.  The whole family helps her to run the farming business.  She makes a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS).  

In order to further develop her activity, Latopat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of $1,000 (USD) which will be used to buy sheep for breeding as well as feed for her livestock.  Latopat is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.  She also wants to save money to build a well with drinking water.

loans.use: to purchase sheep (in order to increase her profits) and to build a well with drinking water.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Juliet, a very hardworking, energetic mother of six lovely children. She resides in the Chuka area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities. 

Juliet has been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years and through those years, she has gathered much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her children. 

Juliet is a very enterprising woman, and although she never got formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. 

The Chuka area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Juliet is very disciplined with finances, and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. All that Juliet waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en: Merla is 33 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Merla has been in her current line of work for 10 years and also earns additional income by selling food. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celsa has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 55 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Гулмиры высшее экономическое образование. У нее только положительные отзывы и репутация. С 1995 года Гулмира начала заниматься животноводческой деятельностью, стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS), Гулмира сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме до 25,000 сом (KGS). В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются: 5 коров, 20 овец. В целях расширения своего хозяйства Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), на полученные денежные средства она намерена купить скот для увеличения поголовья и корма для животных. Гулмира планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и хочет достойно вырастить своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 55, married, and has two children.  She has a university education in economics.  People hold her in high regard and say only positive things about her.  In 1995, Gulmira began raising livestock for a living starting with 20,000 som worth of capital.  Gulmira has managed to develop her business to the point where she earns up to 25,000 som in monthly income, and currently has 5 cows and 20 sheep on her farm.

To expand her business, Gulmira has requested a loan of 80,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank.  She plans on using the money from the loan to buy livestock to increase her headcount as well as buy fodder for her animals.  Gulmira plans on using the extra income from her business to develop her farm further in the future, and also wants to raise her children with a decent standard of living.

loans.use: buy additional livestock and feed to invest in her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Lydia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Gregoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is a 53-year-old married man, from Batumi city, west Georgia. He lives with his daughter and wife who works as a nurse, and generates 400 GEL monthly. At this moment this income is the only source of family's existence. According to this, the family finds it hard to satisfy even basic needs and cover all daily costs. In spite of his high education, Avtandil can't find any stable job and has decided to make his own source of income. 

He lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Avtandil to get a loan of 800 USD. He will renovate the house and rent it seasonally, as the city he lives in is full of tourists seasonally. The family will get the chance to get significant income even during the season, which will enable them to cover everyday costs, as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the Start Up program, Avtandil will get an opportunity to tackle the financial difficulties and make a better style of life with his family.

loans.use: to renovate the house and rent it seasonally.

loans.name: Quy's Group

texts.en: Mr. Quy, who was born in 1981, is an ethnic Thai. He currently lives with his wife and son in the Mai Son district of Son La province. His family’s main source of income is from farming, and the income he earns is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and pay for his son’s education fees. He has saved a small amount of money but it is not enough to build a sanitation project. He is requesting a loan to complete the project because it will help improve his family's living conditions. He is committed to work hard to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to build a sanitation work

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Unn is 61 years old and unmarried. She has no children, but she has two nieces to help out. She is living in Tbaung Khmum, Kampong Cham. Her main income is from her cassava planation, but she has also been rice farming for the last 40 years. She earns 38,600KHR a day, and her daily saving is 26,100KHR. 

Being a member of VisionFund four times before, Unn was able to have enough capital for her business, and find an appropriate home to live in. Now she is a leader of her group that contains 4 people. They are applying for 6,400,000KHR loan. Unn is using her portion to invest in her cassava business by hiring workers and transportation. Her goal is to expand her plantation and to improve the family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to invest in her cassava business by hiring workers and transportation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is an old client, married and with 3 children who are attending school. Festo drives a taxi as his major source of income. He has done this job for over 8 years. 

Festo took his first loan and bought a Toyota Ipsum that he has been using for his business. 

He applied for a loan of UGX.3,000,000 as a top up on a minibus for his business. He thanks Ugafode for the financial support which has enabled him to expand his income base and has enabled him to meet all his family financial obligations. 

He believes with continuous financial boosts his dreams will soon become reality. He is hardworking and resilient.

Pictured is Festo posing in front of his minibus.

loans.use: To buy a minibus.

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en:
A Tbaung Khmum resident, Yoeun is 57 years old and married.  She and her husband have 7 children, 4 of them are her dependents and 3 others have their own family. To support her family, she and her husband have been doing rice farming and raising pigs. Her family income is 99,700KHR with a saving of 65,000KRH each day.

Yoeun has already been familiar with VisionFund. She has been a member three times before. Now, she is a leader of her group that has 4 members. She is applying for 1,600,00KHR loan in order to buy piglets and pig feed. She is hoping that the new loan will help provide better living standard for her family, and that they can have better accommodation.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng, whose wife is a preschool teacher in their countryside, is 47 years old. His daughter works in Nanchong, while his son is still in college. Also he has to support his parents, who are over 70 years old and help him to feed his pigs.

Peng began to feed and sell pigs 8 years ago. The income from selling the pigs is used to support the big family and make a happy life. Because of the  bad economy, the business has not gone well in these last two years. He can just afford the necessities of living. 

A few months ago, on the way home, he and his wife fell down from their motorcycle. They were badly hurt. It cost almost all of their savings. 

Peng requested 15,000 CNY from MicroCred to buy pig feed. He hopes their lives become better and better in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Suqiong

texts.en:
Suqiong, a 56-year-old, was divorced in 1991. Since then, she has worked very hard to raise her daughter alone in Shenzhen. Now her daughter is married and has a 2-year–old daughter. 

She went back to Nanchong in 2004 and worked in a teahouse for a living. She is easygoing and kindhearted. In these years, she got acquainted with the neighbors. It helped her a lot. Last year, she opened her own teahouse. Her business is going very well.

With the coming Spring Festival, many people who worked outside came back. She needs to buy more snacks to meet them, so she has requested 5,000 CNY from MicroCred to stock snacks. She believes that she can sell them quickly and have a happy time.

loans.use: to stock more supplies for her teahouse.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bolor-Erdene, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2006. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, looking after their daughters. 

Using his previous loans, Bolor-Erdene has improved his family's living situation by moving into a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) and upgrading some components of his car. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy closets and drawers in order to further improve his living conditions. Every person in Mongolia celebrates the national festival "White Moon" by purchasing something new as a means of welcoming the New Year. So he wants to buy closets and drawers, two most needed pieces of furniture at his home. In the profile picture, the borrower is with his wife and two daughters, aged four and one.

loans.use: to buy drawers and closets in order to improve his family's living conditions

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de ganado de repasto, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con os gastos del hogar,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto y así seguir con la crianza y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner. He has made a living for 15 years in the rearing grazing cattle, selling his products in the surrounding towns. He has many customers because of his good prices and with his sales he is able to get ahead with the household expenses.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy grazing cattle and so continue with the rearing and have better income.

loans.use: to purchase grazing cattle.

loans.name: Rita Magdalena

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso, el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete. Aquí  cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Jacinto.
En este lugar vive la señora Rita,  tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de  4 y 2 años y un bebé de 4 meses,  el mayor estudia en jardín de infantes. El marido es mecánico de motos, viven con los padres de su marido.
Doña Rita con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días 2 a 3 horas recorriendo, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar  a Guayaquil y Quito cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene poco tiempo que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito recién  y le gusta porque los documentos son mínimos, y da gracias por  que la Fundación le ha dado la oportunidad de ser parte del grupo. Ella sueña con tener su casa propia e independizarse.
texts.en:
The canton is named after the Virgen del Carmen. It is an area with considerable wealth of flora and fauna. The cultivation of the Barraganete variety of banana is a principal source of income.

The members of the San Jacinto credit group meet here every fifteen days, and this is where Rita lives. Rita is 24 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has three children, ages 4, 2 and a four-month old baby. The oldest is in kindergarten. Her husband is a motorcycle mechanic, and they live with his parents.

With hopes of earning something on her own to help her household get ahead, she sells clothing of all kinds door to door. She also sells out of her home, where she has a small shop. She makes her rounds 2 or 3 hours every day, allowing her customers to buy on credit, and collecting every fifteen days.

Every fifteen days or once a month, depending on what she needs, she goes to Guayaquil and Quito to buy her merchandise. She has been doing this for only a short time, and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes. She has just joined the credit group, and she likes it because there is minimal paperwork. 

She thanks the Foundation for giving her the opportunity to be a part of the group. She dreams of having her own home and of becoming independent.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Liza

texts.en:
Rosa Liza is 22 years old and married with two children, one child in school. Rosa Liza works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosa Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, beverages, and groceries..

Rosa Liza has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosa Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Corazon works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling food. Corazon has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy nets and other materials needed for her fishing business. She has sustained her business through ten prior loans from NWTF which she repaid on time. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a 38-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Claire has a food vending business in the Philippines. Claire requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Claire has been in this business for one year. In the future, Claire would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice and feed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and feed to sell to her customers.

Loreta has been in this business for five years. Loreta earns additional income from raising chickens.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and feed to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim 42, is a married father of three children. He lives in very poor conditions with his family and things are often difficult. He tries to work hard in order to provide better living conditions for his family and give them what they need. As an attempt to create a better life, he works as a driver for a company and also has a good shop. During the times he has to drive, his wife works in the shop so that they can save the cost of an employee and generate as much income as possible. 

Bekim works in the shop all hours he is not driving. Now, for the first time, he is requesting a loan to purchase different food and items for his shop. Without the loan, he will not be able to purchase additional items to sell and not be able to continue with his business, which is very important for their income. He hopes that he will have enough profit and success with his business so that he can give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase different food and items for his shop

loans.name: Binh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Binh is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family has six members, including her husband, her four children and her. Her family is in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her four children are both obedient and good at learning. The two elder children have completed a vocational course; the third one is studying at a university, and the youngest is learning at secondary school.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so with the income from selling several pig herds after deducting investment costs, the remaining amount is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount left. But that is not enough to invest and pay for her children’s education. So, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in the education of her children.

She expects the loan amount will help her family have better learning conditions and have a brighter future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in the education of her children

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, an enterprising 39-year-old farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya is a hard-working, energetic mother of six children. For the past five years she has been a farmer, gaining a lot of practical experience. Through her farming income she has assured her family of decent meals and other basic needs. 
Josephine is now applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to move into horticultural farming. Nyamira has good weather patterns and conditions that support farming activities. It has good roads and a good transportation network. With these favorable conditions, she is sure that she will be able to increase her business and reap the maximum in profits. 
Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Josephine feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. She is very disciplined with her finances and hopes that through her accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To move into horticultural farming

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh, born in 1993, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding. The income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount that is left. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee season, but the amount saved is not enough, so she needs to borrow a loan.
	She hopes the loan will help her family invest effectively in the coffee field, so that next year the coffee trees will have a lot of fruit. She will work hard to have money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee desde hace 3 años un puesto de venta de comida ubicado en una zona industrial que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el joven vive en casa propia con su abuela, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  frijoles, arroz, pollo, carne, gaseosas, refrescos, verduras, frutas, huevos, etc. para poder variara su menú y asi atender mejor a sus clientes y poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area. For the past three years, he has managed a food stall that is located in an industrial district near his place of residence. He has many customers because he offers good prices.

This young man lives in his own home along with his grandmother. He is requesting a loan in order to buy beans, rice, chicken, meat, sodas, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, eggs, and other supplies so that he can vary his menu. As a result, he will be improve service to his customers and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, chicken, meat, sodas, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, eggs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ranchería Group

texts.es:
Doña María Luisa es una madre dedicada a su familia y una mujer emprendedora. Ella tiene 37 y vive en unión libre con el señor Claudio quien trabaja como albañil, juntos han formado una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro de ellos están estudiando.

María Luisa es una mujer de campo desde pequeña veía como sus abuelos y padres trabajan la tierra y criaban animales para obtener ingresos y solventar gastos dentro del hogar. Ella sabía que al momento de formar una familia comenzaría a ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y así fue, comenzó a críar y vender borregos hace 13 años. 

Desde muy temprano, después de mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, Doña Luisa se dedica completamente a sus borreguitos, actualmente tiene siete borregos en casa y está muy emocionada porque más corderitos están ya por nacer en los próximos meses. Sin embargo, aún desea tener un rebaño más grande y necesita invertir para comprar 5 animales más y pastura. “Estos animales son muy fáciles de críar porque crecen muy rápido y las ganancias son muy buenas". 

Luisa está dispuesta hacer crecer su negocio porque sus niños aun son pequeños y de alguna manera quiere ayudar con los gastos de su hogar pero sobretodo en sus estudios. “Mis niños son muy pequeños deseo que tengan una mejor calidad de vida por eso mismo su papá y yo los animamos para que continúen estudiando”.

Yolanda, María Luisa, Maribel y María Manuela también invertirán su crédito en borregos, ellas son vecinas de una misma comunidad mazahua. Todas las integrantes están muy contentas y agradecidas por su préstamo porque llevan ya varios ciclos solicitando crédito a la institución, en sus familias el cambio ha sido muy notorio por ejemplo ahora pueden comprar comprar artículos de primera necesidad sin ningún problema, sus hijos continúan estudiando y sus viviendas están mejorando.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio, Doña Maria Luisa es quien tiene el suéter blanco y está cargando al niño*
texts.en:
Doña María Luisa, 37, is a committed mother and enterprising businesswoman.  She and her husband, Claudio, a construction worker, have five children, four of whom are in school.  

María Luisa grew up in the country and watched her parents and grandparents make their livings by working their land and raising their animals.  She knew that when she had a family of her own, she would help her own husband in the same way that her mother helped her father.  And so she has: she has operated her own animal sales business for 13 years, raising and selling sheep. 

From early in the day, after sending her children to school, Doña Luisa tends to her sheep.  She has seven sheep now and was excited to tell us that some will give birth in the coming months.  She wants an even bigger flock in the future and is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy 5 more animals and the rest to buy grass.  "These animals are a good investment because they grow quickly and I can easily sell them for a profit".  

María Luisa wants to grow her business so that she can ensure that her children get good educations.  "My children are still very young and I want them to have a good quality of life . . . that's why their father and I work so hard . . . to ensure that they can finish school." 

Yolanda, María Luisa, Maribel y María Manuela will also use their loans to buy sheep.  All are neighbors in the same Mazahua community.  The members have borrowed from the bank before and all say they are grateful for its support for their businesses.  They also said that their lives have markedly improved as a consequence of the investments they were able to make with the loans.  They can easily buy basic necessities now, their children can stay in school and they've been able to make improvements to their housing.

*The photo was taken in the town center.  Doña Maria Luisa is wearing a white sweater and standing with the child on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy lambs for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Eulalia Aracely

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Eulalia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos mayores de  edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Eulalia junto a su familia  tienen una panadería en un local que arriendan cerca de su casa, allí ellos elaboran pan de varios modelos y sabores así como también tortas, roscas y muchos productos más que son el deleite de su clientes que a diario compran en su local, desde la madrugada ellos se levantan para cuando llegue la mañana tener listo todo para sus clientes, llevan más de 20 años trabajando en esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar y muchos otros ingredientes para preparar los panes. Esta desde el inicio  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the " 16 de Julio" communal bank meet every fortnight in San Eduardo street on the road to Santa Ana in the city of Portoviejo. It has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times.

Eulalia lives here. She is 59 years old, is married and from this relationship has 8 adult children, two of which still live with her. her husband is a craftsman. Eulalia along with her family have a bakery in a store that they rent close to her house. There they produce breads of different kinds and flavors as well as cakes, sweet breads and many more products which delight her customers who buy daily from her store. They get up very early so that when the sun comes up they have everything ready for their clients. They have been running this business for more than 20 years which allows them to earn their living.

This loan is to buy flour, eggs, sugar and many other ingredients to prepare their breads. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and likes it for the support the loans provide. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ratamanegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme Clarisse est la représentante du groupe RATAMANEGRE. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 03 enfants, le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle  a 05 personnes  en charge.
Madame est coiffeuse et vendeuse de mèches depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 10 douzaines de perles.
Mme Clarisse veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son champ d'activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clarisse is the leader for group RATAMANEGRE. She is doing very well. She is married and a mother of three; her oldest is nine years old, her youngest three. One of the children attends school. Mrs. Clarisse supports five people.

She has been a hairdresser and has sold hair extensions for eight years. She procures her supplies from her neighborhood market. She would like to purchase ten dozen pearls.

Mrs. Clarisse wants to reinvest her profit in her business. Her ambition is to broaden the scope of her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen pearls.

loans.name: Tien's Group

texts.en:
Mr Tien is a Kinh ethnic man. He is the first member and has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since 2009. He currently lives with his wife and his two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.	

His family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding,  raising both pigs and chickens. The average income by selling a pig herd is about tens of VND million. But, because the investment cost is also high, the interest is not much, just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. He wants to raise sows and buy feed for them but he doesn’t have enough money. Therefore, he really wants to borrow a loan to invest in the pig breeding.

He hopes the loan amount will help his family invest effectively in breeding with high productivity, and he will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in the breeding of pigs and chickens

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en: Eyvaz is a farmer. He is married and has two children. One of his children is 25 years old and was married. The other is taking his third course at university. His wife is a housewife. They are an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city and presently living in the Fuzuli region. Eyvaz has cows and he has been in the animal breeding business for 15 years. He buys little calves, fattens and sell them. Today he wants to buy calves to increase business. Therefore, he needs a loan in the amount of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He says he is grateful to Kiva and the lenders. In the future, he wants to help his children in education.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase business and in the future, help his children in education.

loans.name: Tamir

texts.en: Mrs. Tamir, 47 years old, lives with her younger son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a barkeeper at a local pub since 2003. Her older son works at a private firm in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and her younger son goes to high school. Using her previous loan, she renovated her house and now lives in a comfortable and warm place. She is requesting a loan of 2,325 USD to buy an electric car for personal use. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants into the atmosphere and wastes less fuel. She will use this environmentally-friendly car for transportation between home and work.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children. She is from Getafe, Bohol.

She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling snack foods, bread and biscuits, soft drinks and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, among others. She is also engaged in a hog-raising venture.

She would like to take a loan to buy more stock to sell of canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soap and toiletries, and also buy additional piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soap and toiletries, and to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 50-year-old married man living in Talibon, Bohol. He runs a small retail business selling dry goods such as slippers and sandals, children’s toys, pillowcases, and blankets.

Reynaldo has been in the business for more than seventeen years now. This is his source of income.

Reynaldo is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as curtains, Tupperware, kitchenware, clothing, pillowcases, blankets, and slippers. A loan will allow him to improve his inventory, thus attracting more buyers in his store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as curtains, Tupperware, kitchenware, clothing, pillowcases, blankets, and slippers.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción, de 53 años, no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios debido a que la situación económica de sus padres no era la mejor. Ella está acompañada y es madre de dos hijos quienes se involucran en compañía de su padre en la limpieza, deshierbe, poda y aplicación de los diferentes insumos agrícolas. Ellos viven en casa. Concepción tiene una gran experiencia y conocimiento en este rubro, pues ella cuando era niña le ayudaba a sus padres en el arreglo de plantas, aplicación de abonos y preparación del suelo para cultivar la planta de café. Ella realiza otras actividades tales como cultivo de maíz y frijol, ventas de comidas ambulantes siendo sus clientes los habitantes de la comunidad. Su propiedad está ubicada a cien metros de distancia de su casa de habitacion. Concepción está solicitando un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pagar por mano de obra que ayude a la limpieza efectiva de la plantación esperando una buena cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Concepción, age 53, was not able to finish her primary education because her parents’ financial situation was not the best. She is in a relationship and is the mother of two children who help their father with clearing the land, weeding, pruning, and applying different farming supplies. Concepción and her family live in their own home. She has a great deal of experience and knowledge about farming. When she was a young girl, she helped her parents with arranging the plants, applying fertilizers, and preparing the ground for planting coffee.

Concepción also engages in other activities, such as planting corn and beans and selling food as a street vendor to customers who live in the community. Her property is located 10 meters away from her house. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, and to pay for labor to help with clearing the land in time for planting. She hopes to achieve a good harvest and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
Al cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí”, por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo, por su rica y variada gastronomía y sus paisajes hermosos llenos de vegetación. Aquí se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Antonio.
En este lugar vive la señora, María tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  cuatro hijos de 23, 22, 21  y 20 años que estudian en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante de plátano y ganado, viven en casa propia.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza cualquier cosa para darles a sus hijos una buena educación, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos agrícolas, su esposo también se dedica a esta actividad, tienen un local en el cual venden sus productos y ella también sale a recorrer puerta a puerta vendiendo la ropa pero la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en compañía de su marido ayudándolo en el local.
 Este crédito es para comprar urea, abono orgánico y ropa. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la amistad que ha hecho con sus amigas del grupo.  Su sueño es ver a sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The canton of "El Carmen" is known as "La Puerta de Oro de Manabí" (the golden gate of Manabí) for its production of "barraganete" plantains—unique to the country and exported around the world—for its rich and diverse cuisine, and for its beautiful landscapes covered with vegetation. This is the place where the members of the San Antonio communal bank meet every 15 days.

María lives in this area too. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four children—aged 23, 22, 21, and 20—who study at the university. Her husband sells bananas and cattle. They live in their own home.

María is a very hard-working woman, who does anything to provide her children with a good education. She makes a living selling clothes and agricultural supplies. Her husband also follows this occupation. They have a store where they sell their products. She also goes from door to door selling clothes; however, she spends most of her time with her husband, helping him at the store.

She will use the loan to buy urea (an agricultural nitrogen-based fertilizer), organic fertilizers, and clothes. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for four years, and she likes it because of the friends she has made within the group. 

Her dream is to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy urea, organic fertilizers, and clothes.

loans.name: Loyola

texts.en: Loyola is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown up children from Getafe, Bohol. For more than 10 years, Loyola has earned a living through her motorcycle transport business which her husband operates. Loyola is asking to take a loan to buy spare parts such as wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts, and fuel. This loan will help her improve their income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts, and fuel

loans.name: Khon Group

texts.en:
Khon, 49 years old, is a married farmer with two grown-up children. She lives in Tbong Khmum province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1982. Her husband, 51 years old, is also a farmer. Both Khon and her husband earn approximately US $12 per day. 

Khon would like to request a loan with her group. She will use her portion to buy foundation parts for a latrine. This loan will help Khon and her family have hygienic living standards. Her plans are to buy more farmland to cultivate rice and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts for a latrine

loans.name: Artemio Jose

texts.es:
Artemio José tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y dos menores hijos en el Caserío de Chinchagual, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

EL se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, tiene experiencia en el rubro, su esposa le apoya en esta labor. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Artemio José is 29 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his wife and two young children in the hamlet of Chinchagual, a rural area of the Pomahuaca district, in an agricultural, trade and ranching community located in the province of Jaen, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. 

He works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee, and has experience in this area. His wife helps him with his work. 

He has asked for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee plantation and thus have optimal production to offer his customers, which will generate more income and enable him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal.

El se dedica a la venta de madera y leña, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de madera y leña para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Juan espera incrementar su nivel de ventas lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en sus ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 59 years old, married, lives in his own home with his wife in the La Matanza district which is located in the Morropon province, Piura region, northern coast of Peru. Life is peaceful there, the villagers work in farming and ranching as their main livelihoods.

He works selling wood and driftwood, he has been in this job for more that 5 years, he has experience in this business with very good personal and work references in the area. 

This loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of wood and driftwood to increase the stock of his business. Thus Juan hopes to increase his sales level which will have a positive impact on his income and will allow him to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and brushwood.

loans.name: Khonishoy

texts.ru: Хонишой выплатила свой кредит без нарушений, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Хонишой на сегодняшний день имеются 10 коров, также Хонишой с семьей занимаются полеводством, выращивая на 3,0 Га ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Хонишой обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит увеличить капитал семьи. Доходы от кредита Хонишой планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Khonishoy paid off her previous loan without any problem, after having used it for its attended purpose.  She thanks Kiva and all the lenders who helped her get this financing.  She now has ten cows on her farm.  Khonishoy and her family are also involved in crop farming;  they cultivate barley on three hectares of land.  Khonishoy makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows.  By increasing her cattle headcount, Khonishoy will be able to increase her family's capital.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business.  She also wants to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Seventy-five percent of the Kenyan population directly depends on small-scale farming for their livelihood in the rural areas. The farming individuals are commonly elderly people between the ages of 45-65 years. However, James has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. At the age of 30 years, he is a proud owner of a farm, where he plants maize and vegetables and keeps dairy cows. The farm is in the Itibo, Nyamira area of Kenya. James practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge attained from the agricultural training he has undergone with Juhudi Kilimo. James also operates a side hustle business to supplement the meager income he earns. 

James sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Nyamira area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why James is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

James is very determined to succeed. Because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits, he will be able to provide a secure future for himself, and also for his ageing parents. James’s dream is to go back to school, and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream. James greatest yearning is to succeed with his dairy farming and be able to have the best economic opportunities in his household to progress together with his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so he can deliver his products to the market on time.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара, 59  лет, вдова. Имеет двоих детей. У Тамары высшее образование, общий трудовой стаж- 40 лет, последние 8 лет она работает в государственных органах, получая заработную плату в размере около 24,300 сом (KGS). В этом году Тамара решила отремонтировать свою квартиру, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай –Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на проведение косметического ремонта и ремонта системы отопления. Доходы Тамара планирует и дальше вкладывать в благоустройство дома.
texts.en: Tamara is 59 years old and a widow.  She has had two children.  She is a college graduate.  She has a total work experience of 40 years and she has been working for the government for the last eight years, making a salary of about 24,300 som (KGS).  This year, Tamara has decided to renovate her apartment and, for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum, requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  This loan will be used to renovate her apartment and repair her heating system.  Tamara plans to use her earnings to make further home improvements.

loans.use: to repair the heating system in her apartment and make other home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two pigs, concentrated feed, and a cow.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, born in 1967, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She lives with her husband and her only son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from her meager salary, so her husband has to find additional work to get more income for the whole family. Even with her monthly salary, it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses.  

She wants to build a sanitation work, but there is not enough money to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for the sanitation work. She hopes the loan will help her family have better living conditions, and more convenience. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for sanitation work.

loans.name: Nosheen Tariq

texts.en:
Nosheen Tariq is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to provide for the needs of the family. Nosheen Tariq provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute, along with her husband, to provide for their household. 
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, fabric, machine oil, etc. for her business. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items, which will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nosheen Tariq is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, fabric, and machine oil

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Badamtsetseg, 31 years old, lives with her husaband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a beautician at a beauty salon since 2010. Her husband is currently unemployed and is looking after their younger son. Their elder son goes to kindergarten. Badamtsetseg is requesting a loan of 550 USD to buy insulation materials such as foam and fiberglass in order to insulate their apartment's windows and walls. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less energy is needed for heating.

loans.use: to insulate the apartment's windows and walls

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en: Veasna is a 21-year-old single student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in banking. He lives in the Pursat province in Cambodia. Veasna has also worked as a credit officer since 2014, earning around USD 3.83 each day. Due to a shortage of finances, Veasna has decided to take out a loan to pay his university fees for a year. In the future, he is going to find another, better job with a reasonable salary to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for a year

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is a 49-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has been in the fishing business for more than 25 years. Rogelio is holding newly-made fishing nets. He is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing nets and lead weights. A loan will help him improve his catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Santos Heriberto

texts.es: Santos de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de café y adicional a eso al cultivo de jocotes desde hace 30 años, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos,  herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos is 60 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife. He grows coffee, but he has also been growing hog plums for 30 years. Santos sells his products at different markets that are located near his home. With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, herbicides, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can continue maintaining his crops and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, herbicides, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Janet has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Janet's husband, Joseph, manages their small farm, earning $100 per year. Even though his small income keeps the family living in poverty, he still claims the position of breadwinner in the household, as is the case in most households in Kenya. Financial support far outweighs any other care or support for the family, leaving women disadvantaged to make decisions within the household, and forcing them to fully depend on their husbands to buy everything, from laundry soap to the food they eat. Until this cultural dogma shifts, it is critical that women have opportunities to participate in money-making activities. 

With the little time Janet has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. Janet is seeking a loan of 90,000 KES to build a greenhouse. Nyamira area has recently witnessed a surge in the tomato farming business. To capitalize more on returns from the booming tomato farming, Janet is seeking to build a greenhouse. Unlike her competition, Janet conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, she has created a name for herself and a demand for her produce. Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Janet’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse. In the future, she is also planning to introduce zero grazing method, intensify her maize farming, and start value addition.
Through this loan Janet will not only increase her income, but also reduce her income vulnerability.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon, born in 1971, is an active person who lives in a rural area. He is an educated, generous and honest man. Alijon is married and has one baby. He is positive and well known among neighbors. He helps and supports everyone who needs and deserves it. 

Alijon is a farmer and his wife is a housekeeper. She loves to help Alijon with the livestock. He has a business buying and selling livestock, and enjoys doing business in this sphere. Alijon grew up in a village and knows well his obligations and duties. It is not hard for him to feed and keep honored cattle, but there are some days when he cannot earn enough from selling to buy forage. Sometimes he is supported by neighbors, but not often. Alijon decided to find financial support outside and is requesting a loan to buy forage for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy forage for his livestock

loans.name: Shahrezada

texts.ru: Шахрезада, 21 год, не замужем, детей нет. У Шахрезады среднее образование. В качестве основного рода деятельности Шахрезада с 2011 года, сразу после окончания школы стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Шахрезады, в хозяйстве имеется: 8 коров, 1 теленок, а также есть поливная земля размером 1,40 ГА, на которой выращивается клевер и кукуруза. Сельскохозяйственная деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шахрезада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком, чтобы увеличить объемы реализации экологически чистого молока.  Доходы от кредита Шахрезада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Shahrezada is 21 years old, single, with no children.  She has a secondary education.  In 2011, right after she finished school, she became involved in animal husbandry and agriculture as her main occupation.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now has eight cows and one calf on her farm and she also grows clover and corn on 1.4 hectare of irrigated land.  Her farming activity brings her an income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow with her calf.  This will help her to produce and sell more organic milk.  Shahrezada is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow with her calf in order to produce and sell higher volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 65-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for more than 10 years. Seaweed, locally known as “guzo”, is valued as food or a side dish in Filipino cuisine. Marina is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and other items. Marina believes that a loan will help her improve her seaweed farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and other items

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina is a 58-year-old married woman living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. For more than 30 years, she has run a small sari-sari (convenience store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Reina is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, etc. to sell. This loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Reina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juana Dolores

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 18 años la cual estudia en universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Juana es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ella y también para el esposo, ella se dedica a la venta informal de ropa y bisuterías, ventas que realiza puerta a puerta y con lo cual se gana lo suyo que les ayuda con los gastos que existen en el hogar y los estudios de su hija. Su marido tiene un local en sociedad con el papá en el cual  venden queso y huevos, ellos compran al por mayor y distribuyen por libras a sus clientes que a diario compran este alimento, ella lleva más de 12 años con esta actividad y su marido más tiempo, actividades con las cuales sacan  adelante a su familia de una forma honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisuterías,  queso y huevos. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios. Sus sueños es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the “16 de Julio Credit Group” meet every fifteen days on San Eduardo Street, on the way to Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known since colonial times as “The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees” 

Señora Juana lives here. She is 40 years old and married, with an 18-year-old daughter who is studying in the university. Her husband is a businessman.

Doña Juana is a very good wife who is taking the loan for herself and also for her husband.  She works on an informal basis, selling clothing and costume jewelry door to door, which is how she earns her own income to help with the household expenses and their daughter’s education.

Her husband has a shop in partnership with his father, in which they sell cheese and eggs.  They buy them wholesale, and distribute them by the pound to their customers, who buy this food daily.  She has been engaged in this occupation for more than 12 years, and her husband, even longer.  With these occupations, they provide for their family honestly.

This loan is to buy clothing, costume jewelry, cheese, and eggs.  She has been in the credit group for five years, and she likes it because the loans are much needed. Her dream is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, costume jewelry, cheese, and eggs.

loans.name: Azra Bibi

texts.en:
Azra Bibi, 42 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her five sons are all studying. Azra Bibi's husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 12 years; he is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Azra Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for resale purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase them. Therefore Azra Bibi is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to assist her husband to purchase these clothes. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Azra Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Setkobor Tuiyobet Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Zedy, a member of Setkobor Tuiyobet Women Group. She is thirty-nine years old, married and blessed with five children whom she lives with.

Zedy earns a living by farming potatoes and maize in her village. She joined Hand in Hand in 2013 and has benefited from savings, enterprise and financial management training. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and hybrid seed to boost her potato farming. She hopes that there will be an increase in productivity and thus increased income that will assist her to educate her children.

 Zedy is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hybrid potato seeds that will help improve productivity.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул женщина в возрасте 42 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Она живет в сельской местности и по сезону выходит на полевые работы. Муж Орзигул ездит в Россию на заработки по сезону. Как и многие сельские жители она занимается откормом скота, который является основным источником ее семейного бюджета. Она начала заниматься скотоводством с юных лет. Видя то, как трудно приходилось ее родителям обеспечивать семью, она решила таким образом помогать родителям. В дальнейшем ей это пригодилось для обеспечения своей семьи. Орзигул не хочет, чтобы ее дети мучились так же как она и смогли получить достойное образование. На данный момент цены на скот сильно упали и в связи с этим бизнес Орзигул переживает не лучшие времена. У Орзигул нет денег для покупки корма для скота, а продавать скот она не хочет из-за низких цен. С данной проблемой она решила обратится в «АРВАНД». На полученные деньги она хочет купить корм и воспользовавшись моментом пару голов скота.
texts.en: Orzigul is 42, married, and she has three children.  She lives in the countryside and she works the land, according to the season.  Her husband also seasonally goes to Russia to find work.  Like many rural residents, Orzigul is involved in fattening cattle.  This activity constitutes the main source of income for her family.  Orzigul became involved in animal husbandry when she was still young.  Realizing how difficult it was for her parents to support the family, she decided to help them, and then she started to support her own family with the same activity. Orzigul doesn't want her children to suffer like she did; she would actually like them to get a decent education.  At the moment cattle prices are quite low and Orzigul's business is going through a difficult time.  Orzigul doesn't have enough money to buy feed for her livestock, and she doesn't want to sell any cattle because the prices are so low.  To solve this problem, she has decided to turn to MDO Arvand.  She will use her loan to buy feed for her livestock and will also take this opportunity to buy two head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle and livestock feed.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through her rice retail sales business. This has been her source of income for the past 11 years now. Nida is asking to take a loan to buy more rice to sell. A loan will help her improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers into her store. In the future, Nida dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Marsa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Marsa, who as a group leader is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 3 children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Marsa joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from the farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Marsa plans to send her children to school.

Between the 11 farmers in Marsa's Group, a total of 5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. 

Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is 50 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 2 children and is married. As a group leader, Violet is representing her group of 6 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Violet's desire to earn enough to send her children to school. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Violet and her group will receive a total of 2 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a 44-year-old merchant from Getafe, Bohol. He is married and has five children. Rufino earns a living through his retail sales of children’s toys, detergents and cleaning agents, etc. This is his source of income for more than 14 years now. Rufino is requesting to take a loan to buy more stocks such as children’s toys, soap, detergents, etc. A loan will help him improve his stocks thus attracting more buyers into his store. 

In the future, Rufino dreams of making his business more profitable and sustainable. He also wants to save money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, such as children’s toys, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.en:
Juliana's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Juliana, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 28 years old, is married and has 3 children. Juliana has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Juliana isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Juliana will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Juliana's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve their harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. She has run a small electronics repair shop with her husband for more than 14 years now. This is the source of their income. Lourdes is asking to take a loan to buy more materials such as screwdrivers, spare wires, power cords, etc.  This loan will enable her and her husband to improve their shop thus allowing them to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as screwdrivers, spare wires, power cords, etc

loans.name: Kaba Thayu 2013 Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Simon, a member of Kaba Thayu Women Group in Nakuru Kenya. He is sixty-two years old, married and blessed with nine children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2014.

Simon does maize and bean farming and also goat rearing. With the training he received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his farming thereby getting more profits from his farm unlike before. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase two dairy goats to expand his farming business. This will improve his income so he can be in a position to educate his children and cater to the family's needs. 

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats that will improve milk productivity.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Eunice, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 60 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 7 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children.

Eunice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Eunice says that she is happy to have made that decision, because since she first joined in 2012, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Eunice will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 1 solar light as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Shazia Akber

texts.en:
Shazia Akber is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for seven years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Shazia Akber has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shazia Akber's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Shazia Akber also plans to accrue savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shazia Akber is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs her husband wants to make to his taxi

loans.name: Twin Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Susan, a member of Twin Women Group. She is married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training courses in financial management. This has helped improve her knowledge in business management. 

Her economic activity is maize and bean farming. She needs a loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds. 

She hopes this will increase her level of income, continue supporting her family and in the long run improve their living conditions. 

Susan is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.
