loans.use: To buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is widowed with five children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling local gin and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin, spirits and crates of beer. She generates additional income from selling maize flour. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler as well as also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin, spirits and crates of beer.

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown up children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 25 years now. It is their source of income. Neonita is asking to take a loan to buy fishing nets and a new fishing boat. A loan will help Neonita and her husband in improving their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Neonita hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to take a loan to buy fishing nets and a new fishing boat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has been selling charcoal from home on both wholesale and retail basis for 11 years, working seven days a week. She also earns additional income from her rental houses. She has requested a loan of 2,200,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to build more rental houses. She joined MCDT because of the good customer care exhibited during the training. She stays in her husband's house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four children ages 8, 7, 5, and 3 years old. Remedios runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. Remedios has been in the business for more than 5 years now. As of now, she is requesting to avail a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods. A loan will enable her to augment her stocks thus attracting more buyers into her store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 66-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a farmer, and she helps her husband in tilling their rice field. Imelda has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.  Imelda is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This loan will help them improve the productivity of their farm thus augmenting their harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Samina Tariq

texts.en:
Samina is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a housewife. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 18 years. He alone is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Samina's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. However, due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Samina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's business

loans.name: Aracely Del Rocio

texts.es:
Aracely tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades que se realizan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en mototaxi, desde hace más de 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Aracely espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aracely is 38 years old, and she is a single mother.  She lives with her children in her own house, in a large community in the urban zone in the Cayaltí District, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.  The occupations in this district are agriculture, livestock-raising, and business.

She has been providing public transportation service with a motor taxi for more than three years; she has experience in the business and regular customers who give her very good personal and work references.

She is requesting a loan to repair and maintain her vehicle, as it is in poor condition currently. With this, Aracely hopes to give better service to her customers, which will generate more income for her, and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her vehicle, as it is in poor condition currently.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 59 años de edad, es casada y con hijos, vive en la zona urbana del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

La actividad que desarrolla Catalina es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, tales como arroz, leche, azúcar, menestras, los cuales comercializa en su domicilio desde hace 15 años. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar y arroz para surtir su negocio, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina is 59, and she is married with children.  She lives in the urban zone of the Oyotún District, which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.  Life in this district is tranquil. The people who live here devote themselves to agriculture, trade, and livestock-raising.

Catalina’s occupation is selling groceries and staple goods from her home, such as rice, milk, sugar, and legumes.  She has been selling them from her home for more than 15 years; she has experience in this business and very good personal and work references in the zone.

The loan will be for the purchase of a large quantity of staple goods such as sugar and rice, in order to stock her business.  This will allow her to generate more earnings and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of staple goods such as sugar and rice, in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge y menor hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la confección de estructuras metálicas como puertas, sillas, mesas, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de herramientas como máquinas de soldar para implementar su negocio, con esto Richard espera brindar un mejor servicio lo que le va a permitir tener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Richard is 27 years old. He is in a common law relationship. He lives in a family house with his partner and small child, in the district of Cayalti located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. He lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock. He works building metal structures such as doors, chairs, tables, among other items.  His business is located in his home. He has more than 3 years of experience in this business and has a stable clientele who have provided good personal and professional references of him. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of tools such as soldering equipment to implement  his business. With this, Richard will be able to offer a better service which will bring greater earnings and consequently will improve his and his family's quality of live.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of tools such as soldering equipment to implement his business.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tiến has a retail business selling bedding (blankets, cushions, buffers, bedsheets). She is requesting a loan to purchase bedding (blankets, cushions, buffers, bedsheets) to resell.

Tiến is 57 years old and she is married with three children. Tiến is the group leader of the Nhóm 13 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. Tiến lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tiến has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tiến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tiến hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase bedding (blankets, cushions, buffers, bedsheets) to resell

loans.name: Lới

texts.en:
Mrs Lới works in agriculture, farming food. Lới has been involved in this business for five years.

Lới is 57 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lới’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lới faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair the toilet.

With her business profit, Lới hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair the toilet.

loans.name: Mariana Jenny

texts.es: Con 29 años de edad Mariana es una señora casada y tiene 2 hijos, un hijo de 7 años que está asistiendo a la escuela, y una niña 10 meses, el esposo de mariana es empleado en una fabrica que hacen muebles, Mariana se dedica a su negocio desde 10 años atrás, comenta que le va bien en su tercena  ya que ella ofrece producto de buena calidad y tiene mucha pasiencia para atender a sus clientes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y terneros para fanearlos y ofrecerlos en carne en su tercena.
texts.en: At 29 years of age, Mariana is a married woman with two children. She has one son aged 7 years old who attends school, and a 10 month old girl. Mariana's husband works as an employee of a furniture factory. Mariana has worked in her business for the past 10 years. She states that her butcher shop is going well because she offers quality products and has great patience to serve her clients. The loan will be used to buy pigs and calves to slaughter them and offer their meat in her butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy calves and pigs

loans.name: Cladys

texts.es:
Cladys tiene 44 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en una zona rural de la provincia de Morropón donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, se encuentra ubicado en la Región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica hace más de 02 años a la venta de miel de abeja y algarrobina en su propio domicilio, también envía pedidos a otras ciudades, estos productos propios de la zona se caracterizan por sus bondades curativas. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo con la finalidad de mejorar la presentación de sus productos y adquirir una mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de estos, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cladys is 44 years old and lives with her husband in a rural area in the province of Morropon, located in the Piura region, in the northern coast of Peru. The population in this area works in agriculture and commerce. For over two years, she has worked selling bee honey and algarrobina (beverage made from the carob tree fruit)  from her own home. She also receives orders from other cities because these products, typical of the area,  are known for their healing benefits.  She has experience in this business and she has very good personal and professional references in her district. She is asking for a loan to improve the presentation of her products and to purchase a greater quantity of raw material to manufacture them, which will result in greater earnings for her family and improvement in their quality of life.

loans.use: To improve the presentation of her products and to purchase a greater quantity of raw material to manufacture them.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 60 años de edad, es conviviente. Tiene 01 hijo dependiente, vive con su hijo y su cónyuge en el distrito de Pomahuaca, el cual es un distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en donde sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Pedro Pablo se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona y de los alrededores; el destino del crédito será para invertir en el negocio con la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería, invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 60 years old and has a partner. He has one dependent son. He lives with his son and his wife in the district of Pomahuaca, which is a medium-sized district with aspirations of bettering itself. The principal activities there are agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising, and it is located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Pedro Pablo works in commerce. He has a store located in his residence. He has more than 8 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. Because of his good service and experience, he has sufficient customers from the zone and its surroundings.  

The destiny of the loan will be to invest in the business with the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise, investing in his business and being able to get an adequate profit so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business with the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Fernando Stalin

texts.es: Fernando esta casado, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 19, y 20 años de edad mismos que están estudiando, la esposa de Fernando se dedica a la crianza de animales menores,  Fernando trabaja de faenador  de chanchos en un camal municipal, el crédito lo necesita para comprar chanchos que los comercializa en las ferias de las ciudades mas cercanas, la aspiración mas grande de Fernando es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Fernando is married. He is 46 years old and has three children, ages 10, 19, and 20, who are in school. Fernando's wife raises small animals. Fernando works as a butcher of pigs in a municipal slaughterhouse. He needs the loan to buy pigs that he will sell at the fairs in the most nearby cities. 

Fernando's greatest aspiration is to have his children complete their schooling so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Jefferson Lee

texts.es:
Jefferson es un joven estudiante que vive junto a su madre y su hermano mayor. Sus padres se separaron cuando él era muy pequeño. Su madre solo es ama de casa, por lo que los ingresos económicos en el hogar son muy escasos, siendo sus padrinos las personas que lo apoyan de manera eventual. Él inicio a trabajar a los 18 años como ayudante de mecánica.
Antes de recibir este apoyo, Jefferson pagaba sus estudios con su sueldo y también el apoyo de sus familiares, lamentablemente tuvo un período de 12 meses sin estudiar por falta de medios económicos. De no conseguir este apoyo tendría que abandonar sus estudios nuevamente hasta poder reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita culminar su carrera.
Actualmente se encuentra estudiando el 4° Ciclo de Mecánica de Mantenimiento, carrera que le gusta mucho y siente que le permitirá apoyar a su madre. Debido a la situación económica por la que están atravesando, Jefferson recurre a KIVA solicitando el apoyo que necesita para poder culminar su carrera. 
Jefferson se siente feliz al saber que existe una institución como KIVA, que está dispuesta apoyar a jóvenes como él que tienen el sueño de llegar a ser excelentes profesionales y así apoyar con el progreso de su familia, sociedad y país.
texts.en:
Jefferson is a young student who lives with his mother and his older brother. His parents separated when he was very small. His mother is only a housewife, and for this reason the economic income in the household is very scarce, his godparents being the people who help them occasionally. He began to work at the age of 18 as a mechanic's assistant.

Before receiving this support, Jefferson paid for his studies with his salary and also with the support of relatives. Unfortunately, he had a period of 12 months without going to school due to the lack of economic means. If he does not obtain this support, he will have to abandon his studies again until he can gather sufficient money to allow him to finish his program.

He is now studying in the fourth semester of the maintenance mechanics program, a program that he likes a lot, and he feels that it will allow him to support his mother. Due to the economic situation that they are going through, Jefferson is turning to Kiva, applying for the support that he needs to be able to finish his program.

Jefferson feels happy to know that there is an institution such as Kiva, which is ready to support young people such as himself, who have the dream to become excellent professionals and thus support the progress of their family, society and country.

loans.use: to finish his program to be a maintenance mechanic and thus be able to support his family economically.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall selling meat.

Dung is 34 years old and she is married with two children.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de 57 y 23 años de edad respectivamente, don José se encarga trabajar para tener recursos económicos con los que solventa los gastos familiares, su actividad económica principal es la crianza y comercialización de ganado, la realiza con la ayuda de su hijo, uno de sus tíos le enseño el oficio y tiene 8 años de desempeñar esta actividad, día a día se esfuerza por continuar trabajando para salir adelante con su familia, no tiene otros ingresos.
El capital será invertido en la compra de ganado, de está amanera fortalecerá el negocio esperando tener mejores ganancias con las que cambiara la alimentación familiar y cancelara sus deudas.
El objetivo de don José es administrar de la mejor manera el crédito para continuar trabajando y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and a son, ages 57 and 23, respectively. Don José is responsible for working to have economic resources with which he can pay the family expenses. His principal economic activity is raising and selling cattle. He does this with the help of his son. One of his uncles taught him this work, and he has been doing it for 8 years. Day after day he does his utmost to continue working in order to get ahead with his family. He doesn't have other income.

The capital will be invested in the purchase of cattle. In this way he will strengthen his business, hoping to have better earnings with which he will change the family diet and pay his debts.

José's goal is to administer the loan in the best way in order to continue working and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy cattle to strengthen his business, hoping to have better earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Tân Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thi has a retail business selling electronics supplies. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell. Thi has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thi is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thi is the group leader of the nhóm 02 thôn Tân xã Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2008, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Thi has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit,  Thi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay higher education tuition fees.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a fruit and vegetable vendor. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. Julita lives with her family in Getafe, Bohol. 

She has been in the fruit and vegetable business for more than two years now, and this is her source of income. Julita is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.  

In the future, Julita hopes to expand her store in order to generate more revenue. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tukurakurane Rusandara Farmers Group

texts.en:
Salome is a 54-year-old married and hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda with 4 children. She sells produce and practices farming to earn a living. 

Salome does not have much money which means her farm is understocked and she gets low returns on her sales. However, she hopes to grow her business. Salome is requesting a loan to increase her stock by buying more maize to sell. She is a member of the Tukurakurane Rusandara group, in which each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying more maize to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 40, lives in Chuka, which is a small agricultural centre in Central province, Kenya. She is the proud mother of two adorable children. Grace started a mixed farm in 2011 and continues to farm for a living. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, poultry and crops. Grace enjoys poultry farming and dairy farming above all other activities. The main challenges she faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed. 

Grace is asking for a loan to buy a quality breed of dairy goat. To her, raising goats is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience. She understands the challenges that come with dairy goat farming and the market uncertainties. This knowledge has influenced her strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand. Dairy goat farming is very profitable and Grace will benefit from goat milk fetching high prices in the local and international markets. 

She plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for her child's education. When she was asked how the loan would benefit her family, she said, “I will be able to educate my child and also feed my family”.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Lovely Mae

texts.en:
Lovely Mae is a 24-year-old scrap buyer from Getafe, Bohol. She buys scrap materials like empty bottles and cans, metal sheets and other recyclable materials. She has been in this business for more than a year now and this is her source of income. 

Lovely Mae is asking for a loan to buy more scrap materials like bottles, empty cans, metal sheets and other recyclable materials. In the future, Lovely Mae hopes of making her business profitable and successful.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials like bottles, empty cans, metal sheets and other recyclable materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with seven children, four of whom attend school. She has been selling used clothes at the market for 10 years, and sells African attire to acquire additional income. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees. 

Mariam has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She resells these on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include changing seasons and theft. She wishes to own a permanent business premise and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products for her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 13,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods which she sells at retail prices. She is positive that more items in her store will result in more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is stable and is used to sustain her family's basic needs and her children's education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Susan dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to send her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Armandi

texts.en:
A loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek will help Armandi, a 48-year-old villager and father of a 22-year-old to buy a dairy cow, as he already makes feed for animals through his other activities. Armandi’s plan is that he continues then to expand his herd of livestock.

Armandi has been involved in agriculture for the past 18 years; wholesalers and buyers buy the fresh produce from him. He owns 15 dynym of agricultural land (one dynym is equivalent to 1000 square metres) and he rents 13 dynym from other villagers at a price of about $50/dynym. He plants mostly beans, peppers, leeks, onions, potatoes and has grapevines in two dynym. Armandi also has a cart and horse to transport what he farms.

loans.use: to start farming livestock by buying one milking cow first and continuing to add to the herd in the years to come.

loans.name: 12 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhung has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to make tailor-made clothing and to help in offering a repairing service.  Nhung has been involved in this business for 2 years and one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Nhung is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 12 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2012, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines for a tailor-made clothing and repair service.

loans.name: 13 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Lan is 38 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 13 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

Lan has a retail business selling medication. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Lan is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

In 2012, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell.

loans.name: Tương

texts.en:
Tương is 60 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Tương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main harship that Tương faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Tương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: 04 Thành Lập Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tươi operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell.

Tươi is 32 years old and is married with four children. She is the group leader of the 04 Thành Lập Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tươi has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima, aged 61, is a married woman and a mother of nine grown-up children. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. 

Geronima has been engaged in a pig raising business for more than eleven years now. She also earns additional income through farming. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

She is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. This loan will be a great help for Geronima in augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children. 

Irene operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a steamer, braids, weaves, relaxers, treatments, and oils. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to buy better hair dryers, rollers, and seats for her salon. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy a steamer, braids, weaves, relaxers, treatments and oils for her salon.

loans.name: Tulibamu Paacwa Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 20-year-old hard working married woman living in Kagadi. She has two children. 

Mary sells clothes to supplement her daily income from farming, a retail shop and a saloon. She hopes to grow her business and in time build a permanent house and educate her children, despite challenges of competition from similar businesses. She intends to use her portion of the loan to buy clothes, sugar, soda, and salon equipment to sell. 

She is a member of Tulibamu Paacwa Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sugar, soda, and salon equipment to sell.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en:
This is Valentino, a 31-year-old married father of two young children, aged 7 and 2, who is seeking your compassion to help him make some basic repairs to the home where his two young children live. Kindly note that the town where his family resides is in the coldest part of the country; thus, by helping him financially you have helped his young children live in a warmer environment.  

For the past four years, Valentino’s focus has been on livestock; he has two cows and sells about 40 liters of milk a day at a price of $0.4 per liter. Had he sold the milk directly to clients, then the price would have been $1 per liter, instead of selling to a dairy farm. He also has a sow from which he sells about eight piglets every year. On the eight dynym piece of land that he owns, he plants mostly corn, wheat, fodder and beets, all these are used for his animals.

loans.use: to make very basic repairs to the family home.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's Group is formed of ten farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Rose, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 38 years old, married and has four children. Rose has been a farmer for sixteen years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Rose isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Rose will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Rose's Group will purchase a total of four solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, and a solar light.

loans.name: Janerose's Group

texts.en:
Janerose is the group leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing eight farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Janerose joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for sixteen years.

Like many other farmers, Janerose decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Janerose's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of four acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights, as, even though Janerose decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson is 59 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Wilson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Wilson also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Wilson's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with five children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Rose works in a retail shop and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. Rose has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, beans, flour, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She aspires to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, beans, flour, cartons of salt and boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is 32 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. 

Rizwana provides sewing services and earns the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. She needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories, and also help for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, cloth, machine oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Abakirozeremu Ebirungi Kibyasi Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 28-year-old married man living in Kagadi with three children. He sells produce to generate income and also does farming for supplementary earnings. His greatest hope is to uplift his business and income despite price fluctuations affecting his returns. 

Richard is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell. He is a member of Abakiroziremu Ebirungi Kibyasi where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is a cheerful woman. She was born in a remote district. Muyassar is married and has three children. 

She is an agricultural woman and likes her work. She is hardworking and a responsible woman. Ten years ago she started her business planting raspberries. She fertilized the land by herself. At early morning, she went to the domestic market to find a place to sell her raspberries. 

Muyassar's husband works at a government institution. Muyassar alone keeps and feeds her family; what her husband earns is not enough for their needs and expenditures. Now, in addition to raspberries, she plants also corn and onions. She sells them in the domestic market. She needs financial support to buy fertilizers in order to improver her land and take more gains. She wants to fertilize her land well. She is asking for financial support to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 45 years old, married and has two children. His wife is a teacher, Saleh’s daughter is a talented girl, she plays the piano and his son goes to school, in the future he wants to be a programmer. They are living in Fizuli region, but for 22 years they have been IDP (İnternally Displaced Persons) from Fizuli city. 

Saleh is a teacher; he is teaching computer programs. His computer was broken and he needed a new computer. He wants to increase his business, and wants to buy a new computer. Therefore, he has applied to Komak company for a loan amount of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Saleh says thanks to Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future, he wants start a new course where he will teach children.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and increase his business.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 48-year-old hard-working man, who does his best to make financial stability for his family, but it becomes harder to earn a living over time. Therefore, Mamuka wants to make his activities more profitable and has requested a loan. He generates income from private activities, in particular he has been a vehicle handyman for over ten years, and has a great desire to open his own auto service and increase productivity. 

Mamuka requested 2,000 GEL for renovating the space for this service and for purchasing all of the tools needed. Mamuka already has loyal customers and will attack more after expanding his auto service. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people, who do not have access to credit products.
 
The expanded business will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family. Mamuka will get the opportunity to make a better lifestyle for his family members and more productively continue his business activity.

loans.use: to open an auto service shop and get a stable source of income.

loans.name: Annamary

texts.en:
Annamary is a 30-year-old single lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She has asked for a loan to help her buy beer, soda, wine and spirits to sell. She owns a bar and a hotel which adds her more income. She is faced with hardships of low capital and bad debtors which affects her business growth. Besides that, she hopes to construct a residential house and educate her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, wine and spirits to sell.

loans.name: James Group

texts.en:
James is 72 years old and is often referred to as a really experienced farmer. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Kakamega South District, formed by 10 farmers, including himself.

James has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2009 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, James’s Group will receive a total of 1 solar light as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is married and has five children, only three of whom go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees.

Hajara buys and sells cattle. She has been in this business for five years and sells at the market once a week but sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cattle for resale. 

In the future she aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She also hopes to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a businesswoman and lives in a rural area. She was born in 1978, and is divorced with one child. She is brave and patient person. 

Madina has been in business for eight years. She is a sewer, and sews traditional dresses for woman. She sells her dresses in stores. Madina started her sewing activities by practicing at home, with the aim of making a better standard of living for herself. She later decided to open her own sewing business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine with an embroidering machine. She needs financial support to increase her business and buy a sewing machine with an embroidering machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine with an embroidering machine.

loans.name: Ldyia

texts.en:
Ldyia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Ldyia operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents, and has been in this business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, beans and flour. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 37-year-old married woman with three children,n living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She is a hard-working woman. She sells produce that is, dry beans, maize, peas, millet and others in order to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years. She dreams of expanding her business even though she meets a challenge of market competition. Betty intends to use the loan to buy dry ground nuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy dry ground nuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Michael is representing his group of 12 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Michael has been a farmer for 14 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Michael is planning to rent more land to cultivate.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Michael's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her son to purchase scrap goods for reselling.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Teso District. She is 53 years old, married and has 5 children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Ndagani, a village found in the Chuka area of Kenya, which is primarily a banana and sugar cane growing region. She has one lovely child with Mr. Justine, her husband. 

To help her hubby provide for the family, Agnes ventured into farming a decade ago. Over the years, she has brought tremendous growth to the business. Today, she keeps dairy cattle, poultry, and grows maize among other crops. She is also invested in other personal businesses for additional income. Agnes enjoys dairy farming the most. She is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow in a bid to keep increasing the quantity of the farm's milk production. The money Agnes will make from selling the additional milk will help her to repay the debt and pay for her child’s education, which is her highest expense. Agnes stated, "I will buy a cow that will produce more milk for sale. This will increase my family's monthly income."

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kennedy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Kennedy, often described as an extremely friendly person. He is 31 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 14 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.  He is married and has one child.

Kennedy is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Kennedy says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Kennedy will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 10 solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Erespinos Group

texts.en:
Erespinos is 55 years old and has 6 children. He has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Erespinos is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Erespinos started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Erespinos’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and materials for her husband's painting business.

loans.name: Jael's Group

texts.en:
Jael is a 43-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers from the Matete district of Kenya. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jael has noticed that she has learnt a lot from the farming training they provide.

Jael described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be buying a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Jael’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing maize.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has been running a business selling used clothes for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Sarah works at the market five days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Raza Camba Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento RAZA CAMBA compuesta por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varon,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; Venta de carteras, Venta de carne,  transporte público, venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

Fabiola(en la foto es la primera a la derecha sentada con polera blanca y cuello amarillo)es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de mochilas, carteras, bolsones para viaje, etc.
Ella es buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un puesto de venta en la calle, en la populosa Zona ’Primero de mayo’ de la ciudad de santa Cruz, caracterizada por el comercio informal; De clima cálido (28ºC -35ºC)
Fabiola es de tez morena, cabello negro largo habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica al transporte interdepartamental, sus hijos estudian en la escuela y toda la familia vive en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de; mochilas, carteras, bolsones para viajes, maletín, Labor que realiza todos los días, “empecé como vendedora ambulante, luego me compré un puesto ahora me va muy bien ya tengo muchos clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mercadería por mayor para abaratar costos y tener productos para vender. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fabiola solicita un préstamo para la compra de bolsos, carteras y maletas de viaje por mayor para abaratar costos y ofrecer  a sus clientes mayor variedad.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur's bank Raza Camba is made up of nine members, eight women and a man. They work in a variety of jobs such as wallet sales, meat sales, public transportation, fruit sales, juice sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, and vegetable sales, and for this reason they ask for a loan to expand their businesses. 

Fabiola (in the photo, she is seated, the first on the right wearing a white shirt with a yellow collar). She is a 28-year-old woman, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 6, and her business is selling backpacks, wallets, large bags for travel, etc.  She is a good mother, responsible, and hard-working. She carries out her business in a sales stall on the street, in the highly populated zone "Primero de mayo" in the city of Santa Cruz, characterized by its informal businesses, and with a warm climate (28ºC -35ºC).

Fabiola has tanned skin, long black hair, and speaks Spanish. She lives her life alongside her husband who works in interdepartmental transport. Their children go to school and the whole family lives in their own house which has drinking water, electricity and gas. Her business is the sale of backpacks, wallets, large bags for travel, and suitcases and she works every day. "I began as a street vendor and later I bought a stand, and now it is going very well for me, since I have many customers..." she says.  Her dream is that her children become professionals. She wants to expand her business purchasing merchandise in bulk to reduce her costs and have more products to sell. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Fabiola is asking for a loan to purchase bags, wallets, and suitcases in bulk to reduce her costs and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase bags, wallets and suitcases in bulk.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo, vive con su esposa de 49 años de edad, se dedica a sembrar granos básicos y hortalizas como frijol, pepino, tomates, cocos etc., no tiene familiares en el extranjero que le apoyen económicamente,  su negocio lo inicio hace más de 10 años y lo heredo de sus padres, con su experiencia ha ido diversificando sus cultivos.
Invertirá en abono orgánico e insecticidas para que el cultivo de hortalizas tenga un mejor desarrollo y no se vea afectado por plagas, espera obtener una cosecha abundante y con mejor calidad, de esta manera las demandas de sus clientes serán cubiertas y sus ganancias aumentaran.
Erasmo tiene como objetivo continuar trabajando, cancelar la deuda adquirida y mejorar la calidad de vida para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Erasmo lives with his 49-year-old wife. He works growing staple crops and vegetables such as beans, cucumber, tomatoes, coconuts, etc. He doesn't have any family members abroad who help him economically. He began his business 10 years ago and inherited it from his parents. With his experience, he has been diversifying his crops. 

He will invest in organic manure and insecticides so that his vegetable crop develops better and is not affected by pests. He hopes to have an abundant harvest of better quality and, in this way, his customer's demand will be met and his income will increase. Erasmo has as a goal to continue working, pay off the acquired debt and improve his quality of life and that of his wife.

loans.use: to invest in organic manure and insecticides so that his vegetable crop develops better and is not affected by pests.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is the 36 years old, the mother of four children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store that sells goods such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. He provides the family's household necessities from the store, and his relatives also like to buy from it. His voice has an impressive, even tone and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and manner, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, which is why it does well. In fact, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Thus, Nusrat has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents and biscuits. She hopes that her husband will use the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to meet the needs of the family. Nusrat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Hayrton Ruben

texts.es:
Hayrton, es un joven estudiante proveniente de Juliaca, ciudad muy fría ubicada en la Sierra Sur de Perú. Junto a su familia emigraron a Lima en busca de un futuro emprendedor para todos. Sus padres se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir.
Él actualmente está cursando el 4° Ciclo de Electrónica Industrial, carrera que le interesa porque desea saber cómo funcionan los componentes electrónicos, así como también tener más conocimiento del mundo de la electrónica. Antes de recibir este crédito, Hayrton estuvo pagando sus estudios con ingresos familiares. Pero debido a la actual situación económica por la que está atravesando su familia, para él es muy difícil trabajar y estudiar a la vez. Por lo que, tendría que dejar sus estudios para poder reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita culminar su carrera.
Hayrton, recurre a KIVA en busca del apoyo que necesita para finalizar su carrera exitosamente y siente que el apoyo que le están brindando le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos personales y profesionales. Por lo que, se siente muy agradecido por la labor que realizan al apoyar a personas como él que anhelan tener un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Hayrton is a young student from Juliaca, a very cold city located in the southern mountains of Peru. Along with his family, he moved to Lima looking for an enterprising future for all of them. His parents work making clothing.

He currently is in his fourth cycle of industrial electronics, a major that interests him because he wants to know how the electronic components work and in this way also have more knowledge about the world of electronics. Before getting this loan, Hayrton was paying for his schooling with family income. But, due to the current economic situation his family is experiencing, for him it is very difficult to work and study at the same time. As such, he would have had to drop his studies to be able to save enough money to be able to finish his program.

Hayrton comes to Kiva looking for the support that he needs to finish his program successfully and feels that the support that you are offering him will allow him to realize his personal and professional goals. For this, he is very grateful for the work that is done to support people such as him who desire to have a promising future.

loans.use: to finish his studies in industrial electronics and establish his own business which will help him support his family.

loans.name: Toby Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento TOBY compuesta por diez integrantes todas mujeres,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; Venta de carteras, Venta de carne,   venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios, venta de productos medicinales.
La presidenta de banco es la señora GUEIZA es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 18, 21 y 24  años, y su negocio es la venta de productos medicinales naturales para la salud.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘del Plan 3000, sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
GUEIZA (en la foto la señora de polera negra y bermudas rojo)es de tez morena, cabello largo color castaño, estatura alta y rosbusta, habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo y sus hijos viven en una casa que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y gas. El negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud, sus inicios fueron como vendedora minorista, actualmente es vendedora mayorista y desde hace un año que alquila una tienda para la exposición de los productos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa en tres años de experiencia en el negocio.  Actualmente cuenta con vendedoras que distribuyen las medicinas por mayor, su tienda cuenta con escasos muebles y necesita una vitrina para exponer su mercadería. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en líder en la venta y distribución de productos medicinales naturales para la salud.
Es por esos motivos que GUEIZA solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles para exposición y ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank TOBY is made up of 10 members, all women, who work in various jobs such as wallet sales, meat sales, fruit sales, juice sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, and vegetable sales, and for this reason they ask for a loan to expand their businesses, and medicinal product sales.

The president of the bank is Gueiza, a woman who is 44 years old, married, and has four children, ages 12, 18, 21, and 24. Her business is selling natural medicinal health products. 

She is independent, enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. She does her work in the Plan 3000 zone, a place characterized by business in all sectors. 

Gueiza (in the photo she is wearing a black shirt and red capris) has tanned skin, long brown hair, is tall and robust, and speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband and their children; they live in a house that has electrical, water, and gas services. The business is selling natural health products. Her beginnings were in retail sales, and currently she is a wholesaler and for the past year she has rented a store to show her products. This is her second loan sequence with the business in her three years of experience with the store. Currently she has saleswomen who distribute the medicines in bulk. Her store has very little furniture and she needs a display case to show her merchandise. Her goal is to expand her business and become a leader in the sale and distribution of natural medicinal health products. 

For these reasons, Gueiza asks for a loan to purchase display furniture to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase display furniture to expand her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Joyce, 45 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Bosamaro, a remote village in Nyamira. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. 

Joyce is happily married and blessed with six children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs.” 

Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Nyamira area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. 

Joyce is a member of Kenyago self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. 

Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: To pay for poultry.

loans.name: Moses Group

texts.en:
Moses, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. He is 50 years old, is married and has six children.

Moses likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Moses plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Moses’ Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Minziro's Group

texts.en:
Minziro is 65 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Minziro has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Minziro also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Minziro's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorized rickshaw body.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Florence, a 29-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Kebirigo, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is happily married and has four children that depend on her for the basic needs. 

For the past sixteen years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her primary sources of income are milk, tea, egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” 

She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high-quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound, and the demand has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. 

The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence, provide a secure and solid education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase quality poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Rephah

texts.en:
Rephah, 43 years old, is married and a mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does vegetable farming as her main business. She benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage the business well through proper bookkeeping and cash flow analysis. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality farm inputs such as manure and pesticide. She hopes this will help increase her farm yields and income. This will help her to cater for family needs such as food, clothing and school fees for her children.
 
Rephah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and pesticide that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 30 years old and blessed with two children. She is married and lives together with her family.
 
She farms maize, beans and potatoes to earn a living. She is happy with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa savings mobilization training, which equipped her with knowledge of business management. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her potatoes farming business by applying quality manure and pesticides. This will enable her to improve the living standards of her family with such things as quality medical care and education. 

Bilha is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and pesticide that will help improve productivity.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 33-year-old married mother of five children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband works in a small firm and generates a very low income. 

Shakeela owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warmer clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.
 
She has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of garments to fulfill the demand. Shakeela wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of garments to fulfill the demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university courses as well as her mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Khoudia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 30 mai 2011 et il est composé de femmes issues de la même localité et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Khoudia est la responsable de ce groupe ,elle est mariée âgée de 45ans et mère de cinq enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles.Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits divers depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 350000 francs elle se payer des tissus de l’encens et des jus de fruit pour les revendre au détail au niveau du petit marché de sa localité.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins familiers et de renforcer ses èpargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 30, 2011 and it is composed of women who come from the same locality and are united by good social and professional ties. 

Madame Khoudia is the leader of this group. She is married, aged 45, and the mother of five children, three boys and two girls. She has been selling various merchandise for a long time and boasts a good experience in this field. 

With her new loan of 350,000 francs she plans to buy cloth, incense, and fruit juice to sell retail in a little market in her locality. The profit she makes will permit her to satisfy family needs and to grow her savings with the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy cloth, incense, and fruit juice to run an income-generating activity.

loans.name: Señor De Ecce Homo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cirila continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía, venta de llaveros, trabajadores independientes.
texts.en:
The member, Cirila, belongs to the "Señor de Ecce Homo" communal bank, which is located in the department of Cusco.

She continues with her business of clothing sales. She is grateful for the loan granted, and committed to making her payments on time. She sells to customers who ask for her merchandise. Cirila is a responsible, diligent person, this being how she supports her family.

She requested the loan to purchase coats, among other items.

The other members make a living selling crafts, selling key chains, and as independent workers.

loans.use: to buy coats, among other items.

loans.name: Oscar Alvaro

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre joven de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia la carrera de mecánica industrial.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, independiente, generoso, amable, responsable y trabajador. Sus estudios los desarrolla en la zona central, , un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-18 grados centígrados.
Oscar es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Vive con sus padres, su papá es instructor de una autoescuela y su mamá que tiene una tienda de barrio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad, alcantarillado, gas domiciliario y agua potable.
