Él estudia la carrera de mecánica industrial que consiste en la construcción y mantenimiento de máquinas industriales, que tiene por finalidad la transformación de materia prima en productos elaborados. “decidí estudiar esta carrera por la motivación de crear, diseñar y obtener resultados para beneficio de todos…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y trabajar en una importante empresa del sector, el desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar los gastos de su colegiatura para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene estudiando su carrera profesional.
Es por esos motivos que Oscar solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar sus gastos de colegiatura para finalizar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 21, is single and has no children.  He is studying industrial mechanics.  He is intelligent, enterprising, independent, generous, kind, responsible, and hard-working.

He is studying in the central area, an area known for all types of commerce.  The area is home to universities, public offices and private businesses that exist side by side.  It has a cold and dry climate throughout the year.  The temperature varies between 6 and 18 degrees centigrade during the day.

Oscar has a dark complexion, short dark hair, dark eyes and is short.  His native language is Ayamará, which he speaks with his family.  He speaks Spanish with the general public and for his studies.  He lives with his family.  His father is an instructor at a driving school, and his mother has a neighborhood store.  They live in their own house, which is made of brick.  It has electricity, sewers, gas for the house, and potable water.

He is studying the career of industrial mechanics, which consists of building and maintaining industrial machines.  The purpose is to transform raw material into finished products.  “I decided to study this career in order to create, design, and get results that will benefit everyone,” he says.

His dream is to complete his education and to work for an important company in the area.  He wishes to buy a laptop computer and to pay his school fees in order to continue with his studies.  This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the four years that he has been studying for his professional career.

It is for these reasons that Oscar is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer and to pay the expenses of his school fees in order to complete his professional degree.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer and to pay the expenses of his school fees in order to complete his professional degree.

loans.name: Señor De Eccehomo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE ECCEHOMO, la socia Cirila tiene 50 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Esta es una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa de nombre Credi Yapa y es otorgado a socios que cumplen puntualmente con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the communal bank group called "Señor de Eccehomo." Cirila is 50 years old and has two children. She is not married. Cirila spends her days working in her clothing business and taking care of her family's daily needs. Cirila has been running her business for a long time; it has gone very well for her thanks to the dedication that she shows each day. Cirila hopes to be able to keep working and supporting her family. Cirila will use this loan to buy suits. 

She is grateful for this loan and pledges to make all of the scheduled repayments. 

This is one of the lines of credit from the Arariwa Association named Credi Yapa. It is offered to bank group members who are punctual with repayments.

loans.use: to buy suits.

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LUCERO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Clorinda ella es conviviente tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua elaborando camas, muebles, roperos entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de cereales, trabajadores de empresa privada.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank "LUCERO", located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco. 
 
The member is 46-year old Clorinda who lives with her partner and has 4 children.

She alternates her daily activities with her carpentry business. She is thankful to those who have helped form part of her dream and she is committed to making her loan repayments in the specified timeframe.

She continues to make beds, furniture, wardrobes etc to help support her family and enable them to progress. 

She is requesting the loan to buy wood. 

The other members of the communal bank make a living working in a grocery store, selling cereal and working for a private company. 

The members who can be seen in the attached photo asked for permission to go to the meeting late because of work commitments.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products, meat, sugar, rice, butter, vegetables, and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre amable y sobre todo responsable, él es casado tiene 37 años, vive con su familia en una comunidad de San Andrés  Sementabaj.

Manuel es un hombre que le gusta convivir con la naturaleza,  pues para la generación de sus ingresos, él trabaja como agricultor desde hace diez años, este trabajo lo tiene a pocos metros de su casa, la especialidad de Manuel es el cultivo de arveja china, le gusta trabajar con este cultivo porque son muy pocas las personas que lo cultivan. Manuel quiere realizar más cultivos, pero la dificultad es que no cuenta con suficiente capital de trabajo para hacerlo, pues para solventar su necesidad, él está buscando un prestamo  de ocho mil quetzales, que lo utilizaría para la nueva inversión.
Manuel es un hombre muy disciplinado, él para aprovechar el tiempo instaló una tienda de consumo diario y este ingreso le ayudara   a complementar los gastos en su hogar, con estos ingresos Manuel saca abante a su familia. 

El sueño de Manuel  es seguir cultivando para generar más ingresos y así él puede apoyar a sus hijos en seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Manuel is a kind and above all responsible man. He is married, is 37 years old, and lives with his family in a community in San Andrés Sementabaj.

Manuel is a man who likes to live with nature. As such, to generate an income, he has worked as a farmer for ten years. This job lies a few meters from his home. Manuel’s specialty is the cultivation of sugar peas. He likes to work with this crop because there are few people who cultivate it. Manuel wants to produce more crops, but the difficulty he finds is that he does not have sufficient work capital to do so. In fact, to cover this necessity, he is looking for an eight-thousand-Quetzal loan, which he will use for the new investment.

Manuel is a very disciplined man. To take advantage of the time, he opened a store of daily commodities, and this income will help him to pay his home expenses. With these incomes, Manuel brings his family out ahead.

Manuel’s dream is to continue farming to generate more income and so he will be able to support his children to continue studying.

loans.use: to cultivate sugar peas.

loans.name: Elvia Liliana

texts.es:
Elvia, tiene 28 años, está casada, el marido tiene 28 años tienen 3 hijos viven en el sector de Agato en casa familiar. En la zona que ellos viven es turístico tiene artesanías, platos típicos que son un deleite para los turistas, pueden hacer turismo por la laguna de san pablo y también visitar el zoológico del sector que es un lugar muy visitando por los turistas extranjeros y nacionales.
Elvia, tiene su taller de confección de prendas de vestir donde elabora pijamas, sacos y las ofrece en el mercado de Imbabura y sus afueras, esta actividad lo empezó hace 8 años atrás con la ayuda de los familiares, la experiencia aprendió trabajando cuando era soltera y se decidió emprender esta actividad que hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos para todas las necesidades que hay en el mes. El crédito que solicito lo va invertir en la compra de materiales como hilos, tela para elaborar más prendas y otros diseños porque tiene pedidos y quiere terminar la entrega que tiene y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por todo el apoyo que le brindan con el capital y así seguir creciendo día a día con el negocio.
texts.en:
Elvia is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is 28 years old and they have 3 children and live in the Agato neighborhood in the family house. The area they live in is touristic and has artisans and traditional foods to delight the tourists. They can enjoy the San Pablo lagoon and visit the local zoo which is well visited by both nationals and foreigners.

Elvia has her clothing workshop where she makes pajamas and dresses and offers them in the market in Imbabura and the surrounding areas. She started this business 8 years ago with the help of her family. She gained experience working while she was single and decided to start this business which today is her source of income to all the needs they have in the month.

She will use the loan to invest in buying materials like thread and fabric to make more clothing and other designs as she has orders and she wants to fill them and continue to expand her business. She is grateful to Fundation Alternativa for all their support in offering capital so she can continue to expand her business day by day.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread and fabric so she cab make more designs, finish orders and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals such as chickens and pigs, and so make higher profits and help his parents.

loans.name: Kwamuka Group

texts.en:
Maria thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to buy different commodities, and this helped her to increase her profits. She is requesting another loan in order to increase the supply of her commodities by purchasing more stock.

With the profits from the previous loan, she is now able to provide basic needs to her children, and she is also able to pay for their school fees.

Maria plans to build a better house for her children and hopes to send them to private schools.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Don Juan, tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su esposa en un sector que pertenece al municipio de Cofradía, Cortes. Don Juan siempre ha buscado como generar sus ingresos, siempre a trabajado como jornalero  y hace 9 años decidió por dedicarse a la compra y recolección de artículos desechable para revender, recolecta o compra envases de plástico, artículos que tienen cobre, aluminio, acero, piezas de hierro y otros para venderlos en las fabricas de reciclaje. Ha invertido varios prestamos en su negocio para mantenerlo activo, actualmente solicita otro por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar un lote de desperdicios de hierro, cobre, aluminio y baterías en mal estado y revender. Su meta es obtener más ganancias para terminar de hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Juan is 63 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a sector of the municipality of Cofradía, Cortes. Juan is always looking for a way to generate income. He has always worked as a day laborer, but nine years ago he decided to start buying and gathering disposable materials to resell. He collects or buys plastic containers, copper, aluminum, or steel items, as well as pieces of iron, etc. to sell them to recycling facilities. Juan has invested various loans in his business in order to keep it going. Currently, he is requesting another 25,000 lempiras so that he can buy a lot of discarded iron, copper, aluminum, and batteries in bad condition and resell them. Juan's goal is to obtain more profits so that he can finish some improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy a plot of discarded iron, copper, aluminum, and batteries in bad condition and resell them.

loans.name: Abe Jean

texts.en:
Abe Jean is 21 years old and resides in Carles, Iloilo. She is single and works hard to be of help to her parents. In her business, she sells crude oil to fishermen and drivers in her community. 

Abe Jean is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy more crude oil to sell and increase her profits. Her income will enable her to pay for household expenses like food and the electricity bill.

In the future, Abe Jean would like to venture into other business opportunities to make her business and future more stable.

loans.use: to buy crude oil

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel se desataca en su comunidad por ser un hombre responsable, Manuel tiene una bonita familia de 4 hijos, él es casado tiene 47 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango. 
Manuel es un hombre muy perseverante todo por el bienestar de su familia, Manuel para lograr sus ingresos económicos, él se dedica a la venta de maíz, eligió esta actividad porque desde pequeño le entre al mundo del comercio, gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres. 
Manuel además de ser vendedor de maíz, él también cultiva de esta cosecha una parte le sirva para su consumo diario y la otra parte lo lleva a vender. Manuel para este año nuevamente vuelve a sembrar, es por eso que él anda en busca de un prestamo de tres mil quinientos quetzales que le servirá  para  comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para labrar la tierra para la implementación de la nueva cosecha.
 Manuel es un hombre muy disciplinado con su trabajo,  aparte de estos trabajos él trabaja también como guardián en un aserradero, para generar un ingreso más, de esta forma él puede cubrir todas las necesidades que se le presentan para la progreso de su familia. 
Las expectativas de Manuel es seguir trabajando duro para que sus hijos estudien hasta ser profesionales y también construirles casa para ellos.
texts.en:
Manuel stands out in his community as a responsible man. Manuel has a beautiful family with 4 children. He is married and is 47 years old. He lives in a community in Chichicastenango.

Manuel is a very persevering man especially as to the well-being of his family. Manuel in order to obtain his economic income works selling corn. He choose his activity as he entered the world of commerce very young, thanks to the teachings of his parents. Besides selling corn Manuel also grows this crop. Part of it is used for their daily use and the other part he sells.

For this new season Manuel is going to plant so he is looking for a loan of 3,500 GTQ which will serve him to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to work the land to prepare for the new crop. Manuel is very disciplined in his work and besides these activities he also works as a guard in a sawmill to create another income. Doing this he can cover all the needs that happen to move forward with his family. Manuel hopes to continue working hard so that his children can study to become professionals and also build houses for them.

loans.use: to grow corn.

loans.name: Luz Daris

texts.es: Luz Daris es una mujer de 31 años de edad, residente de un barrio ubicado en Cartagena de Indias la Ciudad amurallada. Esta mujer desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece servicios de estética, ella siempre le gustó todo lo relacionado con los tratamientos para el cuidado del cabello y las uñas, empezó a ofrecer en el año 2010 los servicios de manicure, pedicure, blower, cortes de cabello para damas, tinturaciones y masajes capilares, la gran mayoría de sus servicios se generan a domicilio en el horario de 8 a.m. a 10 p.m. todos los días y aunque es un horario bastante extenso su compromiso con el trabajo y sus deseos de cumplir propósitos y metas la fortalecen y la motivan a continuar con el ritmo laboral.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en productos de belleza como shampoo, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes y removedores.  Esta inversión hace más eficiente su labor y ofrecería servicios de mejor calidad.  Luz Daris es madre de dos hijos de 8 y 12 años, a quienes desea continuarles brindando bienestar y una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Luz Daris is 31-year-old woman who lives in a neighbourhood of Cartegena de Indias, the walled city. 

Luz offers beauty services from the comfort of her own home. She has always liked everything to do with hair care and nail treatments. In 2010, she started to offer manicures, pedicures, blow-dries, womens' haircuts, dying and head massages. She offers the large majority of her services from her home between the hours of 8 a.m. and 10 a.m every day. Although it's a rather extensive working day, she is committed to her work and her desire to keep her promises and reach her goals motivates her to keep up her pace of work. 

At the moment she is applying for her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest the loan in buying beauty products like shampoo, hair treatments, varnishing treatments and renewing treatments. 

This investment will help makes her work more efficient and she will be able to offer better-quality services. 

Luz Daria is the mother of two sons of 8 and 12. She hopes to continue providing a good wellbeing and excellent education.

loans.use: to invest in beauty products like shampoo, hair treatments, varnishing treatments and renewing treatments.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 42-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Zahida because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts.

Her husband wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories, but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Zahida humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Zahida is very glad and is thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery work.

loans.name: Jose Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 19 años, no tiene hijo, vive en casa familiar en el sector de Agato que pertenece a la provincia de Imbabura, cantón Otavalo, por el sector la mayoría de personas se dedican a las artesanías de diferentes modelos y diseños como las fajas para las indígenas del sector, también hacen lo que son las camisas otavaleñas y otras artesanías que son enviadas a otros países que turistas y nacionales lo usan, por el sector también hay turismo como la laguna de san pablo y sus alrededores.
Segundo tiene su pequeño taller de elaboración de artesanías como las fajas para las indígenas de la provincia y sus alrededores, el empezó hace 6 años atrás esta actividad porque la necesidad lo obligo y hoy en día es fuente de ingreso en su vida y de sus familiares, esta actividad le ha enseñado sus buenas y malas temporadas pero aun así lo sigue ejerciendo porque esto viene de tradición en tradición.
El crédito necesita para poder comprar más materiales como son hilos de lana para elaborar más prendas para ofrecer en el mercado y así seguir manteniendo sus clientes que son fieles a el y seguir incrementando día  a día su pequeño negocio, sus familiares le apoyan siempre en el negocio les ayuda en las ventas y ofreciendo en distintos mercado de la provincia.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le dan con el capital para seguir ejerciendo esta actividad y seguir incrementando su taller.
texts.en:
Segundo is 19  years old. He has no children and lives in his parents' house in the sector of Agato, which is located in the Imbabura province of the canton Otavalo. In this sector, the majority of residents make a living from handicrafts of different models and designs such as the indigenous belts of this region. He also makes Otavalan shirts and other crafts that are renowned throughout the world and sought after buy tourists and Ecuadorian nationals. In this sector, there is also much tourism to the San Pablo lake and its surrounding areas. 

Segundo has a small workshop where he makes handicrafts such as the indigenous belts of his province. He started this business six years ago because he needed the money. Today it is a source of income for his family. This business has good and bad seasons but Segundo keeps working because this activity is steeped in tradition.

Segundo needs this loan to buy more materials such as thread and wool so that he can make more garments to offer in the market. This will help him to keep up with demand from his customers, who are loyal to him and keep growing his business every day. Segundo's family always supports him in his business and help him to sell in the different markets of the province.

Segundo thanks the Fundación Alternativa for the support that this capital gives him so he can keep working and expanding his workshop.

loans.use: to buy more materials: thread and wool, so that he can continue filling his customers' orders.

loans.name: Arlyn Agapita

texts.es: Arlyn, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos, y reside en un sector que pertenece al municipio de Cofradía.  Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo ropa, calzado y achinería. Hace un año que ha decidido poner una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, azúcar, sal, pan, café, productos para aseo, refrescos, y otros abarrotes. Arlyn ha solicitado varios préstamos en la institución y actualmente ha solicitado otro por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar maíz y frijoles para vender en su pulpería. Su meta a futuro es comprar un vehículo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Arlyn is 33 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with her husband with whom she has 4 children. They reside in an area that belongs to the municipality of Cofradía. She has always worked in business selling clothing, footwear and knick-knacks.

A year ago she decided to open a store where she sells food products like rice, beans, lard, eggs, sugar, salt, bread, coffee, cleaning products, soft drinks and other groceries. Arlyn has requested several loans with the institution and currently is requesting a loan of 5000 HNL to buy corn and rice to sell in her store. Her goal for the future is to buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, está casada  tiene 25 años, es esposo tiene 29 años tienen 3 hijos que están estudiando viven en casa familiar en San Roque que pertenece a Atuntaqui Provincia de Imbabura.
Por el sector de San Roque hay talleres donde elaboran prendas de vestir las mismas que son artesanías que ofrecen dentro y fuera de la provincia productos que son de buena calidad y también hay turismo por el sector hay platos típicos como las fritadas con tostado.
Tiene su taller propio de elaboración de bolsos y carteras esto ya viene realizando hace varios años la misma que ha sido un negocio que empezó con su marido esto ya viene ejerciendo en el mercado de Imbabura ofreciendo sus productos a diferentes clientes ofrece varios colores de bolsos, carteras y así mismo ha sido fuente de ingreso para el hogar ayuda para los estudios de los hijos para que sigan unos buenos paso en sus vidas y ella quiere seguir manteniendo este negocio para toda la vida y que también sea vaya fortaleciendo de generación en generación que esto no se pierda por eso con el crédito que esta solicitando en Fundación Alternativa va comprar más materiales para hacer más productos y ofrecer en el mercado y seguir conociendo a mas compradores y que le vayan recomendando todo los productos que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Mercedes is married. She is 25 years old, and her husband is 29 years old. They have 3 children who are studying. They live in a family home in San Roque that belongs to the Atuntaqui province of Imbabura.

Throughout the San Roque sector there are workshops where clothing items are produced. These are crafts that are offered in and out of the province, products that are of good quality. There is also tourism throughout the sector. There are traditional foods such as fritadas with tostado.

She has her own purse and wallet workshop. She has already been performing this activity for many years, the same business that she began with her husband. She has already been practicing this profession in the market in Imbabura, offering her products to different customers. She offers a variety of colors of purses and wallets, and this has been a source of income for the home, and help for her children’s studies so that they follow good paths in their lives. She wants to continue maintaining this business for her whole life. She also hopes that it also continues to strengthen from generation to generation, and that it is not lost. 

Because of this, with the loan that she is requesting from Fundación Alternativa she is going to purchase more materials to make more products to offer in the market and continue meeting more cutomers, who will then recommend all of the products that she offers.

loans.use: to purchase more material, and so produce more products and be able to pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Judiah

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Judiah, a 27-year-old, jovial mother of three lovely children, whom she refers to as her “heartbeat.” Judiah hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, a place that has produced some top elite athletes for the world.

Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Judiah is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past five years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Judiah offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business.

Being a caring and loving mother, Judiah has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. Although Judiah reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is dragging her behind and preventing her from “reaching on top of the skies” is a lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Judiah is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities.

Having so much experience in farming, Judiah is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions. Judiah is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good-quality life and secure her children's future.

Judiah has gone through the repayment schedule and amount, and is comfortable with the plan. Judiah patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 52 years old. He lives in Martvili district with his pensioner mother. The only source of income for the family is a cow. Ivane's mother milks the cow every day and produces cheese to sell locally.

Ivane wants to build a greenhouse on the family-owned land and start an agribusiness. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,600 GEL. With the received credit, Ivane will purchase building materials for a greenhouse and then will also purchase seeds for cucumbers and tomatoes.

The Start Up program will be a great support for Ivane.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow cucumbers and tomatoes there.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grinder machine for shuttering work.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham es un hombre de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección de chamarras.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Tumusla’ un área caracterizada por el comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas. Talleres de sastrería, restaurantes de pollo frito, librería y todo tipo de comercios se encuentran lado a lado. De clima seco y frio, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-18 grados centígrados.
Abraham es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de chamarras, viven en una casa propia que está construida de ladrillo y techo de calamina, cuenta con electricidad, gas domiciliario, alcantarillado y agua potable. Su negocio es la confección de chamarras; dónde su creatividad y experiencia se ajustan a la medida de los clientes. Entre paños, linos, agujas y moldes han transcurrido los últimos 10 años, él confecciona chamarras por temporada y también modifica todo tipo de prendas según el capricho de sus clientes. En la mesa de corte es donde comienza la aventura; con agilidad, precisión, rapidez, esmero y dedicación, el resultado: una chamarra hecha a la medida. “la confección de chamarras de temporada consiste en elaborar prendas según la necesidades del cliente, actualmente es época escolar y me preparé desde diciembre para abastecer a los clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y vestir a todos los colegios de la zona. Él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser ‘collareta’ para doble costura. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Abraham solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser ‘collareta’ para incrementar la variedad de productos en oferta.
texts.en:
Abraham is a 27 year old man who lives with his wife. He has no children. His business is making jackets. He is enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in the 'Tumusia' area, an area of commerce and manufacturing of all kinds. Sewing workshops, fried chicken restaurants, bookstores and all kinds of businesses side by side. With a dry and cold climate and a temperature that varies during the day between 8 to 18 degrees Celsius.

Abraham is dark skinned, short in stature with short black hair. He speaks Aymara with his family and speaks Spanish because of the main culture and for his business. He shares his life with his spouse who works in the jacket business. They live in their own house which is made of brick and a metal roof and has electricity, gas, sewage and running water.

His business is making jackets where with his creativity and experience he adapts to the customer. Amongst cloth, linen, needles and patterns he has spent the last 10 years. He makes jackets for the season and also modifies any type of clothing according to the wishes of his client. The adventure starts on his cutting table. With agility, precision, quickness, care and dedication: the result. A jacket made to measure. "making seasonal jackets consists of making clothing according to the needs of the client. Right now it is the school year and I have been preparing since December to supply my clients." he commented.

His dream is to improve his business and dress all the schools in the area. He wants to expand his business by buying a coverstitch machine to make double seams. This is his first loan with the institution in the 10 years he has been running his business independently. For these reasons Abraham is requesting a loan to buy a coverstitch machine to increase the variety of products on offer.

loans.use: to buy an coverstitch sewing machine to increase the variety of products on offer.

loans.name: Eddie José

texts.es: Eddie es un microempresario emprendedor que a sus 40 años de edad y casado es propietario de un taller de calzado, este negocio lo aprendió gracias a su papá quien tenía un taller y ahí empezaron sus conocimientos en este negocio, luego de haber trabajado impulsó su propio negocio con ayuda de su papá hace diecinueve años, actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de tres trabajadores que son remunerados para aumentar la producción,  es el segundo ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos, lo que le permite comprar al por mayor y así tener el material suficiente en tiempo de escases. El crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como es galón de pega amarilla, pega blanca, conos de hilo, cuero sintético, forro fino, fibra, etc., esto le permitirá aumentar la producción y así cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Eddie is an enterprising small business owner who, at 40 years of age, is married and the owner of a shoe-making workshop. He learned this business thanks to his father, who had a workshop; Eddie's knowledge of this business began there. After working, he started his own business nineteen years ago with his father's help. He currently has three workers to help him who are paid to increase the production.  

This is the second cycle in which ADIM has provided him with financing that has allowed him to buy wholesale and thus have enough material in times of scarcity. He is asking for the current loan to buy raw material like a gallon of yellow glue, white glue, thread cones, synthetic leather, thin lining, fiber, etc. This will allow him to increase production and thus cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make shoes, which will allow him to increase production

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are medium. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 20 years. She operates a catering service business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more catering equipment. Her business goal is to be popular within the country and hire more staff within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more catering equipment

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be hardworking and optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular ones. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to open more branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells curtains and nets. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial constraints. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of curtains and nets. Her business goal is to open another business branch within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have increased profits. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of curtains and nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia, 41, is a married man from Kobuleti City. He is the father of three children and lives with his wife, who works as a tailor and generates 350 Georgian lari per month. This is the family's only source of income, as Gia has been unable to find a stable job, and the children are school-aged.
 
To do his part for the family's welfare, Gia has decided to start his own private business activity. Specifically, he would like to purchase all the tools and machinery he needs to start working as a private artisan. He will renovate houses and also will work as an electrician. 

According to Credo's estimations, this family belongs to the "vulnerable poor" category. Gia has requested a loan from Credo to start a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages the provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income. The income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions. Gia awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase tools and machinery to start working as an artisan

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar  is 47 years old. She is a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchasing and sales, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is a 52-year-old gardener. He is married and has a daughter and two sons. His wife is a houskeeper and takes care of the family. The family lives in the Agsu region. It's very beautiful land, full of beautiful natural places. This region is rich with beautiful gardens, and Kamran has a nice small garden where he raises seasonal fruits, greens and vegetables.

Kamran has been working as a gardener for 30 years and has good skills in this are. His monthly income is 190 AZN, but this doesn't cover the family's demands. Kamran raises his harvest and sells it to local bazaars and restaurants. 

Now Kamran wants to expand his business. He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to build a small grocery next to his house to sell his harvest. Kamran plans to expand his business in the future, and his eldest son will help him.

loans.use: to build a small grocery to sell his harvest

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a poultry farm. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are medium. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of poultry. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved profits and better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, milk, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a developing area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, milk, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will meet his financial needs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice , milk, flour and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her father. She resides in the family house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for a market stall and school fees.

Mary has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years. She works at the market seven days a week on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She aspires to owning a delivery van for transportation and to educating her children through university.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is married with three children, one of whom goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for many years. She works six days a week. She earns additional income from charcoal. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements, and transportation. She aspires to find a permanent residence. She resides in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit and partly for the renovation of her apartment for rent as well. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good outcome from her businesses, for it surely helps fund their daily needs and the school requirements of her children.

Milagros dreams of adding more units to her apartment to improve their quality of living. She prays for a happy and abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle and renovation of her apartment for rent.

loans.name: Pirisla

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Pirisla. She is a 44-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nyamira, which is a small rural town in Nyanza Kenya. Pirisla and her husband have been blessed with three children. 

For 10 years, Pirisla has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. 

Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Pirisla, however, is taking this a little step further. Pirisla is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Susan, who is 36 years old and very hardworking, honest and humble. She hails from Nyamira, Kenya, an area that is blessed with elite and world-renowned runners and also has the best weather patterns, which favour farming activities. 

Susan is a proud mother of three children whom she really loves and adores. She will do anything in her power to always give them the best. She has been farming for the past eight years and, through these years, has always provided them with all the basic needs that they require. 

Susan practices mixed farming -- that is, crop and animal farming -- and she has been able to support her family through these two activities. But she still faces challenges, which is why she wants to diversify and start poultry farming to make ends meet. 

She is seeking a loan to buy poultry. With the increased income, she believes that she will be able to comfortably take care of her family and assure her children a secure future. 

Susan has experienced difficulties in acquiring funds to start her poultry business. Now she feels relieved to know that Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and other lenders to support aspiring women like herself to become economically empowered and be able to realize their dreams. 

Because of the many years that Susan has been farming, she has learned the culture of saving and being honest with money. Through this loan, she hopes to be able to save more and repay the loan on time. She believes that the loan will assist her in improving her living conditions and securing the future of her children and the siblings who depend on her.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Hector Alexander

texts.es:
Héctor vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Héctor es un joven de 24 años, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña nena en una casa arrendada. Trabaja todos los días vendiendo vestidos para fiestas, el recorre dentro de la ciudad a distribuirle a pequeños comerciantes y los fines de semana viaja a la ciudad de Esmeraldas a vender a almacenes, este negocio lo heredó de su madre hace muchos años, ella falleció y el siguió vendiendo;  comenta que le va muy bien gracias a estos ingresos él ha podido manutener a su familia. 
Héctor con el crédito otorgado podrá comprar vestidos de satín, así podrá dar más variedad a su clientela, además va a comprar accesorios para bautizos y quinceañeras ya que esto le falta en su negocio. Está feliz porque la institución le dio la mano, agradece enormemente al equipo de Fundación Alternativa por apoyarle en este negocio.
texts.en:
Héctor lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city in the coastal region with a pleasant climate. It is a very busy commercial city, as it is considered to be a land port where the mountains and the coast meet. 

Héctor is a 24-year-old young man. He lives with his wife and their small daughter in a house they rent. He works every day selling party dresses; he travels around the city to distribute them to small merchants, and on weekends, he travels to the city of Esmeraldas to sell to department stores. He inherited this business from his mother many years ago; she died and he continued selling. He says that his business is going well and that thanks to his earnings he has been able to maintain his family. 

With the loan granted, Héctor will be able to buy satin dresses and thus provide his customers with more variety. He will also buy accessories for baptisms and fifteenth birthday parties, as his business needs these. He is happy that the institution is helping him; he is enormously grateful to the team at Fundación Alternativa for supporting him in this business.

loans.use: to buy satin dresses and accessories for baptisms and fifteenth birthday parties, increasing the variety for his customers to keep maintaining his family

loans.name: Titukulane Group

texts.en:
Being granted the previous loan, Sella used it to buy more fish and this increased the demand of her commodities. She used the profits gained to build a better house for her family. 

She wants to obtain another loan in order to buy different kinds of fish such as usipa, chambo, and kapenta. Buying different kinds of fish will help her to have a diversity of businesses.

She plans on sending her children to private schools and hopes to adequately improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet drinking water for resale to his clients

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario San Antonio lo integran tres socios trabajadores, que motivados por el mejoramiento de vida de sus familias solicitan por tercera ocasión el financiamiento de ADIM para sus negocios. Este grupo es coordinado por la señora Josefa que tiene la edad de 50 años y se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados de la capital, cuenta con una experiencia de veinte años en lo que es la comercialización de estos productos, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en tamarindo, yuca, ayote y pipian, ya que son los que mayor demanda tienen, los créditos anteriores le han permitido cubrir la demanda de los productos de acuerdo a la temporada. El resto de los socios son el señor Henry que tiene la edad de 27 años y comercializa frutas y verduras tanto en el mercado de la municipalidad como en uno de los mercados capitalinos desde hace cinco años, y la señora María Lucrecia, quien comercializa frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados capitalinos y cuenta con una experiencia de quince años.
texts.en:
The San Antonio communal bank consists of three working members who are requesting their third loan from ADIM for their businesses in order to improve their families' lives.

The group is led by Josefa, who is aged 50 and sells fruit and vegetables at one of the markets in the capital. She has been selling these products for twenty years. She is requesting this loan to buy tamarind, cassava, and squash, as these are the products most in demand. The previous loans have allowed her to meet the demands for different seasonal products.

The other members are Henry, aged 27, who has been selling fruit and vegetables both in the local market and one of the markets in the capital for five years, and María Lucrecia who also sells fruit and vegetables in one of the markets in the capital, and has 15 years experience.

loans.use: to buy tamarind, cassava, and squash, as these are the products most in demand

loans.name: Tres Cruces De Oro Group

texts.es:
La socia Eusebia pertenece al banco comunal  TRES CRUCES DE ORO, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo, distrito de Challabamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Eusebia tiene 8 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al cultivo de cereales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito  otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican la venta de cerelaes, materiales de construccion, ganaderia, crianza de animales.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Eusebia belongs to the Tres Cruces de Oro communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Paucartambo, district of Challabamba and department of Cusco. Eusebia has eight children and she is separated. She alternates her daily activities and makes a living by growing grains. She has had her business for a long time and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into it each day. She wants to keep working in order to keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with her established payments.

The other members make a living by selling grains, construction materials, cattle, and raising animals. The member in the attached photograph asked for permission to arrive at the meeting late for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Meet Grace, a small-scale farmer in Nyamira, Kenya. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her three children. 

For the last 10 years, she has been growing maize on the piece of land and keeping dairy cows. She has managed to make a living selling the maize grains to millers after the harvest. She is also involved in other small personal businesses to make extra money. 

Recently, Grace started keeping poultry for fun. She liked the fact that she could wake up in the morning and collect eggs for her family's breakfast. She started looking at poultry as a business when she had more hens and surplus eggs for breakfast. She started selling eggs to neighbors. More neighbors kept coming, wanting more and more every day. 

Grace seeks a loan to purchase poultry. She can hardly meet the demand as it is today. Her major challenge is raising funds. She was, however, referred to Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner, by a well-wisher. 

With your loan, Grace will grow her poultry business to the next level. The extra income will meet her high business-related costs. The loan will help her family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Hello from Kericho, Kenya! Meet Joseph, a 41-year-old hardworking, humble and loving man who cherishes his family so much. Joseph is a proud father of lovely children who he really loves, and you can always notice a pleasant feeling when he arrives at the house every day in the evening. 

Joseph is a passionate farmer who has been doing farming for the past 12 years. He possesses a wealth of experience, and most of the villagers come for farming advice from him. 

Joseph practices mixed farming through keeping dairy animals and doing crop farming, and through this, he has been able to provide a decent life to his family. Although he has been making profits, the income he is getting is not enough to fully satisfy his basic needs. That is why he has decided to keep poultry as a way of making ends meet. 

Joseph is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to buy poultry and use the space in his farm to make more profits. The Kericho area is known to have demand for eggs and poultry products. Therefore, Joseph is sure of a ready market, and this has really motivated him to turn his dream into reality. Being a very hardworking man, Joseph sells the fruits of his labour in the nearby markets and will also want to do the same with the poultry products, hence creating more income. 

Joseph is very keen to provide all the necessities to his family and is sure that through the loan, he will be able to achieve this target. Joseph has always wanted to turn his dream into reality. Knowing that there are people and institutions that support and generate opportunities to progress, he feels so much relived and knows that he will be able to realize his dream. 

Joseph is planning to open a very big shop that will not only be selling eggs but also selling poultry products such as medicine for poultry and also feeds. Through profits from the business, Joseph will be able to repay the loan and improve his living conditions and also provide a secure future for his children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, who is a 26-year-old young woman, lives in Kobuleti city. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a joiner who generates approximately 350 GEL monthly. 

In order to make her own activity and do her bit for the family's welfare, Ekaterine started an agribusiness. In particular, she takes care of a milk cow and produces cheese and yogurt for local trading. Ekaterine also works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and selling them at the local market. 

To generate more income and make a better style of life for her family, Ekaterine has a great desire to start pig breeding. Ekaterine has requested a Credo loan for expanding an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Ekaterine will build a pigsty and purchase pigs for further selling. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will significantly increase. Ekaterine will be able to create better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to build a pigsty and purchase pigs for selling

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab is a 50-year-old married man from Kobuleti district. He lives with his son and wife, who works as a babysitter at a local kindergarten. Merab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has some nut and walnut trees and also a cow. The family sells the harvested products and cheese locally. Merab decided to expand his husbandry business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 laris (GEL). With the received credit, he will purchase pigs and build a shed for them. Merab will expand the farm gradually in the future. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and build a shed in order to expand his husbandry business gradually

loans.name: Jay Ambe Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
High-school educated Lilaben (seen at center) runs a small general shop in the rural Dahod district of Gujarat, in western India. She buys products such as wafers, tea, sugar, and chocolate in bulk from the wholesale market in town, and sells them in her neighborhood through her small shop. Each month, this 32-year-old mother of three contributes to 40% of her family’s monthly income. She sets aside the entire amount as savings, and runs the house with only her husband’s earnings of  6,000 INR each month. Lilaben has a singular goal: to see that all her three children receive a college education and uplift themselves. She is always on the lookout for ways to improve her savings so she can realize this goal. She is aware that their current financial situation is quite inadequate.

Now, Lilaben wants to grow her general shop’s revenues and profits by catering to more local customers. She also plans to negotiate better rates with her suppliers by increasing the size of her stock orders. She specifically wants to purchase more of the popular wafers and chocolate, and stock up on the quick-selling sugar and tea. She estimates this will boost her profits by 6,000 INR each month. Of this, she plans to add 2,000 INR to her monthly savings, boosting it by 50%. The rest, she will reinvest in growing her business further. 

This bold plan needs capital, and local banks do not provide microcredit to borrowers like Lilaben. So, Lilaben has banded together with two more women with similar goals: Gendiben also runs a general shop, and Ratniben sells vegetables. Their incomes keep their families financially afloat, and they want to save more. Together, they seek to crowdfund 45,000 INR as a loan to invest in the growth of their respective microenterprises. They will repay the amount with their increased earnings.

Your loan will help Lilaben work towards her goal of educating her children, and will, similarly, empower her group members to better their lives. They are truly grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy wafers, tea, sugar, and chocolate as inventory for growing her general shop microenterprise.

loans.name: Entreprise Mon Goût

texts.en:
Djimi won a regional prize in an entrepreneurship contest a few years ago. He invested his money to launch his company with a single product: patés.

Since his childhood, Djimi has been attracting people's attention through his involvement in the socio-economic life of his town. Recently, he started producing homemade sandwiches for customers. But Djimi's company faces some problems: he still uses charcoal ovens for baking pies, which is harmful to the environment and the company's production quality.

Djimi would like to end the use of charcoal. To do so, he needs to buy new equipment to help protect the environment, and to produce in better hygienic conditions. Therefore, he turns to Zafèn for a soft loan.

loans.use: to buy a propane gas oven, a microwave, a propane tank (100 lbs.), a small table, 12 molds, and some raw materials.

loans.name: Dulce Amistad Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Dulce amistad lo integran tres jóvenes emprendedores que solicitan por quinta ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM con el objetivo de incrementar el capital de trabajo. Quien lo coordina es el joven Marvin que tiene la edad de 20 años, soltero, cuenta con una experiencia de cuatro años en lo que es la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cajas de tomate, baldes de chiltoma, saco de cebolla y chayote, él asegura que estos son los productos que mayor demanda tiene en estos productos; con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos que ofrece. Otro de los integrantes es Sulma que tiene la edad 25 años y ofrece el servicio de comida y fritanga los fines a trabajadores de empresas cercanas a su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace cinco años, y el último integrante es Saúl un joven que tiene la edad de 21 años y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva tanto en su domicilio y ambulante, esto por más de un año.
texts.en:
The "Dulce Amistad" solidarity group has three enterprising young members who are asking for financing from ADIM for the fifth time in order to increase their working capital. 

Marvin is the young man who coordinates the group; he is 20 years old and single and has four years' experience selling fruits and vegetables in the busiest market in the city. He is asking for the current loan to buy boxes of tomatoes, pails of peppers, bags of onions and squash. He asserts that these are the products that have the highest demand. With the previous loans he was able to increase and diversity the products he offers

Sulma is another of the members; she is 25 years old and sells fried and other food to company employees near her home. She started this business five years ago. The last member is Saúl, a 21-year-old young man who has made a living by selling new clothing in his home and in an itinerant fashion for more than a year.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions and squash

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Borrower Mariam is a 20-year-old Lebanese married woman with no kids so far. She runs an informal hair salon at home. She is a hardworking woman and tries as much as possible to contribute to the financial sufficiency of her family.

Through the loan she will obtain from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she is planning to purchase equipment and tools to properly equip her business to better serve her growing clientele.

In the future, she aims at developing her business to meet the potential demand, and maybe open a fully equipped hair salon, thus improving the standard of living of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to properly equip her business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Agustina works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Agustina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Analyn is 21 years old, and has one child in school.

Analyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and other materials needed.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cynthia is 57 years old, and has one child in school.

Cynthia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cynthia has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, paint, nails, polish and aluminum plates.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

'I used to work as a messenger in a bank, but I realized I could do much better things with my life so I decided to go into arts, especially carving. I did not really undergo any actually training, but started carving bit by bit and sometimes sought help from my other colleagues. Sometimes I assisted them too. Eventually I became very skilled in carving and I then decided to settle for full time carving and depend solely on my own ideas to carve. Now I have assistants and I also train other carvers.'

'I urge you all to please continue your efforts to help us artisans. We really benefit a lot from the support you are giving to us through this microcredit.'

Use the link below to view Samuel's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2104

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, paint, nails, polish and aluminum plates

loans.name: Komang

texts.en:
Komang is an artisan who specializes in sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for his designs.

Komang has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

'When I was 10 years old, my parents, who are master silversmiths, told me to learn about making jewelry. I love this job! The nicest part of my jewelry is the uniqueness of its style. Although it shows an ethnic influence; it's different.'

'From Bali with love ... I'd like to send you my many thanks for all the support. This microcredit will allow me to buy the raw materials I need in order to expand my small business. My wife and I would like to start off the new year on the right foot, with lots of work for all the artisans at our workshop.'

Use the link below to view Komang's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8459

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for his designs

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in hand-woven tapestries. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sheep wool and alpaca fibers.

Raul has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

'After secondary school, I dedicated my energy to painting, cultivating the skills of a self-taught artist. My father taught me to weave in the San Pedro de las Cajas style. I love to paint and I love to weave. They are both a form of expression and often, after I explore a theme in my weaves, I will repeat them on the canvas.'

'Muchisimas gracias! Thanks to this microcredit, I will have the funds I need to increase my product count and, hopefully, increase sales.'

Use the link below to view Raul's hand-woven tapestries on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/735

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sheep wool and alpaca fibers

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo, who works alongside his wife, Ubaldina, is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in Cuzco ceramics. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including clay and paint, as well as to bring on more ceramic artisans to help at the family workshop.

Gerardo has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

'Our family's journey in the ceramic arts has been influenced by the customs and lifestyles of my village, a village of ceramic artisans. We dress our jars and decorative plates in beautiful designs from ancient Peru. Each carries the powerful, elemental mystery of water and earth. In our home-based workshop we also teach other ceramists in our tradition, and many have stayed to work with us.'

'We'd like to send our gratitude and blessings to everyone who contributes to this microcredit. We really appreciate your support.'

Use the link below to view Gerardo's Cuzco ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1562

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including clay and paint, as well as to bring on more ceramic artisans to help at the family workshop

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando (pictured at right), who works alongside his brother, Luis, is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in Cuzco-style ceramics. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including dyes and clay.

Rolando has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

'My parents taught us to appreciate the importance of Cuzco ceramic art from a very young age. We so wanted to help out that we would paint plates and offer them to our parents to sell, who instead treasured them. Our motivation comes from our admiration of Inca artistry and customs. Our compositions reveal the human aspect of this millenary culture. We describe this kind of work as art that breathes life into any setting.’

'I'd like to thank the many friends who support us from afar through this microcredit. This loan will allow us to craft more items, which we do with great pride and much love.'

Use the link below to view Rolando's Cuzco-style ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6678

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including dyes and clay

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including silver and semi-precious gemstones.

Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

'Ever since I can remember, I've always enjoyed painting and designing. So I studied graphic design. However, my wife and her family have been crafting jewelry for generations, and slowly I started designing jewelry. Soon it became my passion. My wife enjoys practicing the techniques her father taught her and eventually we realized it was better to leave the crafting to her, the designing to me. We only get one life to live, and that's why my constant challenge is to succeed every day a little bit more so I can provide a better future for my wife and family.'

'I'd like to thank everyone who plays a part in making this microcredit possible. With these funds I will be able to acquire the raw materials I need to be able to keep up with demand.'

Use the link below to view Antonio's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8656

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including silver and semi-precious gemstones

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in African drums. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including drum shells, leather and cord.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

'After finishing my studies in general arts, I decided to get involved in art work full time. I especially enjoy woodcarving – drums to be specific. I moved back with my mother, and then underwent a three-year training period. Today I am a master training three boys in the art of African drum-making.'

'You all make things easier for me by always being there to assist whenever I need help. God bless you all.'

Use the link below to view Samuel's African drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2289

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including drum shells, leather and cord

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sand paper, nails and polish.

Robert has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

'I left my brother's workshop to start on my own. Presently, I work along with expert artists, all designers and carvers. I focus on design and work with local Ghanaian woods. I love my art and I hope to produce more interesting designs for my customers.'

'I thank you all so much. Without your support, some of us would find it difficult to continue crafting. I am very grateful.'

Use the link below to view Robert's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2538

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sand paper, nails and polish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 30 m3 waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Kishan Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
47-year-old Shardaben, standing in the center among her group members, is the matriarch of a family in the western Indian state of Gujarat. Settled in the semi-rural part of the Ahmedabad district, her family of four survives on a monthly income of 12,500 INR. Extremely diligent with her finances, Shardaben saves almost half of this amount to build a financially stable future for her family. She also runs her own handicraft business, which contributes towards 20% of her family’s income. 

She uses string to weave together artificial gemstones, fake pearls, and beads to make beautiful "rakhis." These rakhis are ceremonial threads that Indian sisters tie to their brothers’ wrists, seeking a promise of love and brotherly protection. Her business sees a huge boost in sales and profits during the Raksha Bandhan festival around August. Shardaben spends the preceding months working hard to prepare for this boost. Handicraft businesses like hers from Ahmedabad source rakhis to expat Indian communities around the world. 

Hoping to deliver on a bigger order for rakhis this year, Shardaben wants to buy more raw materials, like beads and artificial gemstones and pearls. The capital she needs to make this purchase, however, is a too small for local banks to finance.
