Unwilling to rely on private local lenders who charge exploitative interest rates, she has formed a group with four other local micro-entrepreneurs. Ramilaben and Kantaben make rakhis, Rekhaben sells decoration items, and Monaben runs a small provisions store. All these five women want to grow their respective microenterprises and better provide for their families. Together, they seek a loan of 75,000 INR, which they will repay in monthly installments from their increased incomes. 

Your loan will help Shardaben boost her income by an impressive 60%, and will set five families on the path to a financially stable future. Shardaben and her group members thank you for your timely support in their endeavors.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like beads and artificial gemstones to make more handicraft "rakhis" for sale.

loans.name: Shyam Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
24-year-old Jyotsnaben (at center in the picture) is the young mother of a toddler from the Ahmedabad district of Gujarat, in western India. Educated till high school, she hopes to see her child receive a college education. To that end, enterprising young Jyotsnaben started her own tailoring microenterprise. She takes orders from local customers, and sews dresses, curtains, and falls and interlocks for the traditional Indian saris that her clients prefer to wear. 

Her small young family lives off an income of 11,500 INR each month, and she contributes 3,500 INR to these earnings. Diligently, she sets aside 3,000 INR in savings each month. As Jyotsnaben lives in semi-urban Gujarat, there is never a shortage of orders. Seeing the potential for growth, she wants to buy a better professional sewing machine. The upgrade will help her increase her productivity and bring in an extra 2,500 INR each month. This will help Jyotsnaben grow her monthly savings by more than 80%. By the time her child is of school-going age, the savings she is building will cover fees for a good local school.

Jyotsnaben has her plans all laid out, and the only thing stopping her now is a lack of funds to invest in the new sewing machine. Undaunted, she has formed a joint-liability group with four of her friends who also seek to grow their own small microenterprises. Three of her group members are also seamstresses, and a fourth sells ready-made garments. Together, they seek a loan of 75,000 INR to invest in their respective small businesses. Being a joint-liability group, they will hold each other accountable to use the funds wisely and make the loan repayments on time. 

Your loan will help Jyotsnaben and her group take a crucial step towards realizing their business potential and goals for their families. They are grateful for your timely support.

loans.use: to buy a better sewing machine and increase the productivity and profits of her small tailoring business.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.en:
Ana Laura is married and has a daughter. She has a food stall were she sells snacks. Her mother helps with the food stall because Ana Laura has an additional job as an operator in a Walmart store. 

Ana Laura is asking for a loan to buy a used truck to transport her food stall and snacks. She says that this will help her reduce transportation costs and time. This is her second loan with Kubo Financiero, and she paid back the first one on time.

loans.use: to buy a used truck to transport her food stall and snacks.

loans.name: Cirinia

texts.en: Cirinia, 54, is a widow with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 11 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Her name is Rosalie; she is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, a toll operator, and she has children who are working. She and her husband work hard to provide for their daily personal and household needs.

Rosalie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines; people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. She also has a small general store, and sells mineral water as well. She earns a minimum of Php1,500 in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan which she will use to buy recyclable materials from collectors, and partly to add some grocery items to her general store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Her earnings help fund their living expenditures. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given her.
  
Rosalie aims for her businesses to prosper to help her grandchildren attend school. She prays that her family will be found faithful, and live a life pleasing to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials like plastics, metals, and other recyclable materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and married and has three children, who are all in school. She lives in the Philippines and is in the agricultural business, raising pigs. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 53 years old, and has one child in school.

Elizabeth has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of used clothes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married. She has nine children, five of whom are in school. She lives in the Philippines and is in the agricultural business, farming rice. Susan has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it. Susan's future goal is to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.en: Evaristo has been a Kubo client for more than two years. He has taken three loans and has always paid them on time. Evaristo is asking for a loan to make improvements on his home. He works buying and selling timber and formwork and has been doing it for more than 20 years. He lives with his wife and says that they have a very solid marriage.

loans.use: to make improvements on his home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 48 años de edad, él es una persona muy perseverante,  es casado tiene 7 hijos, ellos viven en una comunidad de Chichicastengo. 

Juan es  un padre de familia muy disciplinado y por lo mismo ha logrado la superación con sus hijos, él desde hace mucho tiempo viene trabajando como albañil, aprendió esta actividad porque desde temprana edad acompañaba su padre al trabajo, pues por la  pobreza  en que vivían  sus padres él no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar no le quedaba de otra que acompañar a su papá, pues con esta trabajo Juan genera su economía.  

Pero  cuando Juan no tiene trabajo de albañilería, él sale a trabaja como jornalero con sus vecinos,  Juan manifiesta  que no es bueno saber un solo trabajo,  Juan con el esfuerzo que ha hecho ahora ya tiene hijos grandes y ellos con sus ingresos aportan también a los gastos de la familia.  De esta forma ellos van luchando por sobrevivir. Pues ahora Juan logro construir una casa, pero aún hace falta la remodelación de las dos habitaciones  de  su vivienda, pero ya no cuenta con capital  para hacer ese trabajo, pues él busca un prestamo para culminarlo,  para pagar el prestamo contara con el apoyo de s sus hijos.  
El anhelo de esta familia y sobre todo del papá es poder empezar con la remodelación para que mis hijos tengan un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Juan, aged 48, is a very determined man, he is married with seven children, and they live in a community in Chichicastengo.

Juan is a disciplined head of the household, who has succeeded in becoming successful with his children. For a long time he has been working as a builder. He learned this trade due to accompanying his father to work from a young age, which he had to do since his parents' poverty meant he did not have the opportunity to study, so this is how Juan earns a living.

But when Juan does not have building work, he works as a day laborer with his neighbors. Juan says that it is not good to only know one profession. From the effort he has put in, Juan now has adult children, who with their incomes also support the family's costs. In this way they are fighting for their survival. Now Juan has managed to build a house, but still needs to refurbish the two bedrooms although he does not have the funds to do this. He is requesting a loan to finish the job. He will have his children's support when it comes to repaying the loan.

The family's wish, and above all the father's wish is to be able to start with the refurbishment so that his children can have a good home.

loans.use: to refurbish his bedrooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam paid her first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan. She says she will use the loan to continue investing in her business that sells baby care products. Her biggest accomplishments are owning a house and starting and maintaining her business. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her baby care products business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
Chucalibal is a rural community outside of Chichicastenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Some time ago, nine enthusiastic women formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Maria del Rosario” group with the goals of developing themselves and their small businesses and helping their families.

Juana is a 32-year-old member of the Trust Bank who is married with a large family. She has five children who range in age from 1 1/2 years to 13 years. Juana had limited access to education, but because of her vision of a better life and the responsibilities of so many children, she has been highly motivated to succeed in her small businesses. Juana has a small convenience store as well as a bookstore. The businesses are open from Monday through Saturday, 6 a.m to 7 p.m. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase oil, sugar, rice, beans, noodles and eggs for the convenience store. Juana also plans to buy useful school supplies for the bookstore such as pencils, pens, paper and notebooks. There is a lot of demand right now as the new school year has just begun.

Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer comes to the meeting of the Trust Bank. She oversees business transactions on the loans and then, in the indigenous language of the women, shares practical information with them. This combination of small loans and education is what Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus." The ladies learn to successfully manage their loans when they learn about budgeting, pricing, marketing, accounting and customer service. They learn to value themselves when they learn about self esteem, women’s rights, sexual violence and leadership.

Kiva lenders are much appreciated partners with Friendship Bridge in this effort. The ladies send their thanks. We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the near future. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, rice, beans, noodles and eggs for the convenience store.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to Aurelia as a rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Aurelia perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Erye Floridel

texts.en: Erye Floridel is single. She busies herself with selling health products and food supplements. She is able to support her parents with their daily needs and the education of her two siblings. Erye Floridel is into the dealership of health products and food supplements and wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding needs and applied for a loan of PHP 40,000. She is happy to earn an income of PHP 8,000 per month. She hopes to open a store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of the jeepney. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for the regular maintenance of her jeepney. It is important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be extended to her and for the safety of her passengers. 
 
Cecilia dreams to increase her jeepneys, and give her family a good life. She aims for her children to finish school and earn a college degree to allow them better opportunities for their future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy natural and organic vitamins to sell. Her earnings helped fund their daily expenses, and the school needs of her children. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy additional natural and organic food supplements such as coffee and multivitamins to meet the advanced orders of her regular customers.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it helps cover their daily sustenance and their children's education. 

Rosario dreams for her direct selling business to grow and prosper. She prays that they will remain faithful to God, and someday own a house and lot for her family.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional natural and organic food supplements

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods and cellular phone loads, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs, and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Amy dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life.  Each week, she meets up with fellow members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase several gallons of water. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy additional stocks of mineral water which she sells at retail. She has to meet the increasing orders of her mineral water. Her earnings help to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jenefer dreams of having another business, and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 29 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Lani has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed from NWTF once in the past to sustain it.

Lani's goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Concesa

texts.en:
Concesa is 63 years old and married. She has eight children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Concesa has been farming rice for 15 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 11 times in the past to sustain her business. Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Murama Kweterana Group

texts.en:
The man in the group photo with his hand raised is Jackson, a member of the Murama Kweterana Group. He is a 40-year-old man, married with five children who all attend school. 

Jackson works in agriculture, specifically banana production and coffee planting. He produces 20 bunches per week which he sells to get money and meet his financial needs for things like school fees. Besides agriculture, Jackson is also a professional primary school teacher at one of the primary schools in his village. His salary supplements his income. 

Jackson applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers to increase his production. Jackson joined Ugafode under the Murama Kweterana Group with four other members. As a group they took a loan of 4,300,000 UGX to improve on their sources of income and be able to meet all their families' financial obligations. They are happy with the financial support from Ugafode and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Bella Ruth

texts.en:
Bella Ruth is a 56-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines and has a business selling used clothing, which she has been in for three years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy blouses, shirts, pants, etc. to sell.

Bella Ruth successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested this new loan to further build her businesses. Her goal is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lolita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 37 years old with four children. With three children in school, Marianita works very hard to provide for them.

Marianita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, etc..

Marianita has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus makes a living through his retailing business. He runs a lumberyard in Siquijor and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. He wants to increase his inventory. Now, he availed himself of a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. Jesus hopes to sustain his business and dreams of sending all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en: Marcos is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in hand-crafted wall mirrors. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including high-quality dry wood. Marcos has been selling through Novica since 2004. This is his story: 'I am a self-taught artist who began to work at the age of 17 at a neighbor's workshop. After a year, I decided to venture on my own, gradually gaining renown for the beauty and quality of my work. I have now been dedicated to this craft for over 35 years and to me it feels like only yesterday when I began. Woodwork makes me feel good about myself because it means it's a way of preserving an aspect of Peruvian artistry.' 'Because of the rainfall this past winter, I had to add a roof to my workshop -- which has left me short on capital. This microcredit would give me the support I need to continue growing my business. I have an opportunity right now to acquire dry wood in bulk at a good price, and this investment will allow me to keep crafting and maintain a good level of inventory.' Use the link below to view Marcos's hand-crafted wall mirrors on the Novica site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4505

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including high-quality dry wood

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in African masks and carvings. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and sandpaper. Emmanuel has been selling through Novica since 2000. This is his story: 'After completing a course in auto mechanics, getting a job was difficult and neither my parents nor I could afford the high cost of the machinery I would need to set up on my own. I struggled by doing menial jobs, but I managed to save what I could until I had enough money to buy a small piece of land and raise a wooden store. I started buying finished carvings, and in the evenings I learned to carve these beautiful items. My inspiration comes through dreams, so when I wake up I immediately put the design on paper in order not to lose the idea.' 'I am grateful to each of the contributors and pray that you will continue to assist us. Thank you!' Use the link below to view Emmanuel's masks and carvings on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/1536

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and sand paper

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
Made is an artisan from Bali who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for her designs. Made has been selling through Novica since 2002. This is her story: 'I come from a village long renowned as Bali's center of silver production. My father was one of the senior silversmiths, well trained in the jewelry arts. He taught me from when I was 12 years old until I got married. Though I graduated in anthropology, I decided to set up a workshop with my husband. We are able to offer employment to more silversmiths in our village, and we specialize in traditional motifs and designs.' 'Happy 2015! Thanks so much for the ongoing support. I am hoping to add new designs to my collection and increase my inventory here in the new year, so I will use this microcredit to buy silver and gemstones. I hope you will continue to support me and the small team of silversmiths who work together with me.' Use the link below to view Made's silver and gemstone jewelry on the Novica site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2974

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for her designs

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is a 54-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines, who has a manicure and pedicure business.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials that she needs for her business.

Hilaria has been in this business for five years. Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials that she needs for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson is a businessman in Siquijor. He is 44 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Jefferson runs a retail store selling round log sticks for carpentry. Running this type of business has supported his family, especially in the education of his children. Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for more inventory of round logs for stick cutting to sell. Jefferson believes having enough inventory would allow him to cater to his customers' needs. He is thankful that he has signed up for membership with PMPC as his financing partner.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of round logs for stick cutting to sell

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña María es una mujer luchadora y que demuestra que a sus 64 años aún se puede seguir superando, ella ofrece el servicio de comida como es fritanga, cuenta con una experiencia de veintidós años en lo que es ofertar estos productos, es el décimo noveno ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento y ha demostrado ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, repollo, tomate, cebolla, salsa de tomate, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, y ha logrado la compra de utensilios para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a tenacious woman who shows that at 64 years of age she is still able to continue to get by.  She sells snack foods.  She has 22 years of experience in selling these products.  It is her 19th cycle with ADIM providing a loan.  She has shown herself to be a hard-working woman who is responsible about her obligations.

She is requesting the loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans, cooking oil, green bananas, ripe bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and tomato sauce, etc.  With the previous loans she managed to improve the condition of her business, and she has managed to buy utensils for her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y trabaja como chofer.
Él es independiente, constante, trabajador y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural caracterizada por mantenerse como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo se producen. También tienen granjas de pollos e incluso se trabaja en la apicultura. De clima semi-tropical durante todo el año.
Ismael es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por el trabajo. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de comida, viven en una casa de ladrillo a medio construir, con paredes de ladrillo y otras de adobe y cuentan con el servicio de luz y agua de pozo.
Su negocio es el transporte libre como taxi; ya lleva un tiempo realizando esta actividad por lo que es conocido en el lugar, tiene clientes rutinarios, como algunas cocineras del mercado a las cuales transporta diariamente y también clientes casuales que transporta desde el mercado después de haber realizado sus compras cargadas de bolsas. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa. Él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable para su baño, cocina y lavandería; y dejar de usar su pozo, para brindarle a su familia mayor comodidad y mejores condiciones higiénicas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que está construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Ismael solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones higiénicas.
texts.en:
Ismael is a 24-year-old man. He lives with his partner, doesn’t have children, and works as a driver.

He is independent, persevering, hard-working, and very responsible. He works in the area of “Sacaba,” which is a rural area characterized by being the breadbasket for the city, because of its production of cereals, vegetables, and fruits for the urban areas. They produce corn, wheat, barley, green vegetables, strawberries, bananas, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches, and passionfruit. They also have chicken farms and work in bee-keeping. The area has a semi-tropical climate during the whole year. 

Ismael has brown skin, a short stature, and short black hair. His mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in his area, and he speaks Spanish for work. He shares his life with his partner, who sells food. They live in a house made of brick, with walls of brick and others of adobe; they have electricity and well water. 

His business is taxi transportation. He has spent some time doing this, so he is well-known in the area. He has regular clients, including some cooks from the market who he transports daily. He also has casual clients who he transports from the market after they have made their purchases carried in bags. 

His dream is to finish building his house. He wants to have drinkable water for his bathroom, kitchen, and washing room and to stop using his well, to offer his family more comfort and better sanitary conditions. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in three years that he has been building his house.

It is for these reasons that Ismael requests a loan for the connection of drinkable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and washing room to offer his family better sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to connect drinkable water and offer his family better sanitary conditions.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 25-year-old woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines who does business buying and selling used televisions.

Irene has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy used televisions to sell.

Irene has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy used televisions to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a 39-year-old woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines and has had a used clothing business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of used clothing to sell.

Riza successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested this new loan to further build her businesses. Her future goal is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ferminita

texts.en:
Ferminita is 48 years old and has five children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Ferminita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ferminita has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ferminita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 50 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Florencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, canned good, candies, groceries, etc.

Florencia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, canned good, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Susana is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish-making business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Alozius

texts.en:
Alozius is a sixty-nine-year-old hardworking married man with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Alozius is a farmer growing crops and vegetables, such as maize, cabbages, cotton, rice, beans and others, for selling to earn a living. Alozius has a dream of becoming a model farmer in his area and also educating his children to attain a minimum qualification. However, he is faced with challenges of pests and diseases.

Alozius wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lylliam Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lylliam es una microempresaria esforzada por el bienestar de su familia, tiene la edad de 59 años y se dedica a la comercialización de perfumes en el mercado de la municipalidad y en la capital del país, este negocio lo inicio hace doce años y es el décimo noveno ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en variedad de perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, los créditos anteriores la han motivado a seguir solicitando el financiamiento debido a que le han permitido ofrecer variedad de productos
texts.en:
Lylliam is a micro-entrepreneur, making an effort for the wellbeing of her family. She is 59 years old and is dedicated to selling perfumes in the market of the municipality and in the capital of the country. She started this business 12 years ago, and this is the 19th cycle in which ADIM has offered her a loan for her business. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in a variety of perfumes for women, men, and children. The previous loan have motivated her to continue requesting loan because they have allowed her to offer a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and has four children. Jocelyn is married and two of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, and she is 49 years old now.

Lolita has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, and she is 20 years old now.

Sheila has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Sheila requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers to sell.

Sheila has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Sheila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers to sell.

loans.name: Person

texts.en:
Person is a single hardworking male who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, brick laying and also owns a coffee plantation where he gets additional income. He hopes to complete his modern residential house but his limited by poor weather that destroys the bricks he is laying. 

He is therefore requesting for a loan to help him finish building his house by buying iron sheets for roofing.

loans.use: finish building his house by buying iron sheets for roofing.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a Ugandan male living in Kamwenge. He is a hardworking married man and a farmer who gets additional income from goat rearing. Through this he has been able to sustain his family by providing them with basic necessities. He hopes to expand his coffee plantation, however, his main challenge is the unpredictable weather changes, especially prolonged drought and soil exhaustion.

Isaac will use the loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura dedicates herself to raising rabbits and selling their meat. Their manure used to be untreated and Maura piled it up outside the farm, while she was cooking with wood and spending significant amounts of money on LP gas and chemical fertilizer. With her biodigester, she will be able to transform her rabbits' manure into a productive resource, as it will produce biogas connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house, as well as a nutrient-rich, organic fertilizer to apply on her corn field. As she reduces her operating expenses, her farm will become more cost-effective and her health will improve due to the elimination of wood and its toxic smoke from the house. With her savings, she plans to buy more rabbits to expand her meat production capacity, and enlarge the farm.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Stiben Viterbo

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Stiben un joven de 21 años quien vive en unión libre con Paola, una señora muy trabajadora, de este amor han procreado una nena hermosa. Juntos han venido trabajando desde hace un año en la venta de sandalias, ellos recorren a clientela fija, gracias a este negocio han podido salir adelante poco a poco. Con este crédito ellos podrán comprar más mercadería, surtir más en sandalias para brindar más variedad a su clientela. Se sienten muy agradecidos con la institución por abrirles las puertas y darle la oportunidad de recibir un crédito.
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo in the Colorados is a city in the coastal region known in the country for being a very productive and commercial area. Precisely in this area, there is a lot of commercial interchange because it is a land port that connects the maintains with the coast. 

Here, lives Stiben, a young man who is 21 years old and who lives in a common-law marriage with Paola, a very hard-working woman. From this love, they have a beautiful child. Together, they have been working from a year selling sandals. They have a fixed clientele. Thanks to this business, they have been able to go forward little by little. 

With this loan, they will be able to buy more merchandise to supple more sandals to offer more variety to their clients. They are very thankful for the institution for opening doors for them and for giving them the opportunity to receive a loan.

He is thankful to all who make up Fundación Alternativa and especially to Kiva because the loans offered help many people that need to thrive in their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to take care of his family.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis le 06 Décembre 2010, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même village depuis longtemps et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Mariama, âgée de 51 ans (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont 01 garçon et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de vaches pour la revendre aux bouchers dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 3 vaches à raison de 150000 f l’une qu’elle revend à 165000 f aux bouchers.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’une part de payer ses intérêts et d’épargner, d’autres part de participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
There are good relationships between the members of this group created on December 6, 2010. The women have been living in the same village for a long time, and nurture bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Mariama, 51 years of age and standing all the way to the right, is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is married and a mother of two, a boy and a girl. She buys cows that she resells to butchers at the weekly markets. She is expert in this business.

With her new loan, she plans to purchase three cows at 150,000 XOF each, for an individual resale price to butchers of 165,000 XOF.

Profits will allow her on the one hand to repay her loan and to save, and on the other to contribute to the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy three cows, costing 150,000 XOF each, for resale.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 42 year old married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been in fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their source of income. 

Amelita is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, rope, lead weights, hooks and gasoline for the boat. Amelita believes that a loan will help them improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, rope, lead weights, hooks and gasoline for the boat

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 15 Novembre 2006  lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  

Madame Diénaba (debout à l’extrême gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de deux enfants dont 01 fille et 01 garçon. Son activité consiste à vendre des légumes qu’elle achète à Dakar pour les revendre au marché central de Kolda.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 03 sacs de carottes à 7000f l’un pour les  revendre à 200f le kg, 05 sacs de choux  à 8000f l’un pour le revendre à 300f kg et paie un transport de 20000 f de Dakar à Kolda.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales et surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on November 15, 2006, the same day the village finance association was inaugurated. The group gathers women, most of whom have acquired a good amount of experience in retail, their main business.

Mrs. Diénaba (standing all the way to the left) is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is married and a mother of two, one girl and one boy. Her business consists in reselling vegetables purchased in Dakar at Kolda’s central market.

This new loan will allow her to purchase three bags of carrots (7,000 XOF each, retail price 200 XOF per kilo), five bags of cabbage (8,000 XOF each, retail price 300 XOF per kilo), and to pay a 20,000-XOF transportation fee from Dakar to Kolda.

Profits will allow her to actively contribute to the family’s budget, mostly to her children’s school expenses.

loans.use: to buy three bags of carrots, five bags of cabbage, and pay for transportation from Dakar to Kolda.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es: Adelfa: Es una mujer indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, es una mujer amable y luchadora, tiene 52 años de edad, casada, tiene 8 hijos: 6 son mayores de edad y dos adolescentes que cursan su sexto grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja como conductor. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar, desde hace 30 años estableció su tienda de ropa y calzado, en un tramo en el mercado municipal. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua: vestidos para niñas y damas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas y en Masaya calzado. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero y ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Adelfa is an indigenous woman of the Miskita ethnic group. She is a native of Puerto Cabezas, and is kind and persevering. She's 52 years old, married, and has eight children: six are adults, and two are youngsters, sixth graders in primary school. Her husband works as a driver.

Adelfa set up a clothing and shoe shop that she has kept for thirty years in a section of the municipal market. She did it to create her own source of income and help with the household expenses, as well as the education of her school-age children.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing in Managua: ladies' and girls' dresses, pants, blouses and tee shirts, as well as footwear that she will buy in Masaya. 

Her dream is to have  a prosperous business and expand the shop.

loans.use: to buy in Managua: girls' and ladies' dresses, pants, blouses and tee shirts, as well as footwear that she will buy in Masaya.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 64 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child in school.

Juana is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juana has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packs of clothes to bring in customers, improve sales and continue supporting her family.

loans.name: Marie Tedene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 30 mai 2011 et est  composé de femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Marie Tèdène la responsable est une veuve âgée de 65 ans et mère de six enfants dont trois garçons et trois filles non scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits halieutiques et dispose d'une bonne expérience pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis cinq ans. Son nouveau crédit de 450000 lui permettra de se payer de la marchandise pré citée au niveau de son village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent d’épargner dans son compte banc villageois et de satisfaire les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 30, 2011. It is composed of women united by good social and professional relationships.

Mrs. Marie Tedene, the leader, is a 65-year-old widow and mother of six—three boys and three girls who do not attend school. She works in the retail of seafood products, in which she has a good experience of five years. Her new 450,000-XOF loan will allow her to purchase some local merchandise.

Profits allow her to increase savings in her local account and to provide for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy seafood products for retail.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Vizcochoni Group

texts.es:
La socia Estefa pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” en la comunidad de Vizcochoni. 
La comunidad de Vizcochoni está ubicado en el del distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
La socia Estefa tiene 40 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es conviviente, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales menores, la socia continua criando a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros. 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The member Estefa belongs to the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” in the community of Vizcochoni. The community of Vizcochoni is located in the district of Colquepata, which is in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. 

Estefa is 40 years old. She has 5 children, and she is in a common law marriage. The member continues to work in agriculture and raising small animals. The member continues raising her animals to later sell them to customers who want them. She has had this business for quite some time, and she does well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. This is the way that the member moves her family forward. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, among other things.

The members work in agriculture, selling food, selling groceries, raising cattle, making crafts, cattle ranching, raising small animals, and more. The members are thankful for the opportunities that they have been given, and they promise to make their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, among other things.

loans.name: Arlin Del Socorro

texts.es: Arlin es una mujer emprendedora que tiene la edad de 33 años, casada, su negocio es la comercialización de ropa nueva y de segunda en las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace diez años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, es el sexto ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y el crédito actual lo solicita para invertir en camisetas blancas, camisolas, talladores, licras, camisas colegiales, pantalones, etc., los créditos anteriores le han permitido mantener el negocio ya que es el que le permite aportar a los gastos familiares, la socia asegura que aunque existen temporadas bajas las ha sabido superar porque oferta los productos de acuerdo a la temporada, en este caso es el inicio de clase.
texts.en:
Arlin is 33 years old and enterprising. She is married and has a business selling new and second-hand clothing in communities near to her home. She started this business ten years ago with financial support from her husband. This is Arlin’s sixth loan from ADIM for her business. She is applying for it in order to buy blouses, Lycra clothing, trousers, school shirts and other items.

Arlin’s previous loans have allowed her to keep her business going, and to continue helping with household costs. Arlin assures us that, although there are low seasons for trade, she has been able to do well because she sells seasonal clothing. She is currently selling clothes for the start of the new school year.

loans.use: to buy blouses, Lycra clothing, trousers, school shirts and other items.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Milagros is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Christian Alberto

texts.es:
Christian es un señor de 37 años, vive con sus cinco hijos en casa propia, con el apoyo de sus hijos él ha podido superar la separación de su esposa quien lo dejó hace varios años atrás. Comenta que ellos son su fuerza para salir adelante, por ellos trabaja para darles la educación y ya en la tarde comparten su tiempo juntos.
Christian desde muy temprano se levanta a picar  frutas, ya que el vende come y bebe, una bebida llena de frutas ; luego sale a recorrer por avenidas principales de la ciudad, cuenta con clientes fijos ya que es una bebida deliciosa y nutritiva. Los fines de semana el vende en un parque muy conocido de Santo Domingo de los Colorados; gracias a este negocio él ha podido llevar el sustento para su hogar, darles la educación a sus hijos y poder salir adelante.
Hoy Christian acude a Fundación Alternativa para acceder a un crédito con el fin de comprar un mejor coche, más grande y con una mejor carpa; él y su familia están agradecidos con la institución y en especial a proyecto Kiva por hacer posible que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Christian is 37 years old and lives with his five children in a house that he owns. With the support of his children, Christian has gotten over his separation from his wife, who left him some years ago. Christian says that his children give him the strength to move forward. He works for them and to give them an education, and spends time with them in the afternoons.

Christian gets up very early in order to pick fruits, which he sells as food and as a fruit drink. After picking the fruits he heads out to the city’s main avenues. He has regular customers as his drink is delicious and nutritious. At the weekend, Christian sells in a very a well-known park in Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Thanks to this trade, Christian has been able to support his family and household, to give his children an education, and to move forward in life.

Today Christian has come to Fundación Alternativa to apply for a loan in order to buy a better and larger cart and a better awning with a goal to providing his children with a better upbringing. Christian and his family are grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to the Kiva project for making the expansion of his business possible.

loans.use: to buy a better and larger cart and a better tent with a goal to providing his children with a better upbringing.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yesenia es una microempresaria esforzada por el bienestar de su familia, tiene la edad de 40 años y es propietaria de una pulpería, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años por medio de un préstamo a un familiar demostrando que lo que propone se llega a lograr siempre que se sea perseverante, es el cuarto ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con las cuotas de pago, el crédito actual lo invertirá en granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, cajas de jabón, carne de pollo, aceite, papel higiénicos, toallas sanitarias, etc., una de sus metas es mantener su negocio y diversificar los productos ofrecidos.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a microentrepreneur motivated by the well-being of her family. She's 40 years old and the owner of a grocery store. She started this business three years ago through a loan from a family member, demonstrating that her proposals will always be successful as long as she perseveres.

This is the fourth cycle of ADM financing, because she's demonstrated responsibility with payment quotas. She will invest the current loan in staple goods like rice, sugar, soap, chicken, oil, toilet papers, sanitary pads, etc. One of her goals is to maintain her business and diversify the products offered.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of two grownup children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a fish vendor and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Antonia is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market.  Antonia believes that a loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Antonia’s future dream includes the expansion of her fish vending business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Queney

texts.en: Queney is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She owns a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Queney has operated her business for more than five years now. Queney is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Queney hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos y reside con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene como 16 años de cultivar café ya que le genera más ingresos. Esta producción la vende en grano entero en el mercado local. Actualmente esta solicitando su tercer ciclo en la institución y es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y para limpieza de la finca de café. Su fin es mejorar su finca y seguir cultivando más para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Jesús is 40 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. They have two children and lives with his family in a village in the city of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. 

He's always earned a living as a farmer and has been growing coffee for 16 years, as it earns more income. He sells this crop as whole beans at the local market. 

Right now, he's seeking his third loan in the institution, for 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and composts for cleaning his coffee fields. His goal is to improve his fields and continue growing more to earn better profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for cleaning his coffee field.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is a farmer and also deals in selling coffee to earn extra income where he is able to earn a living. He hopes to expand his banana plantation to increase the volume of agricultural output from his garden. His main challenges are the unpredictable weather changes. He is requesting a loan to buy materials to use for mulching his farm.

loans.use: to buy materials to use for mulching his farm.

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento KANTUTAS compuesta por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; Venta de carne,  transporte público, cerrajería, venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
Trinidad es la presidenta de banco (en la foto la que está parada a lado del señor de chompa negra) tiene 58 años de edad, soltera tiene un hijo varón de 12 años y su actividad es la venta de carne.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, paciente, comprometida con su trabajo, y constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona 12 de Octubre de la ciudad, de El Alto,  caracterizada por el comercio informal.
Trinidad es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su hijo viven en la casa de sus familiares construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de carne, sus cortes más vendidos son; bife de chorizo, bola de lomo, colita, corazón de cuadril, Trabajo que realiza en un cuarto de su casa habilitado como carnicería y también como tienda de barrio porque vende refrescos, huevo, verduras, etc. “antes vendía carne en la calle  hasta que hice muchos clientes y decidí alquilar un ambiente  y abrir mi carnicería…” comenta. Ella desea comprar con el crédito carne de cordero y así vender este producto que es solicitado por fin de año para la elaboración de la Picana un plato típico en época de navidad Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Trinidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de  carne de cordero para ofertar más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Kantutas Communal Bank is composed of eight members—six women and two young men. They are engaged in various occupations such as selling meat, public transportation, locksmithing, selling fruit, selling juice, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, and selling vegetables; and they are requesting a loan to expand their businesses.

Trinidad is the president of the bank. In the photo, she is standing next to the man wearing the black sweater.  She is single, she has a 12-year-old son, and her occupation is selling meat.  She is a good mother, responsible and patient, committed to her work, and persevering. She carries on her business in the “12 de Octubre” Zone, in the city of El Alto, which is characterized by informal commerce.

Trinidad is petite, with tan skin and long black hair.  Her mother tongue is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives with her son in her relatives’ house, which is made of brick and has potable water and electricity.

Her business is selling meat, and the cuts that she sells the most are top loin, sirloin tip, rump, and eye of rump.  She works out of a room in her house that is adapted to be a butcher shop, and also as a neighborhood grocery, because she sells soft drinks, eggs, vegetables, etc.  She says, “I used to sell meat in the street until I had many customers, and decided to rent a shop and open my butcher shop”.

She wants to use the loan to purchase lamb to sell, as this product is requested at the end of the year for making Picana, a traditional dish during the Christmas season. 

This is her first loan cycle with Kiva in the 9 years that she has been engaged in this occupation.  These are the reasons that Trinidad is requesting a loan: to purchase carne cordero in order to offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase lamb.

loans.name: El Carmen-74 Group

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 12 años, y su negocio es la tapicería.
Élla es independiente, emprendedora, activa, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de la ‘Mutualista’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas de empresas, universidades e instituciones. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, usa blusa blanca y bermuda beige). Su vida la comparte junto a su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. viven en una casa perteneciente a la familia, construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la tapicería, actividad que aprendió de su familia; élla ejerce el oficio de cubrir con tela, tapiz o cuero asientos domésticos, de automóviles o motocicletas, fijando el material con tachuelas, grapas o cosido. También se dedica mejorar la comodidad de los mismos instalando muelles, espumas o fibras vegetales en su interior. El objetivo principal de sus trabajos es lograr la comodidad y belleza de los asientos que tapiza. Los materiales que mayormente utiliza son; Tijeras, Martillo de tapicero, Grapadora manual o neumática, Compresor, Tiza para marcar telas, Máquina de coser, Pata de cabra pequeña para sacar, grapas y tachuelas, Mazo de goma, Agujas curvas para coser a mano, Aguja larga para poner, botones, Punzón, Alicates, Cinta métrica, Escuadra y otros. “tapizo todo clase de muebles, asientos de automóvil y también puedo realizar cortinas y cualquier confección que se necesite máquina de coser…” comenta. Su sueño es ser el negocio preferido de la zona. Élla desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de telas, tapices y herramientas por mayor, debido a que las telas y tapices se agotan rápido y las herramientas se encuentran en mal estado por el continuo uso. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas, tapices y herramientas para renovar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosemery is a 44-year-old woman.  She lives with her partner and has two children aged 2 and 12.  She is in the upholstery business.

She is independent, entrepreneurial, active, persevering, responsible and a hard-worker.  She carries out her business in the area “Mutualista'” a commercial area located in the center of the city characterized by the grouping together of company offices, universities and institutions.  The climate is warm, tropical and humid, with an approximate temperature of between 21 and 35 degrees Centigrade all day.

Rosemery is a short dark-complexioned woman with long, black, tied-back hair and dark eyes.  Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for business.  She is the second on the left in the photo wearing a white blouse and beige bermudas.

She shares her life with her partner who works in commerce and with her children.  The oldest is in school and the youngest has not yet reached school age.  They live in a house belonging to the family, made of brick with a corrugated-metal roof, that has potable water, electricity and a sewer system.

Her business is upholstery, an occupation that she learned from her family.  She practices the trade of covering with fabric, tapestry or leather the seats of house chairs, automobiles or motorcycles, securing the material with tacks, staples or sewing.  She also works to improve the comfort of the seats by installing springs, foam or vegetable fibers in the interior. 

The main objective of her work is to achieve comfort and beauty in the seats that she upholsters.  The tools that she mostly uses are scissors, upholstery hammer, manual or pneumatic stapling gun, compressor, chalk to mark the fabric, sewing machine, small crowbar to take out staples and tacks, rubber hammer, curved needle for hand-sewing, long needles for putting on buttons, punch, wire-cutters, tape measure, square and other things.

“I upholster all types of furniture and automobile seats and I can also make curtains and whatever creation that needs a sewing machine,” she comments.  Her dream is to be the preferred business in the area.  

She wishes to make an investment in her business by buying fabric, tapestry material and tools wholesale due to the fact that the fabrics and tapestries get used up quickly and the tools are in a bad state due to their continual use. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the ten years that she has been doing this occupation.

It is for these reasons that Rosmery is asking for a loan to buy fabric, tapestry material and tools to renovate her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, tapestry material and tools to renovate her business

loans.name: José Mercedes

texts.es: El señor José es un hombre trabajador que tiene la edad de 57 años y demuestra que a su edad aún mantiene las ganas de seguir superándose para seguir ofreciendo a su familia un nivel de vida acorde a la del país, es propietario de una mueblería donde su principal producción son las sillas abuelitas, cuenta con una experiencia de treinta años en la elaboración de muebles, es el segundo ciclo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio y este crédito lo solicita para la compra de un motor con su mesa, esto le permitirá aumentar la producción y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard-working man who is 57 years old and demonstrates that despite his age, he still has the desire to continue advancing, in order to offer his family a level of life that is in accord with that of his country. He is the proprietor of a furniture producing shop where the principal product is a “granny chair.” Jose has 30 years experience making furniture.

This will be his group's second loan cycle requested by ADIM to finance their businesses. The loan will allow Jose to purchase a motor with its own work table, which will permit Jose to increase production and, consequently, his income.

loans.use: purchase a motor with work table that will permit him to make and offer quality furniture to his customers.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children aged 8, 7 and 5. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years. She also runs a small sari-sari or retail store business. This is the source of their income. 

Dina is asking for a loan to buy gasoline for the boat and additional stock for the store like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Dina hopes to expand her store in order to generate more income. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the boat and additional stock for the store like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy new fishing gear like lead weights, hooks and fishing nets, and materials for repair like plywood, nails and epoxy adhesives. This  loan will enable her and her husband to improve their fishing business, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand their fishing venture in order to generate more revenue. She also wants to save money to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear like lead weights, hooks and fishing nets, and materials for repair like plywood, nails and epoxy adhesives

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is a fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 53 years old and has four grownup children. Florencia has been in the fish vending business for more than 12 years now. As of this time, she is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Florencia believes that a loan will help her improve her business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and other items

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, a 37-year-old married female with four children, lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the motorcycle transport business for five years alongside a brick laying business for extra income. Irene dreams of educating her children and buying a vehicle for hiring out. 

She is a hardworking woman whose greatest desire is having educated children. Her challenges are competition and accidents on the road, plus limited capital. She intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Kervin

texts.en:
Kervin is a 24-year-old man from Ronda, Cebu. He has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income. 

Kervin is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Kervin dreams of expanding his hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Helen is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among others. With a loan, Helen will be able to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Helen dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among others

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol, 49, is a married woman and a mother of seven grownup children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Mirasol has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is their source of income. Mirasol is requesting a loan to buy gasoline for the fishing boat and additional fish to sell. A loan will help her and her husband improve their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the fishing boat and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en:
