Silverio is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and also operates a retail shop to give himself an extra income. He wishes to have a big store of produce, however his main challenge is competition from other traders which limits the profits gained from the business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more produce like beans, maize, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like beans, maize, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Yekonia

texts.en:
Yekonia is a 50-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop alongside produce selling. He was inspired by the need to cater for his family to start up those businesses. He faces a challenge of scarcity of resources to buy more items for the shop, however he hopes to expand his business and have educated children.  

Yekonia is requesting a loan to buy more items like soap, sugar, and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, sugar, and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells fish to earn income to support his family. He also has a banana plantation where he gets supplementary income to buy food for the family. He hopes to construct and have a model home, though he is limited by competition from other traders, bad weather and perishability of fish, which limits his level of sales and profits. 

Godfrey has asked for a loan to paint his house.

loans.use: to paint his house.

loans.name: Acela

texts.es: Acela: Es una mujer indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, es una mujer cordial con espíritu emprendedor, tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos: Tres adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus tres hijos que estudian, desde hace 6 años, estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de bastimentos, verduras, frutas y cereales, en un tramo en el mercado Bruno Gabriel. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos: plátano maduro, verde, filipitas, frijoles, maíz, cacao, chiltoma, coco, repollo, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con construir un local para su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Acela is an indigenous woman of the Miskita ethnic group. She is a native of Puerto Cabezas, and she is a friendly woman with an entrepreneurial spirit. She is 33 years old and married. She has 4 children, 3 teenagers who are in elementary school and middle school and a small 4-year-old son. Her husband works informally as a bricklayer.

With the purpose of having her own source of income to help cover household expenses and support the education of her 3 children who are in school, Acela established a small business 6 years ago, selling general supplies, vegetables, fruits, and grains in a section of the Bruno Gabriel market. She is requesting a loan to buy ripe plantains, green plantains, filipitas (a banana variety), beans, corn, cocoa, sweet peppers, coconut, and cabbage, among other products. She dreams of building a stall for her small business.

loans.use: to buy ripe plantains, green plantains, filipitas (a banana variety), beans, corn, cocoa, sweet peppers, coconut, and cabbage, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and manure for his coffee farm

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Rosa es una mujer laboriosa de 28 años que solicita por primera vez el financiamiento en ADIM para su negocio y así incrementar el capital de trabajo lo que le permitirá aportar más a los gastos familiares, es madre de cuatro hijos quienes han sido su mayor motivación para su superación, propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dos años y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, chiverías, pan, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico, etc., ya que estos son los productos que la población demanda a diario, una de sus metas es pagar las cuotas en el tiempo establecido para gozar de los beneficios pagar en el tiempo establecido las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working 28 year old woman.  She is requesting a loan from ADIM for her business for the first time.  This way she will increase her working capital, which will allow her to contribute more to the family expenses.  She has four children, and they have been her greatest motivation to succeed.

She has had a grocery store for two years.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains like rice, sugar, cooking oil, snacks, bread, sanitary napkins, and toilet paper, etc.  These are the products that the population asks for daily.  One of her goals is to make the payments according to the established time-frame in order to enjoy the benefits of making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy basic grains that will allow her to increase the products that she sells.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old and has five children. Vilma is married and has four children who are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 35-year-old hardworking married woman with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a drug shop for human medicine, and she also earns a salary as additional income in order to earn a living. She has a dream of setting up a pharmacy targeting the demand, since people travel long distances to the hospital. However, she faces a challenge of market competition. Jennifer wants money to pay for labour for roofing and plastering her residential house.

loans.use: to pay for labour for roofing and plastering her residential house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 31 years old and married with one child in school. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, coffee, cigarettes, beverages, groceries, etc.

Emma has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soap powder, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, shampoo, and other groceries. 

In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, coffee, cigarettes, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kereni

texts.en: Kereni is a 49-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a farmer and that is her main source of income, although she also owns a milling machine to earn extra income. She intends to expand her coffee garden into a big plantation, however she is limited by bad weather that affects her level of produce. She needs a loan to hire cheap labor to clear her garden.

loans.use: to hire cheap labor to clear her garden.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a hardworking 55-year-old married man with seven children. He sells veterinary drugs in Kasese, Uganda. He gets additional income from a monthly salary alongside farming. He maintains his dream of becoming a veterinary doctor and expanding his business to new market areas. Josephat needs the loan to buy more drugs and spraying equipment to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs and spraying equipment to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 52 years old now.

Gemma has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Able

texts.en: Able is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He mainly sells bananas. He also supplements his income by selling coffee. He wishes to have a big banana plantation in his area, however his main challenge is unfavorable weather that affects the quality and quantity of output from his garden. Able has asked for a loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a hardworking 44-year-old male who is married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells crude salt and he has been in the salt business for 12 years. He also owns rentals and a transport business to get additional income. He has a dream of educating his children. However, Hamisi has a challenge of limited capital and weather changes. Hamisi wants money to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Letecia is 54 years old now.

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Letecia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ivelene

texts.en:
Ivelene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ivelene is 27 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Ivelene has a food production business in the Philippines. Ivelene requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Ivelene has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imelda is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Imelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, flour, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Imelda has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, flour, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 36 years old and has four children. Marieta is a woman and has three children who are in school.

Marieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marieta has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 50 years old and married with nine children. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like candies, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, biscuits and candies. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like candies, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 51 years old and has seven children.  She is a widow and has two children who are still in school. Josefina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Josefina has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roquena

texts.en:
Roquena is 55 years old and married with five children. Roquena works very hard to provide for them.

Roquena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

Roquena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, vinegar, soy sauce, junk foods, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Roquena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Lisbette

texts.es: La señora Rosa es una mujer emprendedora que tiene la edad de 33 años, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 15 años, quienes han sido su motivación para salir adelante y así brindarles los recursos necesarios como es los alimentos y educación, es el décimo cuarto ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una mujer laboriosa y responsable con las cuotas de pago, cuenta con la ayuda de una trabajadora que es remunerada, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra tintes, máquinas para afeitar, tratamientos para el cabello, cremas corporales, vanidades, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, etc., lo que le permitirá seguir mejorando la calidad del servicio ofrecido, una de sus metas es la compra de un rótulo con luces y así atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is an enterprising woman, age 33.  She is married with two children, ages 10 and 15, who have been her motivation to get ahead in order to give them the resources that they need, such as food and an education. 

This is the fourteenth cycle in which ADIM is providing her with a loan for her business, and she has shown herself to be a hard-working woman who makes her payments responsibly. She has the help of a lady whom she has hired. 

The current loan that she is requesting is to purchase hair color, hair removal devices, hair treatments, body creams, vanity products, lipstick, nail polish, etc., which will allow her to continue improving the quality of the service that she offers.  One of her goals is to purchase a lighted sign, and thus attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase hair color, hair treatments, vanity products, body creams, etc., which will allow her to attract new clients.

loans.name: Brigida Lorena

texts.es: La señora Lorena tiene 22 años, es soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en la parroquia Diez de Agosto, barrio Lindo, en la vía al Triunfo, la zona es considerada cálida-húmeda, se observa mucha vegetación, se dedica a la producción y cultivo de caña de fruta, estos trabajos los realiza sola, ella tuvo la aspiración de ser maestra pero por la situaci´n económica de su familia no pudo continuar sus estudios, ella es una mujer emprendedora, aprendió de su madre la actividad de la caña. además de eso cría pollos y cuando existen eventos en su parroquia ella los utiliza para vender pinchos, ella es el sustento del hogar. Con el crédito que se le otorgó va a comprar abono para el cultivo de caña.
texts.en:
Lorena is 22 years old. She is single, and she has a child. She lives in the Diez de Agosto parish, which is a nice neighborhood located on the road to Triunfo. The area is considered to be warm and humid with lots of vegetation. 

Lorena makes a living producing and cultivating cane fruit. She carries out this work alone. She wished to become a teacher, but she was unable to continue her studies as a result of her family's economic situation. She is an entrepreneurial woman, and she learned how to cultivate cane from her mother. In addition to this work, she raises chickens. When there are events in her parish, she uses them to sell chicken skewers. She is the sole supporter of her household. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her cane fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cane fruit crops so that she can support her family.

loans.name: Jose Ivan

texts.es: José Iván: Es un hombre indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originario de Waspam y se trasladó a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco,  Es un hombre alegre y luchador, tiene 35 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos: El mayor de 10 años de edad, estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y el menor de 6 años estudia su pre-escolar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda que es de tambo y madera, desde hace 16 años no cambia la madera. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, postes de madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad y establecerle a su esposa una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
José Iván is part of the Miskita ethnic group. He is a native of Waspam but moved to Bilwi at the time when the whole population of Río Coco was being evacuated. He is a cheerful, hardworking man of 35. He is married and has two children: the elder is 10 years old and in grade 4 while the younger is six and in pre-school. 

Because José Iván wishes to improve the conditions of his home and have a better, more comfortable place for his family to live in, he is seeking a loan to improve his house. It is a stilt home made of wood, and the wood hasn’t been changed for 16 years. With the loan he wishes to buy construction materials such as wooden planks and posts, zinc sheets, nails, and to hire laborers. 

José Iván’s dream is to own a cement house which is more durable, and to have a small corner store for his wife to run.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as wooden planks and posts, zinc sheets, nails, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Ronald De Jesús

texts.es: Ronal es habitante de un barrio ubicado en Cartagena de Indias en el cual funciona su negocio de Droguería, cuando finalizo sus estudios de técnico en farmacia en el año 2007, decidió ser empresario independiente y con sus conocimientos en esta área logró contactar a proveedores de medicamentos en los diferentes laboratorios de la ciudad, surtir su negocio y empezar a funcionar.  En la actualidad su droguería cuenta con una serie de medicamentos de alta rotación y una serie de productos para la nutrición, cuidado de la piel e higiene personal, que se encuentran a disposición inmediata para sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos o transeúntes del sector y quienes pueden comprar de contado en los horarios de 9 a.m. a 9 p.m.  Ronal está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de medicamentos.  Esta inversión mejorará el stock de medicamentos y la diversidad de los mismos, con el propósito de que el cliente encuentre todos los productos que solicita en las marcas de su preferencia. Ronal tiene 34 años y desea que su negocio sea altamente competitivo para a futuro manejar varias sedes en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ronal lives in a neighborhood located in Cartagena de Indias; his pharmacy business is also located there. When he completed his pharmacy training in 2007, Ronal decided to run his own independent business. Because of his pharmaceutical knowledge he managed to contact providers in the various medical laboratories in the city, bought stock for his pharmacy, and opened his business. Nowadays his pharmacy has products that are in high demand as well as nutrition, skincare, and personal hygiene products. 

For the most part Ronal’s customers are neighbors or passers-by. They buy with cash; the pharmacy is open from 9 am to 9 pm.

Ronal is seeking his first loan with Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He is planning to buy new medications for the pharmacy so he will have a wider range of stock. His customers will be able to find all the products and brands they want.

Ronal is 34 years old and wants his business to be very competitive.  In the future he wishes to have various branches throughout the city.

loans.use: buy new stock for his pharmacy

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 32-year-old hardworking widowed woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for five years. She gets additional income from motorcycle transport and farming. She started the business after the death of her husband, in order to have a source of income to enable her to educate her children. Her business dream is expanding it to new areas, though competition and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her returns. Jane wants to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel and iron bars to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for consumption

loans.name: Nolin Yolanda

texts.es: Nolin, 	tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en un sector del municipio de Cofradía, Cortes. Trabajó por varios años en una maquila y hace 3 años decidió establecer su propio negocio. Vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, harina, huevos, manteca, azúcar, churros, pan, café, sal, refrescos y productos de aseo. Ha invertido dos préstamos anteriores al negocio y actualmente solicita otro para comprar granos básicos, churros, refrescos, pan, huevos y otros con el fin de surtir e incrementar el inventario para ofrecer mejor servicio a la clientela. Su meta a futuro es construir un local aparte mas amplio para el negocio y comprar un vehículo exclusivo para su negocio.
texts.en:
43-year old Nolin lives with her husband and son in a part of the municipality of Cofradiá, Cortes. She worked for several years in a factory, but then three years ago decided to open her own business. She sells staples such as rice, beans, flour, eggs, butter, sugar, doughnuts, bread, coffee, salt, soft drinks and cleaning products. Her previous loans were invested in her business.

Now Nolin is seeking another loan to  so she has more products to offer her customers. Her future goal is to build separate bigger premises and to buy a vehicle to use exclusively for her business.

loans.use: buy stock for her store such as basic grains, doughnuts, soft drinks, bread, eggs etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary, a member of Valley Hope women group. She is 28 years old, married and a mother of one. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She operates a clothes selling enterprise as her main business. She has benefited a lot from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her business profitably. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of clothes to increase her income. This will assist her to cater for the basic family needs such as food and in paying school fees for her child.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to help improve her income.

loans.name: Upendo Tumaini Group

texts.en: In 2014, Upendo Tumaini Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained on financial management, enterprise development and savings mobilization to improve their livelihoods. The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph, who is 47 years old, married and has three children. He does poultry farming to earn a living. He has applied for a loan to buy poultry feed so that he can increase the production. He hopes that this loan will help increase his income, which will help improve his living standard and pay school fees for his children. Group members are happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Women Of Faith Victory Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Women of Faith Victory Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained on financial management, savings and resources mobilization. The group members are mostly involved in farming activities.

The person raising her hand in the photo is Veronicah, who is 39 years old, married and living with her husband and their five children. She operates a mini boutique to earn a living, and also farms potatoes, maize, beans, cabbages and carrots. She has applied for a loan to add more stock to her clothes selling business so that she can supply more, and thus meet her customers' demand. She hopes this will help increase her income, which will improve the living standards, such as providing quality education for her children. 

Veronicah is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the great financial support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for her mini boutique.

loans.name: Yahaira Marina

texts.es: Yahaira Marina: Es una joven originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 25 años de edad, casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de salir adelante y tener una carrera profesional, para brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro solicita su primer financiamiento para pagar aranceles universitarios, titulo entre otros gastos para elaboración de tesis.  Su sueño es ser una profesional exitosa y concluir su carrera en Ciencias Naturales, que cursa en una de las universidades del municipio.
texts.en: Yahaira Marina is a young woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 25 years old and married, and she has a small four-year-old son. In order to get ahead and have a professional degree to provide her family with a better future, she is asking for her first loan to pay university fees for her degree, among other expenses for writing her thesis. Her dream is to be a successful professional and to finish her degree in Natural Sciences, which she is pursuing at one of the universities in the city.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her degree, among other expenses for writing her thesis

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Hermelinda de 30 años de edad es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Prosperidad”  la cual lo conforman 06 mujeres optimistas y solidarias. Hermelinda se dedica al cuidado de niños especiales. Gracias a su constante dedicación y servicio ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.  Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de bisuterías. Solicitó el crédito para acondicionar y ampliar su local. El grupo  “Prosperidad” agradecen a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Hermelinda es la segunda del lado derecho y viste bivirí plomo.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 30 years old, separated and has one dependent child. She belongs to the Alcancia Community group called 'Prosperity' which is made up of six optimistic and supportive women. 

Hermelinda works taking care of special kids. Thanks to her constant dedication and service she has been able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family. Her greatest wish is to set up a trinket shop and she is applying for a loan so she can set up and stock her store.

The 'Prosperity' group thanks Kiva lenders for the help they have given them. Hermelinda is the second on the right and is wearing a grey top.

loans.use: to set up and stock her store

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos quienes están casados, ella vive acompañada de una empleada quien le ayuda en su negocio y  reside en el municipio de Sabá Colón.  Ella tiene su propio negocio  de pulpería desde hace 20 años siendo su única fuente  de ingresos. Vende granos básicos, productos enlatados, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, productos de limpieza, medicamentos etc. Además tiene unas maquinitas de juegos para niños lo que le genera otros ingresos. Su negocio se ha mantenido estable y en crecimiento por la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 12,000 lempiras para comprar arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, y otros abarrotes para surtir y vender. Su plan es seguir trabajando con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 64 years old and is a single mother to three children who are married. She lives with a maid who helps her with her grocery store and resides in the municipality of Sabá Colón.  

Ana has had her own grocery store for 20 years which has been her only source of income. She sells staple grains, canned food, sugar, butter, soft drinks, cleaning products, medication, etc. She also has some arcade games for children which generate earnings. Her business has remained stable while also growing due to the inversion of various loans. 

At the moment Ana is applying for her seventh loan of 12,000 lempiras to buy rice, flour, butter, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries to stock and sell. Her plan is to continue working in her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, butter, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries to stock and sell

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en: Muhamad is a 38-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income alongside livestock rearing. It is from these businesses that he has been able to meet his family's needs. He faces a challenge of climatic changes and lack of capital, however he hopes to become an advanced farmer. He is requesting a loan to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia. Group

texts.es: Vilma de 58 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está conformado por 06 socias responsables y solidarias. Ella se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y fotocopias. Hace más de 10 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio lo cual le va bien. Tiene planeado ampliar su negocio por la mayor demanda de sus clientes. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de cuadernos, fólderes y libros. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Vilma se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
Vilma is 58 years old and is separated with one dependent son. The loan group Sacred Family is made up of 6 responsible and supportive members. Vilma sells school supplies and makes photocopies. She has been developing this business for over ten years, and it is going well for her. She plans to grow the business because she has greater demand from her customers. This most recent loan will be used to purchase notebooks, folders and books.

The Sacred Family Group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they provide. Vilma is pictured standing in the back, she is the first on the left and wearing a white tee shirt.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, folders and books.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 36-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income, although he also practices farming and runs a depot. He has been able to sustain his family and educate his children using the proceeds from those businesses. High transport costs and inadequate capital are his main challenges, however he hopes to have an improved business that can easily be transformed into wholesale. He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en: Muhamad is a 53-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer, and at the same time sells firewood and bananas. In his business, he is faced with a hardship of low capital, which hinders his business growth. Besides that, he hopes to establish himself into a wholesaler and expand his business to new areas. He has asked for a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to  buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 46-year-old married man who used the previous loan to buy more firewood to sell. He is still in the firewood-selling business, and at the same time earns a salary and makes bricks. In his business, he is still facing hardships of low capital and high transportation costs that are still hindering the business. However, he hopes to educate his business to higher levels of learning. Deo has asked for a loan to buy more firewood and logs for selling.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and logs to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James used the previous loan to plant more tea. James has continued with tea farming, and at the same time making bricks, which gives him more income. In his business he is still facing challenges of low capital, unpredictable weather changes and the high cost of sprays, which affect his output. Besides that, James has hopes of having a very good source of income and expanding his business to new areas. James has asked for a loan to buy wood, labor and hire a venue for tea planting.

loans.use: to buy wood, labor and hire a venue for tea planting.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is aged 27 with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He rears poultry and pigs, and at the same time sells bananas in big markets, which has earned him more income. In his business, he faces challenges of weather changes, especially heavy rains which affect chicken by reducing the amount of eggs laid compared to dry seasons, thus resulting in low production. Besides that, Gilbert hopes to buy land to construct a permanent house and expand his poultry project. He has asked for a loan to buy feed for the chicken and pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chicken and pigs.

loans.name: Lesli Celena

texts.es:
Lesli es un señorita de 21 años, es muy amable ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.

Lesli es una señorita que lo que busca cada día es superación en la vida, pues para la generación de sus ingresos económicos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas asimismo trabaja con una su tía en los oficios domésticos; ella lo hace porque necesita comprarse sus cosas personales y además para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa. 
Lesli pretende seguir estudiando, pero para  para poder realizar sus tareas ella necesita una computadora, al igual que sus hermanos, pues para poder realizar la  compra Lesli solicita un prestamo en ADICLA de dos mil quetzales y ella estaría reservando uno de sus ingresos para pagare el prestamo.  

El sueño de Lesli es seguir estudiando en la universidad  y más adelante conseguir un trabajo donde pueda generar más, para luego construir su casa propia. Lesli tiene la certeza de lograr todas estas metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Lesli is a very friendly young woman of 21 who lives with her parents and siblings in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

Lesli is a young woman who tries to improve her life every day. To generate an income she works selling tortillas and at the same time she also works with an auntie as a housekeeper. She does this because she needs to buy her own personal items and also so as to support her parents with the household costs.

Lesli would like to keep studying, but to do her assignments she needs a computer, as do her siblings. To make this purchase Lesli is applying for a loan of two thousand quetzales from ADICLA and she will reserve one stream of income to pay off the loan.

Lesli's dream is to continue studying at university and further down the track get a job where she can generate a higher income to later build her own home. Lesli is certain that she will achieve all of the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
María Antonieta es una señora de 51 años, ella es reconocida por su comunidad por su amabilidad, ella tiene 3 hijos pero ya todos casados, María Antonieta vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Sementabaj. 

María Antonieta ha sido siempre una mujer perseverante, con los  negocios que ha emprendido, ella para la generación de sus ingresos cuenta con dos negocios, tiene una tienda de consumo diario y una venta de ropa típica, doña Antonieta se siente muy afortunada con sus negocios, pues con la amabilidad que atiende logra vender. 
 María Antonieta quiere mantener su tienda siempre equipada y  por esa razón ella busca un prestamo que le servirá para comprar más mercaderías de consumo diario y comprar más cortes fajas y blusas para siempre tenga ropa al alcance de su clientela. Ella tiene la plena certeza   de vender siempre para generar más ingresos y sobre todo ganancias y con ese dinero estaría pagando su prestamo. 
El sueño de María Antonieta es generar más ingresos para poder tener sus ahorros para sobrevivir cuando sea ya más grande y piensa convertir en locales de ventas una parte de su casa para darlo en alquiler.
texts.en:
María Antonieta is a lady, age 51, who is known for her friendliness throughout her community. She has three children, but they are all married now.  María Antonieta lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj.  

She has always been a persevering woman with the businesses that she has undertaken; and in order to generate income, she has two businesses.  She has a store where she sells items for daily consumption and traditional clothing.  Doña Antonieta feels very fortunate with her businesses, as with her friendly service, she is able to make sales. 

María Antonieta wants to maintain her store always stocked, and that is why she is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for daily consumption and more skirts, sashes, and blouses, in order to always have clothing available for her clientele. 

She is certain that she will always make sales in order to generate more income and above all, earnings with which she will be paying off her loan.


María Antonieta's dream is to generate more income so that she can have her savings to survive on when she is older. She is also thinking of converting a part of her house into shops in order to rent them out.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for daily consumption and traditional clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante Group

texts.es:
Cuatro mujeres emprendedoras con el objetivo de incrementar el capital de sus negocios se unieron para formar el grupo solidario “Mujeres Adelante” y solicitar por primera vez en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios. Quien lo coordina es la señora Leticia una mujer trabajadora de 34 años de edad, acompañada y propietaria de un taller de costura, cuenta con una experiencia de cuatro años y el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de tela sincatex, dacron americano, conos de hilos, zipper, etc., una de sus metas planteadas es aumentar la producción.
El resto de las integrantes son, Irelia una joven de 24 años que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa desde hace tres años, Salvadora una señora de 36 años su negocio es la comercialización de ropa y calzado en su comunidad desde hace tres años, y Evelia se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos de la Zermat este negocio lo impulsó hace siete años.
texts.en:
Four enterprising women came together to form the 'Mujeres Adelante' solidarity group with the goal of increasing their businesses' capital. This is the first time that they are applying to ADIM for a loan for their businesses. 

Leticia is the coordinator of the group. She is 34 years old, has a partner and is the the proprietor of a sewing workshop. She has four years of experience and she is applying for this loan to buy sincatex fabric, American Dacron fabric, thread, zips, etc. One of her goals is to increase her production.

The other members are Irelia, a young woman of 24 who has sold clothing for three years; Salvadora, a 36 year old woman who has sold clothing and shoes in her community for three years and Evelia, who has sold Zermat cosmetics for seven years.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zips, etc. to increase their production

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Ma. Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ma. Lina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Ma. Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 60 years old and married with seven children.

Saturnina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, salts, eggs, groceries, etc.

Saturnina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Saturnina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, salts, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 29 years old and married with two children.

Suzette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, biscuits, canned goods, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

Suzette has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Suzette aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, biscuits, canned goods, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Analyn has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rubelyn is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rubelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rubelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Rubelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rubelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to mulch his banana plantation.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 48-year-old single lady with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes and maize, and at the same time has a retail shop that earns her more income. She faces challenges of little capital, which hinders her business growth. However, she has hopes of expanding her business to new areas in order to generate more income. Gladys has asked for a loan to buy tomato herbicides to spray her tomato garden.

loans.use: to buy tomato herbicides to spray her tomato garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tomato garden

loans.name: Carrie

texts.en: Carrie is 29 years old and married with two children. All of her children are in school. Carrie works very hard to provide for them. Carrie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. Carrie has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Carrie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 34 years old and has four children. Marigen is married and has two children who are in school.

Marigen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marigen requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marigen has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marigen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 54 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them. Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like salt, shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc. Leonora has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like salt, shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 37 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them. Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like junk food, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. Leonila has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like junk food, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Editha is 63 years old now. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Editha has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edith works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Edith is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Edith has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Josephine is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Juanita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nexie

texts.en:
Nexie is 35 years old and married with six children, with three children in school, Nexie works very hard to provide for them.

Nexie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk food, groceries, etc..

Nexie has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Nexie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk food, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 47 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom attend school. Brenda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like toothpaste, soap, condiments, groceries, etc. Brenda has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like toothpaste, soap, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 31 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. Angie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Angie has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Angie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aracely se dedica a la venta de perfumes y a la vez tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación en donde también vende un poco de ropa, de estos ingresos ayuda a sus hijos con los gastos de estudios entre otros,  Aracely solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un cuarto en su casa para su hija quien ya es toda una señorita y necesita su propio espacio, es por eso que como madre Aracely se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en: Aracely works selling perfumes, and at the same time she has a small grocery store in her house, from where she sells some clothing. With her income she helps her children with education costs among others. Aracely is requesting a loan to buy building materials to build a room for her daughter, who is already a young lady who needs her own space. This is why, as a mother, Aracely worries about the well being of her family.

loans.use: to build a room for her daughter who needs her own space, and make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Los Intocables _74 Group

texts.es:
Elisa es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 33, 30, 25, 22 y 18 años, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio.
Ella es emprendedora, trabajadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el quinto anillo de la ciudad un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca a mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad. De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Elisa es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la tercera de la izquierda, viste una blusa blanca con rayas negras, cuello negro). Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de mandiles, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de polleras, venta de chamarras para niños, venta de jugos batidos, taller de soldadura y tapizado de autos, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus objetivos.  Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como ayudante de chofer interdepartamental y con su hijo menor que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su actividad principal es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, refrescos, etc., también tiene una congeladora donde guarda carne, su labor la realiza durante toda la semana y durante todo el día. “los helados tipo bolo son los que más se venden…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un mini-mercado en su propio domicilio. Ella desea realizar una ampliación en su tienda comprando mercadería por mayor. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor.
texts.en:
Elisa is a 55 year old woman, married, she has 5 children of 33, 30, 25, 22 and 18 years old. Her business is running a store in the neighborhood. She is enterprising, hardworking, and persevering. Her business is on the fifth ring road of the city in a place where once a year almost a thousand craftspeople meet at the 'La Alasita' fair, where they sell all kinds of goods in miniature with the aim of this miniature being made and becoming reality. It has a tropical, humid climate with a constant climate of around 30 degrees year round.

Elisa has a dark complexion, long black hair, short stature, her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and speaks Spanish with the general population and for her business (third from the left, wearing a white blouse with black stripes and black collar). Her desire to get ahead has brought her to be the leader of a bank of people with businesses like; apron sales, alpaca sweater sales, pollera skirt sales, children's jacket sales, smoothie sales, a welding shop and auto upholstery, to request a loan to reach their objectives. 

She spends her life with her husband who works as interdepartmental driver aide and her youngest son who goes to school. They live in their own home which is made of wood with a corrugated iron roof, it has drinking water, electricity and sewerage. Her main work is a local store which has basic food supplies such as; bread, sugar, rice, pasta, oil, drinks, etc. She also has a freezer where she stores meat. She works the whole week and whole day long. "The bolo ice creams [fruit and yoghurt based ice sticks] are the biggest sellers", she says.

Her dreams is to have a mini-mart in her own home. She wants to expand her store, buying wholesale stock. This is her 7th loan cycle in the 5 years she has been in this business.

It is for these reasons that Elisa is requesting a loan to buy wholesale basic foods.

loans.use: to buy wholesale basic foods.

loans.name: Monette Queen

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Monette Queen works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Monette Queen is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of firewood to sell for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Bebeth

texts.en:
Bebeth is a 32-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a bamboo basket-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials needed for her business like bamboo, etc.

Bebeth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials needed like bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Dixie

texts.en:
Dixie is 23 years old with two children. With one child in school, Dixie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Dixie has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a business fishing shells in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing fish. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials to use in her fishing business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelsón, de 38 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, ya que desde pequeño le toco trabajar duro, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, tienen 2 hijos, los cuales viven todavia con ellos y ya estudian sino que trabajan en el campo con Nelson. 

Nelson, se dedica a la siembra de maiz, maicillo, ajonjoli y otros, además trabaja con ganado de repasto y crianza.- Sus cultivos los tiene a una distancia de 1 kilometro para llegar al cultivo, por lo general trabaja de 7:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m.  

El crédito lo ocupa para comprar insumos agricola para sembrar maíz y para comprar 2 vacas.

Nelson, tiene  muchas esperanzas en el negocio de el ganado, su deseo para el futuro es construir una vivienda digna, ya que vive en lo propio pero la casa es de lámina.
texts.en:
Nelson is 38 years old. He did not go to school as since he was young he has had to work hard. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. They have two children who still live with them and are studying. When they're not studying they work in the field with Nelson.

Nelson grows corn, sorghum, sesame and other plants as well as raising cattle and working with grazing cattle. His crops are 1km away and in general he works from 7am to 1pm. This loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies to sow corn and to buy two cows.   

Nelson has many hopes for his cattle business. His wish for the future is to build a decent house as he already lives in his own home but it is made of tin sheeting.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to sow corn and to buy two cows.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia: Es una mujer trabajadora, amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 40 años de edad, casada con cuatro hijos: Dos son mayores de edad, un adolescente de 15 años de edad que estudia su secundaria y una pequeña de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como buzo. Ella cuenta con una experiencia de 23 años de ser docente de primaria y secundaria. Desde hace más de 5 años habita en una vivienda construida de tambo y madera, su casa se encuentra en mal estado. Está solicitando financiamiento para cambiar la madera de la vivienda. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  establecer una pulpería para contar con una fuente de ingresos adicional y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking and friendly woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 40 years old and married with four children: two adults, one 15 year old teenager at high school and a little one who is four years old. Her husband works casually as a diver. 

Sonia has 23 years of experience as a primary and secondary school teacher. For more than five years she has lived in a wooden stilt house and her house is in bad shape. She is applying for a loan to replace the wood in her house. With this loan she will be able to buy dressed lumber, nails and wooden posts and cover the cost of labour. 

Sonia's dream is to set up a grocery store to have another source of income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to replace the wood in her wooden stilt house

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old and married with three children. With all of her children in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.es:
Rosanna es una joven estudiante de odontologia, ella solicita un prestamo para cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Hola, mi nombre es Roxanna, tengo 22 años, soy dominicana, nací en la Ciudad de Constanza, provincia La Vega, tengo 1 hermana y soy soltera. No tengo trabajo en vista de que mis estudios no me lo permiten, es mi madre quien trabaja como conserje en una escuela y sus ingresos son  muy poco para poder costear los gastos y  mis estudios.   
Estudio  Odontología en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI) La Vega, R.D., quiero desarrollarme en esta carrera porque en verdad me gusta mucho y quiero poder ayudar aquellas personas que realmente lo necesitan, mi familia y a mi comunidad. 
He cursado 5 cuatrimestres y las materias que más  me han gustado son: Biología, Historia e Inglés. Este préstamo para mí es muy necesario porque con él yo puedo cumplir mis metas, ser profesional y ser un cambio más en el mundo. Si no recibiera este préstamo se derrumbarían mis sueños porque sinceramente en la situación que estoy no puedo costear la carrera que quiero por mis propios medios. 
Mi deseo es graduarme con las mejores notas, ayudar a mi familia y  poder sobresalir profesionalmente. Después de  terminar mi carrera quiero trabajar en mi profesión como odontóloga en el sector general para así poder brindarle un servicio a todo el que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Rosanna is a young dental student. She is requesting a loan to cover the cost of her education, this is her story:

Hello, my name is Roxanna, I'm 22 years old, Dominican, I was born in the city of Constanza, La Vega province, I have a sister and I'm single. I don't have a job in view of the fact that my studies don't allow it, my mother works as a school janitor and her income is too little to cover costs and my studies too.

I'm studying dentistry at the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI) in La Vega. I want to study this career because I like it a lot and I want to be able to help people who really need it, my family and my community.

I have studied five quarterly semesters and the subjects I've liked most are: biology, history and English. For me this loan is very necessary because with it I can accomplish my goals, become a professional and be one more change in the world. If I don't get this loan my dreams will crumble because I really can't pay for the degree I want with my own means. 

My desire is to graduate with the best grades, help my family and be able to excel professionally. After finishing my degree I want to work in my profession as a dentist in the general sector to be able to offer services to all those who need them.

loans.use: to pay for her tertiary studies.

loans.name: Gloria Alicia

texts.es: Gloria Alicia tiene 4 años de prestar este servicio para refuerzo y afianzamiento escolar en su barrio. Ella es salvadoreña y tiene 10 años de recidir en Panamá. Tiene dos hijas de seis y un año. Junto a su esposo, quien es panameño, luchan para salir adelante. Es profesora en Educación parvularia, con 10 años de experiencia laboral. Está tramitando la legalización de su pequeña empresa, a la que llama "Aprendo agsl". Se centra en el área educativa, en la orientación, el afianzamiento y formación escolar, pre escolar y primaria. En sus propias palabras comenta: "Yo no tengo acceso a los financiamientos bancarios, pues es poco lo que pido y los bancos no ven atractiva este tipo de inversión. Yo no tengo crédito en la banca nacional, por ser extranjera y por ser actualmente mi actividad parte de la economía informal. El acceso a la EC me permite cumplir este tipo de proyectos que son parte de mi meta personal, profesional y familiar. Me hace sentirme viva profesionalmente. Mi meta a nivel de familia es poder aportar económicamente al hogar; como meta profesional, quiero crecer hasta crear un kínder; este préstamo me ayuda a iniciar las bases de este objetivo.
texts.en: Gloria Alicia has been offering school enrichment and strengthening services in her neighborhood for 4 years. She is Salvadoran and has resided in Panama for 10 years. She has two daughters, aged 6 and one year. With her husband, who is Panamanian, she fights to get ahead. She is a pre-school teacher, with 10 years' work experience. She is in the process of accrediting her small business, which is called "Aprendo Agsl". It is focused on the area of education, orientation, enrichment and academic training for the pre-school and primary levels. In her own words, she says:  "I don't have access to bank loans, because I ask the banks for so little that they don't see this type of investment as attractive. I don't have credit in the national bank, because I am a foreigner and because right now my activity is a part of the informal economy. Access to the communal bank allows me to complete this type of projects, which are a type of my personal, professional and family goals. It makes me feel alive professionally. My goal for my family is to be able to contribute financially to the home. My professional goal is that I want to expand up to kindergarten. This  loan helps me start the basics of this goal."

loans.use: to buy furniture, equipment, and paper items for her school enrichment center.

loans.name: Rougui's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis le 06 Décembre 2010, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même village depuis longtemps et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Rougui, (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Agée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 07 filles et 01 garçon. Elle est vendeuse de tissus qu’elle cherche au Mali.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter des tissus estimés à une valeur de 100000f  et paie un transport d’une valeur de 30 000f pour les revendre avec l’aide de sa fille.

  En plus d’augmenter son épargne, les bénéfices lui permettront de nourrir sa famille
texts.en:
Created on December 6, 2010, there is a good connection between the group members. They have lived in the same village for a long time and have a relationship based on solidarity and mutual aid. Their main activity is small business.

Madame Rougui, (seated all the way at right), is the group’s star borrower. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 8 children (7 girls and 1 boy). She sells fabric that she buys in Mali.

With her new loan, she would like to pay for approximately 100,000 FCFA worth of fabric and 30,000 FCFA worth of transportation costs. She will sell her fabric with the help of her daughter.

In addition to bolstering her savings, her earnings will allow her to feed her family.

loans.use: pay for approximately 100,000 FCFA worth of fabric and 30,000 FCFA worth of transportation costs

loans.name: Grupo Del Lago Group

texts.es:
Lilia Elvira es una señorita de 24 años, ella es muy amable, vive con sus padres y hermanos en  una comunidad de San Antonio Palopo.

Lilia Elvira (la última de derecha izquierda en la fotografía) es una persona  muy  perseverante con sus actividades, pues ella desde hace 6 años viene desempeñando este trabajo, ella para la generación de su economía, se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, Lilia se siente muy orgullosa de su trabajo porque conoce todo el procedimiento, El ingreso que genera Lilia es para apoyar a sus padres en los gastos para que tengan lo esencial para la familia.  

Pues por los años de experiencia  que tiene Elvira  y por la calidad de sus tejidos tiene siempre clientela. Pues para seguir con esta actividad y seguir con las demandas; ella necesita  capital de trabajo para comprar más materia prima, que consiste en diversidad de hilos. Pues Elvira con el afán de ayudar a  otras mujeres de su comunidad ella solicita este prestamo en grupo, aparte de que ella se siente útil a su comunidad asimismo porque para adquirir el prestamo  grupal no  es necesario presentar ninguna garantía porque cada persona es testigo del prestamo 
El sueño de Lilia es conseguir el prestamo, para poder incrementar  y con las ganancias más a futuro puede construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Lilia Elvira is a 24 year old woman. She is very friendly and she lives with her parents and siblings in a community in San Antonio Palopo.

Lilia Elvira (the furthest on the right in the photograph) is a person who is very dedicated to her activities. She has been doing this work for 6 years. To generate her income, she makes traditional clothing. Lilia is very proud of her work because she knows the whole procedure. The income Lilia generates is to help her parents with the expenses they have for the family's necessities.  

Becasue of the experience Elvira has and the quality of her weavings, she always has customers. In order to continue with this activity and continue to meet demand, she needs working capital to buy more raw materials, which consists of a variety of threads. So that she can help other women in her community, Elvira is asking for this loan. She also feels useful in her community because to acquire the group loan she doesn't have to show any type of collateral because each person is a witness for the loan.    

Lilia's dream is to get the loan so that she can grow and with the profits, in the future, be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (thread).

loans.name: Marta Doris

texts.es:
Marta es un ama de casa, cabeza de familia de 50 años de edad, madre de tres hijas, que se dedica a la actividades de la confección a terceros, para ella ha sido muy complicado el tener que mantener a su familia, trabaja en una actividad muy competida y para ajustar en el barrio donde reside esta golpeado por la inseguridad que generan bandas delincuenciales que le cobran una cuota para permitirles trabajar.
Inicio su negocio por necesidad económica aprendiendo empíricamente y con la practica en su casa, ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una maquina fileteadora, maquina plana, maquina recubridora, estas máquinas le permitirán optimizar sus procesos de confección y poder recibir pedidos que signifiquen una buena entrada de dinero.
texts.en: Marta is a housewife and a main breadwinner. She is 50 years old and the mother of three children. She works sewing clothes for third parties. For her, supporting her family has been a very complicated. She works in a very competitive field, and aside from that the neighborhood where she lives is affected by insecurity generated by criminal gangs that charge payments to be able to work. She started her business out of financial necessity, learning on the job  and practicing at home. She wants to ask for a loan to buy a overlock sewing machine, a flat sewing machine and a serger. These machines will allow her to optimize her sewing processes and be able to take orders that will represent good income.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a flat sewing machine, and a serger.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 15 Novembre 2006  lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême gauche) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 09 enfants dont 01 fille et 08 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de divers produits comme l’huile de palme, le miel des balais qu’elle achète à Diaobé pour les revendre à Kolda.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 4 bouteilles de20 litre d’huile de palme en raison de 64000f pour les revendre à 1500 le litre, 02 bouteille de miel à 42000f pour le revendre à 2500f le litre et enfin 300 balais à 15000f pour les revendre à 100f l’un.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales et surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group was created on November 15, 2006 at the same time that the banc villageois was founded. This group brings together women who have solid experience in small business, which is their principal activity.

Madame Fatou (standing all the way at the left) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of 9 children (1 daughter and 8 sons). She sells various items like palm oil and brooms. She buys her supplies in Diaobé and sells them in Kolda.

With this loan, she would like to buy:
+ 4 20-liter bottles of palm oil for 64,000F that she will sell at 1,500F per liter
+ 2 bottles of honey for 42,000 F that she will sell at 2,500F per liter 
+ 300 brooms for 1,500F that she will sell for 100F each.

Her income will allow her to actively participate in the management of her family’s expenses and her children’s schooling.

loans.use: buy 4 20-liter bottles of palm oil, 2 bottles of honey, and 300 brooms.

loans.name: Marilu Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marilú, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es motorista, tienen 1 hijo.

Marilú, inicio a trabajar en una venta de electrodomésticos hace dos años, de ahí se dedicó a cuidar de su hijo, sin embargo, su esposo enfermo tres meses y fue necesario que Marilú trabajará para cubrir los gastos del hogar, así fue que empezó a trabajar en una tortillería, donde hasta el día de hoy, tiene dos años de estar laborando.- Gracias a ese trabajo, han podido salir adelante y su esposo ya está recuperado y ahora, ambos cubren los gastos del hogar.	

El crédito será utilizado para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, así podrán mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

El sueño de Marilú, es que su hijo se prepare académicamente y para eso está dispuesta a esforzarse, para darle la oportunidad de que pueda superarse.
texts.en:
28-year-old Marilú studied up until the ninth grade. Her partner is a driver. They have one child.

Marilú began to work in a household appliances store two years ago and then dedicated herself to caring for her son; however, her husband was sick for three months and Marilú had to work to cover the household expenses, so she began to work in a tortilla factory, which is where she still works. She has worked there for two years. Thanks to this work, they have been able to get ahead in life and her husband is now recovered and they cover the household expenses together.

The loan will be used to make improvements to their home, so they can improve their family’s quality of life.

Marilú’s dream is for her son to get an education. She is ready to exert herself in order to give him the opportunity to better himself.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre de 51 años de edad, proveniente del campo, criado con esas buenas costumbre de trabajar, del amor por la familia, sus creencias religiosas, y un sentido de protección por la familia.
Mediante una solicitud de crédito, ramiro quiere iniciar una vida como independiente, tener su propia empresa, manejar sus tiempos y es por eso que le gustaría iniciar a vender frutas y verduras.
Ramiro quiere realizar este trabajo empujando una carreta por el barrio y sectores cercanos en la cual vendedora, tomates, cebollas, bananos, papas, zanahoria, cilantro, aguacates, plátanos, frijol, yuca, repollo, entro otros.
En Resumen Ramiro quiere solicita un crédito para iniciar su negocio y lo invertirá en la compra de la carreta y surtido anteriormente nombrado. 
Tu apoyo significara una ayuda muy grande en las intenciones de Ramiro de generarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia conformada por su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 51-year-old man. He was raised in the country with the good traditions of hard work, love for family, religious beliefs, and protective instincts towards his family.

By requesting a loan, Ramiro wants to start life as a sole trader in order to have his own business and manage his own time. For this reason, he would like to start selling fruit and vegetables.

Ramiro wants to do this work by pushing a cart through the neighbourhood and surrounding areas, from which he will sell tomatoes, onions, bananas, potatoes, carrots, coriander, avocados, plantains, beans, cassava, cabbage, and other things.

In summary, Ramiro wants to request a loan in order to start his own business and he will invest it in purchasing a cart and the aforementioned stock.

Your support will be a lot of help to Ramiro in creating a better quality of life for his family, which consists of his wife and two children.

loans.use: to buy a cart and some fruit and vegetables for his business

loans.name: Alba Libia

texts.es:
Alba es un mujer de 38 de edad, es madre de 4 hijos de 6, 5, 4, 14, vive con su esposo en una granja donde cría gallinas esta actividad ha sido una salvación y una bendición  pues ha podido brindarle estudio a sus hijos.
Su mayor deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, volver un espacio más agradable, tener más cosas, como un televisor, juegos para sus hijos y muchas otras cosas que una madre se sueña en su hogar, peor lo más importante juntar el dinero para comprar los útiles escolares y los uniformes de sus hijos.
